RT is the first news channel to break the 500 million YouTube views benchmark.

fields.title: 8.9 Japan earthquake biggest in its history, tsunami reaches Russia
fields.description: Follow latest updates at twitter.com and www.facebook.com North-east Japan has been swamped by a major tsunami - and the entire Pacific region is now on alert. It was caused by an 8.9-magnitude earthquake that struck 130 kilometres off the eastern coast - sending a reported 10-metre wall of water inland, causing widespread devastation. 32 people are confirmed dead - but that number's expected to rise. The wave has also reached Russia's Kuril islands to the north, reportedly around a metre high. In Japan, 200 people have reportedly been washed away, with several others missing in Japan's Sendai city. Tokyo's been all-but shut down - with fires and injuries widely reported there. Millions are without electricity. Norita International Airport is also closed. 20 powerful aftershocks have been recorded since the first quake, which was the strongest ever recorded in Japan - and the 6th biggest-ever. An earthquake has now been felt in Hawaii - measuring 4.5 - with tsunami waves expected within a few horus. RT on Facebook: www.facebook.com RT on Twitter: twitter.com

fields.title: Dramatic aerial video: Strong earthquake hits Christchurch, New Zealand
fields.description: New Zealand's Prime Minister has confirmed 65 people have died, following a powerful earthquake in the city of Christchurch. That number's expected to rise significantly. The magnitude 6-point-3 quake struck just after midday, causing busy office buildings to crash down in the bustling city center. Cries for help could be heard from beneath the rubble, during a desperate scramble for survivors. Rescue crews from across New Zealand and Australia are at the disaster site, where a state of emergency has been declared.

fields.title: Fresh footage of huge tsunami waves smashing town in Japan
fields.description: As survivors of the Japanese earthquake and tsunami grappled with the enormity of the devastation, more footage emerged on Sunday showing the moment the tsunami struck Japan's northeast coast. Residents of the port town of Kamaishi in Iwate prefecture watched in horror as the first huge tsunami waves hit, sweeping away cars and buildings. One group managed to scramble to safety on higher ground, where they watched as the water surged towards them. Others were stranded on the roof of a multi-storey building as the water level rose rapidly below. Top videos of Japan earthquake & tsunami 2011 www.youtube.com Subscribe to RT! www.youtube.com Watch RT LIVE on our website rt.com Like us on Facebook www.facebook.com Follow us on Twitter twitter.com Follow us on Google+ plus.google.com RT (Russia Today) is a global news network broadcasting from Moscow and Washington studios. RT is the first news channel to break the 500 million YouTube views benchmark.

fields.title: Japan Dead Zone: Video of search for bodies in Fukushima radiation shadow
fields.description: Japan's government has ordered the operator of the Fukushima nuclear plant to pay some $12000 to each household forced to evacuate because of radiation leaks. It is estimated the compensation bill could end up topping 25 billion. However, the country's leadership has come in for its own criticism, from those still living in shelters a month on from the quake. They say helps been too little, too late. It comes as emergency response crews are finally carrying out intensive searches for tsunami victims near the nuclear plant, delayed over radiation fears. RT on Facebook: www.facebook.com RT on Twitter: twitter.com

fields.title: Indonesia buried in ash after volcano Merapi eruption
fields.description: Twin disasters - a tsunami and a volcano eruption - have hit Indonesia. At least 154 people have been killed in the tsunami, while more than 28 died when Mount Merapi erupted. Thousands were forced to flee and seek refuge in shelters. Scientists had warned that pressure building beneath the volcano's lava dome could trigger one of the most powerful blasts in years.

fields.title: Video of Japan town wiped out by monster quake-tsunami
fields.description: Rescuers on Monday dug through rubble in Rikuzentakata, a port city of over 20-thousand people in Iwate Prefecture, which was virtually wiped out by Friday's earthquake and tsunami. Local media estimates that almost three-quarters of the city was swept away by the tsunami, which surged over an eight-metre (26 feet) high dike. Footage also shows emergency workers searching through the wreckage for survivors in the town of Iwanuma in Miyagi prefecture. Top videos of Japan earthquake & tsunami 2011 www.youtube.com Subscribe to RT! www.youtube.com Watch RT LIVE on our website rt.com Like us on Facebook www.facebook.com Follow us on Twitter twitter.com Follow us on Google+ plus.google.com RT (Russia Today) is a global news network broadcasting from Moscow and Washington studios. RT is the first news channel to break the 500 million YouTube views benchmark.

fields.title: Doctors Without Borders: Haiti Aid Planes refused landings
fields.description: France has accused the US of occupying quake-devastated Haiti, saying Washington is hindering the relief effort with its troops surge. More foreign soldiers and police are being sent to the Island-nation, where looting and violence are on the rise, as people are still desperate for vital supplies - a week after the disaster. The French minister in charge of humanitarian relief, Alain Joyandet, has asked the UN to clarify America's role in Haiti. He says after US troops took charge of the main airport, they've been turning away aircraft carrying aid, in favour of military planes. French President Nicolas Sarkozy's office tried to play down reports of the rift with the US, saying cooperation between the two countries was going well. But the charity Doctors without Borders backed Joyandet's call to the UN, adding that aid delays threaten lives.

fields.title: Tears and Pain in Haiti: Video from tent hospital
fields.description: It's believed the Haiti earthquake may claim as many as 200000 lives - and leave 3 million homeless. There's also a growing fear of violence as desperation increases for vital supplies. Teams from all around the world continue searching for survivors, while others try to get aid through.

fields.title: Putin chases gray whale, shoots darts from crossbow for research
fields.description: Russian Prime Minister Vladimir Putin has taken part in a wildlife experiment, helping biologists get skin samples from an endangered gray whale. Putin, who is currently visiting the Far Eastern region of Kamchatka, joined the team of marine biologists at the Kronotsky Nature Preserve, where the nearly-extinct mammals have recently been observed. Despite the poor weather conditions and the rough water, a motor boat carrying the wetsuit-clad team went to sea in search of gray whales. After a group of whales was detected, the Prime Minister shot a sample-taking dart at one of the animals with a crossbow. "We tried to work with three or four whales, but we only got one," Putin told the press after setting foot on the shore. "I had a rush: three times I missed, but the fourth time I hit it."

fields.title: Video of mad tsunami waves battering ships, homes, cars after Japan earthquake
fields.description: North-east Japan has been swamped by a major tsunami - and the entire Pacific region is now on alert. There's a major search and rescue operation underway in Japan. 300 hundred military planes and 40 ships have joined the mission to survey the damage. It's the north east of Japan which has been worst hit by the massive tsunami caused by the biggest in nearly a century and a half. At the centre the city of Sendai, where the worst is feared for hundreds perhaps thousands of people. The official figure of dead is currently 95 and rising. And thr threat from the monster waves goes all around the Pacific basin with strong aftershocks still being felt. Alerts have been put in place as far away as California all the way to Alaska. Top videos of Japan earthquake & tsunami 2011 www.youtube.com Subscribe to RT! www.youtube.com Watch RT LIVE on our website rt.com Like us on Facebook www.facebook.com Follow us on Twitter twitter.com Follow us on Google+ plus.google.com RT (Russia Today) is a global news network broadcasting from Moscow and Washington studios. RT is the first news channel to break the 500 million YouTube views benchmark.

fields.title: Merapi Eruption: Travel chaos as volcano spews massive clouds of ash
fields.description: Jakarta International Airport officials said on Wednesday that concerns about the ash from an Indonesian volcano had forced several airlines to again cancel flights into and out of the capital. Among them were Cathay Pacific, Value Air, Qantas and Malaysia Air. The volcano also forced US President Barack Obama to cut short his visit to the country. Mount Merapi, hundreds of kilometres east of Jakarta, has been spewing massive clouds of ash and gas high into the air for more than two weeks, killing at least 153 people and causing travel chaos and at times forcing two nearby airports to shut down. RT on Facebook: www.facebook.com RT on Twitter: twitter.com

fields.title: Dramatic footage of TV newsroom violently shaken by 7.4 quake in Japan
fields.description: Dramatic footage as Miyagi TV (MMT) newsroom is violently shaken by the 7.4 magnitude aftershock, shelves fall, staff react - power cuts off for about 20 seconds, comes back on to reveal extensive damage to office. Japan was rattled by a magnitude-7.4 aftershock on Thursday night nearly a month after a devastating earthquake and tsunami flattened the northeastern coast. The strongest aftershock since the day of the magnitude-9.0 megaquake was a fresh blow to victims of that March 11 quake and subsequent tsunami that killed some 25000 people, tore apart hundreds of thousands of homes and has sparked an ongoing crisis at a nuclear power plant. Damage and injuries from the aftershock were not immediately clear. RT on Facebook: www.facebook.com RT on Twitter: twitter.com

fields.title: Ghost Island: Apocalyptic scenes in tsunami worst-hit Japan areas
fields.description: Follow latest updates at twitter.com and www.facebook.com The National Police Agency has released new figures on the victims of the quake and tsunami. The data says 3373 are dead, 6746 missing and 1897 injured in 12 prefectures. Many unidentified bodies have been detected in quake-hit coastal areas, and will inevitably raise the death toll.

fields.title: Video of flood stricken Vietnam and Thailand
fields.description: At least 9 people have died as a result of flooding in Thailand that began last week. The government's Disaster Prevention and Mitigation Department said Wednesday that in addition to fatalities, the flooding has affected nearly 4000 villages in 19 provinces in eastern, central and northeastern parts of the country. Residents of the flood stricken region were seen on top of the roofs receiving aid packages from the Red Cross workers. Up to 120 centimetres of rain pounded the central region over the past week, submerging 200000 houses and forcing 142000 people to flee, according to the national floods and storms control committee. Central Vietnam also suffered severe flooding earlier this month that killed 66 people.

fields.title: Video of 'tsunami dog' rescued in Japan after 3 weeks at sea
fields.description: A dog which was rescued at sea off the coast of Kesennuma, Japan, on Friday after being found drifting on a roof is believed to have survived for three weeks after being washed away by the killer tsunami triggered by the March 11 earthquake. Coast guard members aboard a helicopter involved in the day's search for those still missing after the disaster found the dog on the roof drifting along some 1.8 kilometres off Kesennuma, Miyagi Prefecture. It took several hours to catch the dog and bring him to the safety of a coastguard vessel. The dog's collar has no clues about the owner such as address and contact numbers. RT on Facebook: www.facebook.com RT on Twitter: twitter.com

fields.title: Radiation level rising at Fukushima nuclear plant in quake-hit Japan
fields.description: Follow latest updates at twitter.com and www.facebook.com Experts are warning that radiation levels are rising at the Fukushima nuclear plant and there's a high risk of a leak if the situation isn't resolved in the next few hours. Dr. Robert Jacobs, who's a Professor of nuclear history and culture at the Hiroshima Peace Institute, says nuclear power stations are programmed to shut down during major earthquakes..

fields.title: Russian doctors and rescuers to help quake-hit China
fields.description: Russian doctors and emergency workers are due to arrive in China's Sichuan province, which has been hit by the country's deadliest earthquake in more than two decades. Russia's Emergency Ministry is also sending a mobile hospital and specialist rescue teams with heavy equipment and dogs.

fields.title: Pakistan flood death toll over 800, state of emergency declared
fields.description: At least 800 people have been killed in Pakistan over the last three days during floods triggered by monsoon rains. Thousands were left stranded as emergency services struggled to reach remote villages. Nearly 400 thousand have been displaced so far and the provincial government has declared a state of emergency. The torrential rains are expected to continue over the weekend.

fields.title: Biggest blast yet at Mt. Merapi, volcano death toll up to 122
fields.description: A least 78 people have been killed in the latest blast from Indonesia's volatile Mount Merapi - its most powerful eruption in a century. It takes the death toll to 122 since the volcano became active again last week after lying dormant for four years. Residents are being treated for burns and respiratory problems. 75000 people have been evacuated from central Java. RT on Facebook: www.facebook.com RT on Twitter: twitter.com

fields.title: Latest close-up shots of Fukushima, video of Japan tsunami hitting plant
fields.description: Japan has upgraded the severity rating at the paralyzed Fukushima nuclear plant to seven, a level only ever previously assigned to the Chernobyl disaster. Officials say it's been raised, because high radiation has been recorded in the air, ocean and tap water. But Japan's nuclear safety agency is still reluctant to compare the dangers to what happened at Chernobyl, saying the radiation leak is still smaller. RT on Facebook: www.facebook.com RT on Twitter: twitter.com

fields.title: Tsunami Climbing: Incredible video of ship heading into wave in Japan
fields.description: The Japanese coast guard released a video on Saturday showing the massive tsunami waves swelling in the sea off the coast of northern Japan, after the 9.0-magnitude earthquake struck offshore on March 11. The footage showed the first huge wave rising up above the prow of the coastguard ship as it sailed straight towards it. Two more waves followed. Video courtesy: JAPAN COAST GUARD Top videos of Japan earthquake & tsunami 2011 www.youtube.com Subscribe to RT! www.youtube.com Watch RT LIVE on our website rt.com Like us on Facebook www.facebook.com Follow us on Twitter twitter.com Follow us on Google+ plus.google.com RT (Russia Today) is a global news network broadcasting from Moscow and Washington studios. RT is the first news channel to break the 500 million YouTube views benchmark.

fields.title: Biggest eruption of Mount Merapi sends volcano ash cloud miles high
fields.description: A strong earthquake has hit eastern Indonesia after a volcano in the seismically active country had its biggest eruption yet. The US Geological Survey said Wednesday's quake had a preliminary magnitude of 6.1. No damage or injuries were immediately reported and no tsunami warning was issued. Indonesia is evacuating more people from near Mount Merapi after the volcano had its biggest eruption yet. The explosive eruption Wednesday afternoon lasted more than an hour and shot searing ashes kilometers (miles) into the sky. The massive blast endangered places that had not been not evacuated as well as refugee camps within that distance. RT on Facebook: www.facebook.com RT on Twitter: twitter.com

fields.title: Deadly & Destructive: More video of quake-hit Italy
fields.description: A strong earthquake shook northern Italy early on Sunday, killing at least four people, toppling buildings and sending residents running into the streets, emergency services and news reports said. The magnitude-6.0 temblor struck at 4:04 am (2:04 GMT) on Sunday between Modena and Mantova, about 35 kilometers (22 miles) north-northwest of Bologna at a relatively shallow depth of 5 kilometers (3.2 miles), the US Geological Survey said. It was one of the strongest quakes to shake the region. Subscribe to RT! www.youtube.com Watch RT LIVE on our website rt.com Like us on Facebook www.facebook.com Follow us on Twitter twitter.com Follow us on Google+ plus.google.com RT (Russia Today) is a global news network broadcasting from Moscow and Washington studios. RT is the first news channel to break the 500 million YouTube views benchmark.

fields.title: Video of devastated Japan, quake damage, cities swamped by tsunami
fields.description: Follow latest updates at twitter.com and www.facebook.com The death toll in Japan's earthquake and tsunami is likely to exceed 10000 in one state alone, an official said on Sunday, as millions of survivors were left without drinking water, electricity and proper food along the pulverised northeastern coast.

fields.title: Aerial video of ravaged regions worst hit by Japan quake-tsunami
fields.description: Follow latest updates at twitter.com and www.facebook.com Vast areas in Japan have been left unrecognisable by the devastation caused by Friday's quake and tsunami. The coastline of Miyagi prefecture was one of the worst-hit regions. Police estimated 10-thousand dead among the 2.3 million people who lived in the prefecture, the Japanese equivalent of a state. On Monday, millions of people spent a fourth night with little food, water or heating in near-freezing temperatures as they dealt with the loss of homes and loved ones.

fields.title: Volcano coughs, turns air into ash in Indonesia
fields.description: Indonesia's military forced villagers off the slopes of the country's most volatile volcano on Saturday as it unleashed a new powerful explosion that claimed another victim and temporarily shut down an airport. Some 36 people have now died near Mount Merapi since it first erupted last on Tuesday. Plumes of heavy gray ash poured from the crater's mouth as rocks and debris cascaded down its slopes. Saturday's powerful 21-minute eruption briefly forced the closure of the airport in the nearby city of Yogyakarta, 20 km south of the volcano. At least one school was also closed due to the quantity of ash which has fallen on the city. 47000 people who live around Mount Merapi are staying in government camps or with friends and relatives. The latest rumblings of Merapi come as rescuers cope with a rising death toll from a tsunami in another part of the sprawling archipelago nation. The catastrophes struck within 24 hours in different parts of the seismically active country, severely testing Indonesia's emergency response network. RT on Facebook: www.facebook.com RT on Twitter: twitter.com

fields.title: Video of Chile aftermath, quake witnesses, Hawaii tsunami siren alerts
fields.description: Follow RT at twitter.com and at www.facebook.com The massive earthquake that struck central Chile has now claimed at least a hundred-and-twenty-two lives. Dozens of buildings collapsed and parts of the country are without power, after the deadly 8.8-magnitude quake. Santiago airport is closed, and Chile's president has declared a 'state of catastrophe'. Tsunami warnings have also been issued for the Pacific rim - sirens are being heard in Hawaii to warn of impending tidal waves, while Samoa has evacuated its coast.

fields.title: Ron Paul on Haiti quake: American people will donate billions
fields.description: Many thousands are feared dead in Haiti after the country's worst earthquake in two centuries, devastated the capital. The International Red Cross says up to three million people may be affected, and need emergency aid. Congressman Ron Paul shares with RT his view on what should be done to help the Island nation to deal with this tragedy.

fields.title: Russian Aid teams arrive in Haiti, save survivors from rubble
fields.description: Russian Emergency Ministry planes are being considered for use by other states to help in the desperate aid mission to Haiti. Rescue workers who've arrived from Russia have already saved survivors from the rubble. Specialist teams with dogs, along with doctors and other experts have flown from Moscow to the devastated country. Psychologists are assisting families that have lost or are searching for their loved ones. A mobile hospital is working to combat the threat of disease in the aftermath. But rescue efforts are being hampered too by criminal dangers - making it difficult to operate on the ground.

fields.title: Video of tsunami waves smashing cars after Japan earthquake
fields.description: A large tsunami is sweeping through north-eastern Japan, following an earthquake thought to have been 8.9 on the Richter Scale. The first wave has also reached Russia's Kuril islands to the north, reportedly around a meter high. 11-thousand people are being evacuated from the area. In northern Japan, water is surging inland in Seday, some 350km north of Tokyo. There's considerable damage and many casualties - although numbers can't be confirmed because communications are badly-affected. Several people are missing. The lower floors of buildings on Honshu island are being flooded and cars overturned. A bridge has also collapsed. Tokyo's Norita International Airport has also closed. The quake's epicenter was located 130 kilometers off Japan's Pacific coast. A tsunami warning's now in place across the entire Pacific region. Top videos of Japan earthquake & tsunami 2011 www.youtube.com Subscribe to RT! www.youtube.com Watch RT LIVE on our website rt.com Like us on Facebook www.facebook.com Follow us on Twitter twitter.com Follow us on Google+ plus.google.com RT (Russia Today) is a global news network broadcasting from Moscow and Washington studios. RT is the first news channel to break the 500 million YouTube views benchmark.

fields.title: Scorched Land: 25 killed as raging fires destroy homes, forests
fields.description: Forest fires have killed at least 25 people and left two thousands homeless in central Russia as a heatwave grips much of the country. The situation has escalated following weeks of record breaking temperatures. More than a thousand homes have been destroyed and over 600 hectares of forest have caught fire across the country. Strong winds have been fanning the flames, with villages, summer camps and hospitals being evacuated. A total of two hundred thousand fire fighters are involved in operations with more people and machinery being brought to the region.

fields.title: Strong 8.9 earthquake rocks Japan, tsunami hits North East
fields.description: A large tsunami is sweeping through north-eastern Japan, following an earthquake thought to have been 8.9 on the Richter Scale. The first wave has also reached Russia's Kuril islands to the north, reportedly around a metre high. 11-thousand people are being evacuated from the area. In northern Japan, water is surging inland in Sed-ay, some 350km north of Tokyo. There's considerable damage and many casualties - although numbers can't be confirmed because communications are badly-affected. Several people are missing. The lower floors of buildings on Honshu island are being flooded and cars overturned. A bridge has also collapsed. Tokyo's Norita International Airport has also closed. The quake's epicenter was located 130 kilometres off Japan's Pacific coast. A tsunami warning's now in place across the entire Pacific region. Top videos of Japan earthquake & tsunami 2011 www.youtube.com Subscribe to RT! www.youtube.com Watch RT LIVE on our website rt.com Like us on Facebook www.facebook.com Follow us on Twitter twitter.com Follow us on Google+ plus.google.com RT (Russia Today) is a global news network broadcasting from Moscow and Washington studios. RT is the first news channel to break the 500 million YouTube views benchmark.

fields.title: First video: Moment of Indonesia earthquake, Aceh locals flee amid tsunami warning
fields.description: Follow latest updates on twitter.com and www.facebook.com Indonesia's Geophysical Agency says a fresh aftershock of 8.2 magnitude has hit off the Sumatra province of Aceh following an earlier 8.6 magnitude quake. A new tsunami warning has been issued. Indonesia's disaster mitigation agency is sending a rescue team to Aceh, after the quake knocked out the province's electricity and sent locals scrambling for higher ground, Reuters says.

fields.title: Video of relief effort, refugees in Pakistan as floods affect 12 million people
fields.description: A red alert has been declared in Pakistan as floodwaters sweep from the north of the country into the south. Mass evacuations of villages on the banks of rising rivers have begun. Officials say 12 million people have been affected by the worst monsoon rains in decades, with about 1600 dead. Rescuers are still trying to reach densely populated regions left without food or drinking water. Forecasters predict more heavy rains.

fields.title: New blast at Mount Merapi as Indonesia's deadly volcano erupts again
fields.description: Indonesia's deadly volcano erupted again on Thursday, pitting out towering clouds of hot gas and debris in a powerful early morning explosion as disaster officials say the death toll has climbed to 44. According to officials, Mount Merapi had been spewing ash and clouds up to 6.5 km (4 miles) high. The pre-dawn eruption followed a much more powerful blast on Wednesday night that chased people from villages and emergency shelters along its scorched slopes. RT on Facebook: www.facebook.com RT on Twitter: twitter.com

fields.title: Video of fighter jets in mud after tsunami hits Japan Air Force base
fields.description: Follow latest updates at twitter.com and www.facebook.com Workers were clearing up at an air force base in Miyagi prefecture on Sunday, after a devastating tsunami coursed through it, smashing up fighter jets and covering buildings and equipment in thick in layers of mud. The magnitude-8.9 offshore quake triggered a 23-foot (seven-metre) tsunami and was followed for hours by more than 50 aftershocks, many of them more than magnitude 6.0.

fields.title: Video of new powerful Merapi volcano eruption in Indonesia
fields.description: Indonesia's deadly volcano has unleashed another powerful eruption, although there were no immediate reports of new casualties. Mount Merapi, one of the world's most active volcanoes, has killed at least 38 people since eruptions began a week ago. Indonesia is situated in an area nicknamed the Pacific "Ring of Fire'' which is prone to earthquakes and volcanic activity.

fields.title: First minutes after Haiti quake caught on camera
fields.description: A Brazilian soldier stationed in Port-Au-Prince with the United Nations peacekeeping units in Haiti, captured the chaos and panic that followed the earthquake on Tuesday. Soldier Luis Diego Morais was escorting Brazilian Nobel Peace Prize nominee Zilda Arns, who was speaking inside the Sacre Coeur church, when it collapsed. Using his camera phone, Morais captured the aftermath of the earthquake.

fields.title: Over 1000 killed in deadly Pakistan floods, thousands stranded
fields.description: In Pakistan, the death toll from the worst flooding the country's seen in over eighty years has reached more than 1100. Officials say that figure could rise as there are areas rescue workers have not yet been able to reach. Flooded roads and damaged bridges are hampering rescue efforts. Some 27000 are still stranded in remote villages.

fields.title: Video of Haiti storm tearing tents apart as homeless flee
fields.description: Heavy rain and wind in Haiti swept away dozens of tents in a camp outside the capital Port-au-Prince which houses thousands of homeless Haitians. Angry residents were forced to seek shelter elsewhere. The humber of people in relief tent camps has nearly doubled to 1.6 million, instead of shrinking. This comes as former US President Bill Clinton visited Haiti to mark the six month anniversary of January's earthquake which killed as many as 300000 people and left over a million homeless.

fields.title: Latest super close-up footage of Fukushima wrecked nuclear reactor
fields.description: Japanese officials are planning to pump out contaminated water from the stricken reactors at the Fukushima nuclear plant. Authorities hope the measure will help resume efforts to restore the facility's cooling system. It's unclear when the operation will start, as radiation levels around the site are continuing to rise. The latest tests show it's now ten thousand times the legal limit in groundwater near the plant.

fields.title: Japan earthquake: CCTV video of tsunami wave hitting Sendai airport
fields.description: The government has confirmed 23 deaths, with the number expected to rise. It follows the 8.9-magnitude earthquake which sent a 4-metre wall of water inland across the Miyagi prefecture . There's considerable destruction - 200 people have been washed away. Buildings, cars and ships were also swept by the raging waters. Several are missing on Japan's Sendai island. The first wave has also reached Russia's Kuril islands to the north, reportedly around a metre high. There are several fires along Japan's eastern coastline, and 4 million homes are without power. The Prime Minister's ordered an emergency response team to tackle the disaster - with aircraft scrambled to the worst-affected area. Communication is crippled and Tokyo's Norita International Airport has been closed. The entire Pacific region is on tsunami alert - with Hawaii braced to be hit within the next few hours. Top videos of Japan earthquake & tsunami 2011 www.youtube.com Subscribe to RT! www.youtube.com Watch RT LIVE on our website rt.com Like us on Facebook www.facebook.com Follow us on Twitter twitter.com Follow us on Google+ plus.google.com RT (Russia Today) is a global news network broadcasting from Moscow and Washington studios. RT is the first news channel to break the 500 million YouTube views benchmark.

fields.title: Ruins, rubble all that left of Japanese town wiped out by quake-tsunami
fields.description: Follow latest updates at twitter.com and www.facebook.com Chinese state broadcaster CCTV showed the extent of the destruction in Japanese coastal town of Ofunato, mostly destroyed in Friday's earthquake-triggered tsunami. Ruins, rubble and ships are among what was left of the town following the tsunami that ravaged the area last week. The death toll from last week's earthquake and tsunami jumped on Tuesday as police confirmed the number killed had topped 2400, though that grim news was overshadowed by a deepening nuclear crisis.

fields.title: Shooting Ash: Video of powerful volcano eruption in Indonesia
fields.description: An Indonesian volcano that was quiet for 4 centuries shot a new, powerful burst of hot ash more than 3 kilometres (10-thousand feet) into the air, sending frightened residents fleeing to safety for the 2nd time this week. The tremor from the eruption - the strongest so far - could be felt 8 km (5 miles) away. The eruption of Mount Sinabung on Sunday and Monday - which caught many scientists off guard - forced 30-thousand people living along its fertile slopes in North Sumatra province to evacuate to cramped emergency shelters in nearby towns.

fields.title: Can Imperialism save Haiti? CrossTalk debates
fields.description: Could the aid to Haiti have been better administered? Peter Lavelle and his Crosstalk guests - William R. Hawkins from American Business & Industry Council Education and US filmmaker Danny Schechter are debating the issue.

fields.title: 'Flying Japanese': US destroys tsunami 'ghost ship' with cannon fire
fields.description: Courtesy: US Coast Guard The US Coast Guard has opened fire to sink the Japanese "ghost ship" cast adrift by last year's massive tsunami, which was approaching the shores of Alaska. The deserted ship, which was more than 60 meters long, posed a significant risk to marine traffic as it drifted through shipping lanes and at some point might have interfered with other ships. RT on Twitter twitter.com RT on Facebook www.facebook.com

fields.title: Japan Reactor: Video of new explosion at Fukushima nuclear plant
fields.description: Follow latest updates at twitter.com and www.facebook.com The situation at the Fukushima nuclear plant in Japan worsens as a second explosion is reported, intensifying fears of the possibility of nuclear meltdown triggered by last week's huge earthquake. At least seven are missing with several others hurt after the blast - which is not however believed to have pierced the structure containing the reactor's core.

fields.title: Aerial video shows immediate aftermath of 14m tsunami at Fukushima
fields.description: Follow latest updates at twitter.com and www.facebook.com Recently released helicopter video showed immediate aftermath of tsunami at Fukushima. Tokyo Electric Power Company says its nuclear power plants in Fukushima, built on grounds 10 to 13 meters above sea level, were hit by a 14-meter-high tsunami. The company had only expected a tsunami of 5.7 meters at the Daiichi plant and one of 5.2 meters at the Daini. The wave disabled emergency power generators and heat removal pumps at Fukushima Daiichi on 11 March. The loss of these systems left units 1, 2 and 3 in severe trouble that has only stabilised after the write-off of the reactors, which are now being cooled by seawater injection.

fields.title: Scary! Massive waves on huge road bridge send Volgograd drivers asphalt surfing
fields.description: Motorists using a bridge in the southern Russian city of Volgograd were given the ride of a lifetime by a powerful gust of wind. The new river crossing started shaking violently and a massive downpour at the same time made conditions worse. Drivers say their cars were literally thrown into the air, many thinking it was an unexpected earthquake. The shaking was so severe it caused vehicles to career into the opposite lane creating chaos. Local authorities claim the shaking of the bridge was possibly caused by an earthquake. Seismologists, however, say this is highly unlikely. Meanwhile, Russian president Dmitry Medvedev has ordered an investigation into the bridge's safety and construction history. The bridge across Volga river is 1260 meters long and 32 meters wide. It was opened less than a year ago in October 2009.

fields.title: Video of blast at Fukushima nuke plant, radiation leak reported
fields.description: Follow latest updates at twitter.com and www.facebook.com An explosion at a Japanese nuclear power station tore down the walls of one building on Saturday as smoke poured out and Japanese officials said they feared the reactor could melt down following the failure of its cooling system in Friday's powerful earthquake and tsunami.

fields.title: Chavez: US weapon test caused Haiti earthquake
fields.description: Venezuelan leader Hugo Chavez has once again accused the United States of playing God. But this time it's Haiti's disastrous earthquake that he thinks the US was behind. Spanish newspaper ABC quotes Chavez as saying that the US navy launched a weapon capable of inducing a powerful earthquake off the shore of Haiti. He adds that this time it was only a drill and the final target is ... destroying and taking over Iran.

fields.title: 5.7 Magnitude quake hits Venezuela
fields.description: Another earthquake has struck - this time in Venezuela, which is also in the Caribbean region. The tremor's been confirmed by the US Geological Survey. It's been measured at 5.6 on the Richter scale, making it a medium-strength earthquake. There have been no reports of any damage or casualties so far. Experts say the new earthquake could be an aftershock of the one which devastated Haiti on Tuesday - which was force seven in magnitude.

fields.title: Amateur video of Japan tsunami ravaging through port full of ships
fields.description: The overwhelming majority of the dead as a result of the earthquake in Japan became victims of tsunamis. For instance according to the authorities of the Miyagi prefecture, the hardest hit by the tsunami, the wave of 20 metres high in some places tolled the lives of over 96 percent of the total number of the dead. Meanwhile, the number of victims of the April 11 quake topped 13800 people. According to official data on Sunday, the number of the dead in 12 stricken Japanese prefectures totalled 13802 people and missing 14129. More than 4928 people were wounded. People died mostly in the prefectures of Miyagi, Fukushima and Iwate. The search work continues, including inside the evacuation zone around the stricken Fukushima-1 nuclear plant where, according to rescuers, several thousand bodies may remain. RT on Facebook: www.facebook.com RT on Twitter: twitter.com

fields.title: Video, images of Giant Sinkhole in Guatemala City
fields.description: A three-storey building has collapsed and fell into a huge sink hole in Guatemala City. The giant 200ft-deep crater appeared after Guatemala was hit by tropical storm Agatha, bringing torrential rains and causing deadly mudslides. Witnesses claim at least one man was inside the house when it was swallowed by a big hole, and several others remain missing.

fields.title: New strong 7.4 earthquake rocks Japan, tsunami alert issued
fields.description: Follow latest updates at twitter.com and www.facebook.com A powerful 7.4-magnitude earthquake has struck off the coast of Japan, triggering a new tsunami warning. Residents of the North-East of the country have been ordered to evacuate to higher ground - the region is still in tatters following the deadly tsunami of last month. Early reports warn of a wave up to 2 meters high. Japanese authorities say the workers trying to bring the stricken Fukushima nuclear plant under control, have been evacuated.

fields.title: Exiled dictator 'Baby Doc' Duvalier returns to Haiti
fields.description: The former dictator of Haiti, Jean-Claude Duvalier, also known as 'Baby Doc', has returned to the country 26 years after he was overthrown. He greeted crowds of supporters, but did not say why he chose to return or what he would do. Duvalier inherited power from his father at 19 and presided over one of the darkest chapters in Haitian history. He is accused of torturing and killing political opponents, ruling in an atmosphere of fear and repression ensured by his feared secret police force. RT on Facebook: www.facebook.com RT on Twitter: twitter.com

fields.title: Giant tsunami wave eats boat as earthquake hits Japan
fields.description: North-east Japan has been swamped by a major tsunami - and the entire Pacific region is now on alert. It was caused by an 8.9-magnitude earthquake that struck 130 kilometres off the eastern coast - sending a reported 10-metre wall of water inland, causing widespread devastation. 61 people are confirmed dead - but that number's expected to rise. The wave has also reached Russia's Kuril islands to the north, reportedly around a metre high. In Japan, 200 people have reportedly been washed away, with several others missing in Japan's Sendai city. Tokyo's been all-but shut down - with fires and injuries widely reported there. Millions are without electricity. Norita International Airport is also closed. 20 powerful aftershocks have been recorded since the first quake, which was the strongest ever recorded in Japan - and the 6th biggest-ever. An earthquake has now been felt in Hawaii - measuring 4.5 - with tsunami waves expected within a few hours. Top videos of Japan earthquake & tsunami 2011 www.youtube.com Subscribe to RT! www.youtube.com Watch RT LIVE on our website rt.com Like us on Facebook www.facebook.com Follow us on Twitter twitter.com Follow us on Google+ plus.google.com RT (Russia Today) is a global news network broadcasting from Moscow and Washington studios. RT is the first news channel to break the 500 million YouTube views benchmark.

fields.title: Tsunami shaken: Japan's PM resigns over Fukushima
fields.description: Japan's Prime Minister has formally announced his resignation, paving the way for the country's sixth leader in 5 years. His move follows nationwide criticism of his response to the devastating earthquake and tsunami that took place in March, and triggered a nuclear crisis at the Fukushima plant. The twin natural disasters claimed the lives of more than 15000 people, with survivors complaining about slow recovery efforts. A new leader of the ruling Democratic Party, who'll most likely become Japan's next Prime Minister, will be chosen on Monday. RT on Twitter: twitter.com RT on Facebook: www.facebook.com

fields.title: Record-high radiation at Fukushima since quake & tsunami struck
fields.description: Japan's energy operator TEPCO has detected the highest level of radiation at the Fukushima nuclear facility since the March earthquake and Tsunami hit the plant. The reading, taken between the first and second reactor buildings, registered at levels considered fatal to human health. The company and government say they remain on target to bring the reactors to a safe state of cold shutdown by January. Tens of thousands of people remain in temporary shelter after a no-go zone around the complex was enforced. RT on Twitter: twitter.com RT on Facebook: www.facebook.com

fields.title: Satellite stills show large scale of Haiti quake disaster
fields.description: (Stills are courtesy of DigitalGlobe www.digitalglobe.com) The Haitian Red Cross predicts an horrific death toll of around 50000 while the World Health Organization predicts the sheer numbers of dead may lead to an outbreak of disease. Satellite pictures showed a devastated capital city with collapsed buildings and internally displaced people on the streets.

fields.title: France accuses US of 'occupying' Haiti
fields.description: France has accused the US of occupying stricken Haiti, saying its military surge is hindering the relief effort. The French minister in charge of humanitarian aid has asked the UN to clarify America's role in the country. He says after assuming charge of Haiti's main airport, they've been turning away emergency supplies in favor of military planes. The charity Doctors without Borders backed his call to the UN, saying lives were being put at risk. US commanders insist they agreed to give priority to aid shipments last night after UN intervention.

fields.title: 7.1 earthquake in Japan month after deadly tsunami ravages country
fields.description: And the latest from Japan, where a magnitude-7.1 aftershock has hit the northeast of the country. Pictures from a local television, showed the moment the quake hit. It comes exactly a month since the devastating quake and tsunami, which killed more than 13 thousand and left over one hundred thousand homeless. Sombre ceremonies and a minute's silence were observed around the country. RT on Facebook: www.facebook.com RT on Twitter: twitter.com

fields.title: New CCTV video of quake hitting Haiti
fields.description: The images of the moment when earthquake struck Haiti were caught on a CCTV camera at a bakery in the Delmas district in the capital Port-Au-Prince. They show customers fleeing in panic, some cars swaying outside the bakery, and a building across the street collapsing.

fields.title: Tsunami in Indonesia kills over 100 as earthquake triggers waves
fields.description: A quake-triggered tsunami on Monday has left more than a hundred people dead. Scores are missing and houses have been destroyed with hundreds seeking refuge in shelters. Around 20 people have been injured by hot ash and rocks as a volcano has begun to erupt in Indonesia. Scientists had warned that pressure building beneath Merapi's lava dome could trigger one of the most powerful blasts in years. Indonesia sees frequent earthquakes and volcanic activity.

fields.title: Cholera kills 142 & threatens thousands more in Haiti
fields.description: A cholera outbreak has killed at least 142 people in rural central Haiti and left more than one-thousand people infected. Health workers say that laboratory tests confirmed the illness. Aid groups are rushing in medicine to combat the county's deadliest health problem since its devastating earthquake. Many people still live in unsanitary conditions after January's massive quake which killed some 300-thousand people.

fields.title: Pakistan devastated after worst floods in history
fields.description: The massive floods which are raging through north-western Pakistan have now killed at least one-thousand-one-hundred people. Emergency workers are struggling to save thousands of others who're still trapped. The situation's being made worse by water-borne disease, with some of those in rescue camps suffering with fever and skin problems. The UN estimates that about one-and-a-half million people are affected by the country's worst monsoon rains in memory.

fields.title: Japan's top nuclear man resigns over Fukushima
fields.description: A senior nuclear advisor to the Japanese Prime Minister is resigning, alleging the government ignored his safety advice. Toshiso Kosako says the wrong radiation limits were set for schools near the crippled Fukushima nuclear plant, endangering the lives of children. The Japanese government denies the claims, insisting it followed expert advice. The plant has been releasing radioactivity since being hit by a earthquake and tsunami in March. RT on Facebook: www.facebook.com RT on Twitter: twitter.com

fields.title: In water up to chest: Brazil hit by worst floods in decades
fields.description: Severe floods in Brazil have killed at least 35 people and forced over 35-thousand to abandon their homes since late December. Heavy rains have been battering the country for weeks and a state of emergency has been declared in some 60 towns. A powerful storm in the state of Sao Paolo left hundreds of houses submerged in muddy water. It's the worst flooding in 28 years and more rain is forecast in the region in the coming days. RT on Facebook: www.facebook.com RT on Twitter: twitter.com

fields.title: Chile earthquake caught on CCTV as death toll rises
fields.description: Follow RT at twitter.com and at www.facebook.com Security footage has been released showing the moments when the 8.8-magnitude earthquake struck central Chile. It is now confirmed that at least 147 people have died. Many buildings have collapsed and several areas are without power. A 'state of catastrophe' has been declared after what was the most destructive quake in fifty years. Countries in the Pacific Rim are on tsunami alert - warning sirens are sounding in Hawaii, while Samoa has evacuated its coast.

fields.title: Hip Hop Pres: Wyclef Jean wants Haiti's top job
fields.description: Hip Hop star Wyclef Jean has formally entered the presidential election in Haiti. The former Fugees star, who was born on the island, has previously been its roving ambassador. He's also been actively involved in reconstruction efforts since the earthquake that devastated the Carribean nation earlier this year. The star has huge support at home, where half the population is under 21. Elections are set for November.

fields.title: Volcano Eruption: Indonesia village residents ignore warnings
fields.description: More than six-thousand Indonesian villagers have returned to their homes on the slopes of the Mount Sinabung volcano. That's despite warnings that they're putting their lives at risk, after a surprise eruption at the weekend, which forced nearly 30-thousand residents to be evacuted to safety. The volcano had been dormant for 400 years, and officials admit they were not monitoring its behaviour.

fields.title: 7.8 earthquake strikes Sumatra in Indonesia
fields.description: Follow RT at twitter.com and at www.facebook.com A powerful earthquake has struck the Indonesian island of Sumatra. Locals were evacuated to higher ground amid fears of a tsunami, although the alert has now been lifted. Three aftershocks rattled the north of Sumatra, but there were no reports of casualties. The 7.8-magnitude quake is the second major one to hit the island in six months.

fields.title: Strong aftershock hits Chile as president sworn in
fields.description: A large aftershock has rocked Chile just moments before the inauguration of the country's new president. The 7.2-magnitude tremour was stronger than the quake that destroyed the Haitian capital in January. Scientists have warned that more aftershocks are likely to happen.

fields.title: Ian Bremmer: Japan's rebuilding "extraordinary"
fields.description: July 7 - Ian Bremmer of Eurasia Group praises Japan's rebuilding efforts following the earthquake and tsunami earlier this year, but says that Japan's government has returned to it's dysfunctional "business as usual." Bremmer also discusses the future of Greece, the EU and the IMF.

fields.title: Droughts, floods may permanently plague US midwest: author
fields.description: July 18 - A severe water shortage is gripping 14 states -- from Florida to Arizona -- and author of "The Ripple Effect" Alex Prud'Homme sees more droughts and flooding wreaking havoc in the US over the next few years.

fields.title: Moody's on impact of quake on Japan
fields.description: Moody's looks at the impact of Japan's tragic earthquake on its fiscal position

fields.title: US West Coast expecting major quake following Japan disaster
fields.description: Apr 14 - Japan's devastating earthquake has raised concerns among geoscientists that the West Coast of the United States is likely to be next. From southern California to Alaska, the coastline shares its geography with the San Andreas fault and the Cascadia subduction zone, both of which scientists say, are primed for a major quake. Rob Muir reports.

fields.title: Renault operations chief on sorting Japanese supply squeeze
fields.description: July 28 - Renault's chief operating officer talks about how the group can offset persistently high raw material costs and deal with supply disruptions from the Japanese tsunami which hit its bottom line in H1.

fields.title: US: Pakistan must do more on relief
fields.description: US Secretary of State Clinton calls on Pakistan to do more on flood relief. Deborah Lutterbeck reports

fields.title: Inside the News: Investors dip into risk assets
fields.description: Aug. 15 - Investors dip back into risky assets as last week's volatility eases and data shows that Japan's economy was not damaged by the earthquake and tsunami as much as feared.

fields.title: Nissan CEO Ghosn sees "significantly higher" full-year sales
fields.description: June 22 - Carlos Ghosn upgrades his 2011 sales forecasts after Nissan restores Japanese production faster than expected after the March earthquake.

fields.title: Nissan CEO Ghosn Sees "Significantly Higher" Full-Year Sales
fields.description: Carlos Ghosn upgrades his 2011 sales forecasts after Nissan restores Japanese production faster than expected after the March earthquake.

fields.title: Haiti, one month after quake
fields.description: Friday marks one month since the January 12 earthquake shattered Haiti's capital Port-au-Prince, killing 212000 people.

fields.title: Little built in Haiti's ashes
fields.description: As Haiti's one-year earthquake anniversary approaches, many wonder why the pace of rebuilding seems slow. Deborah Lutterbeck reports

fields.title: Newsmaker event preview: Rebuilding Japan
fields.description: Reuters Tokyo bureau chief Nathan Layne's preview to Reuters Newsmaker event with Renault-Nissan CEO Carlos Ghosn on June 22. Ghosn will give his view on the challenges ahead for Japan's car makers after the devastating earthquake, the tsunami and the radiation crisis.

fields.title: Tsunami survivors try to conceive again
fields.description: Women who lost their children in the Boxing Day tsunami undergo reverse sterilisation to try and conceive.

fields.title: Nissan's electric LEAF hits the road
fields.description: The first UK customers for Nissan's new electric model collected their vehicles from showrooms amid talk about potential further disruptions to the supply chain in the wake of Japan's earthquake and tsunami.

fields.title: Tsunami aid helps survivors.
fields.description: Living standards improve for some in Sri Lanka, as a result of tsunami aid flowing into the country.

fields.title: Texting $10 million relief to Haiti
fields.description: Using mobile phones to donate money, texters have contributed more than $10 million in the first days after an earthquake rocked Haiti.

fields.title: Another rescue amid Haiti despair
fields.description: Rescuers continue to search for survivors as plans are made to get the country back on its feet.

fields.title: Japan : Too much greens, too little fish
fields.description: Japanese shy away from buying all vegetables, but fish supplies in danger of running low with fishing industry in the north decimated by tsunami and radiation contamination.

fields.title: Royal Wedding knocks UK growth
fields.description: July 26 - Britain's economy only grew by 0.2% in the second quarter partly due to the Royal Wedding and Japanese tsunami, raising pressure on the government to boost growth as it tries to cut the budget deficit. Joanna Patridge reports.

fields.title: Flying robots, the builders of tomorrow
fields.description: Dec. 2 - A team of scientists has demonstrated that a coordinated group of pre-programmed, autonomous robots can do the job of building workers, constructing a six meter high tower without any human intervention. Architects say this new technology paves the way for new methods of engineering buildings of the future. Georgina Cooper reports.

fields.title: Japan quake cost seen twice Kobe
fields.description: Toshiro Muto, a former BOJ deputy governor, expects disaster costs from the earthquake and tsunami at least twice as high as the 1995 Kobe quake.

fields.title: X Japan make their mark
fields.description: June 29 - One of the most successful bands in Japanese history sets its sights on the rest of the world. Doug Maclaurin reports.

fields.title: Japanese inventor buoyed by demand for tsunami rescue pod
fields.description: Oct. 7 - While Japan continues to recover from the March 11 earthquake and tsunami, one entrepreneur is thinking about how to survive the next one. His invention? A yellow rescue pod he calls a must-have for every home. Andrew Schmertz reports.

fields.title: Praying for Haiti a year after quake
fields.description: As the first anniversary of the devastating quake approaches, victims look for ways to find healing.

fields.title: Tsunami survivor "Baby 81," five years on.
fields.description: The family of the tsunami survivor known as "Baby 81" say fame got in the way of financial aid in tsunami aftermath.

fields.title: Millions risk hunger in Horn of Africa
fields.description: July 5 - More than ten million people face drought and starvation in the Horn of Africa region as aid agencies appeal for emergency aid to provide for children at risk. Nick Rowlands reports.

fields.title: Urgent need for Pakistan flood aid
fields.description: The Pakistani government is faced with the enormous task of distributing aid to millions of people affected by floods.

fields.title: Flooded Pakistan lacks clean water
fields.description: A lack of clean drinking water for Pakistan's flood victims leads aid agencies to fear a deadly outbreak of water-borne diseases.

fields.title: Despair over Pakistan flood losses
fields.description: People accustomed to hardship face up to the devastating impact of the floods, and begin to wonder if their government cares about them.

fields.title: Indonesia leads huge tsunami drill
fields.description: 18 countries participate in Indian Ocean drill in the regions devastated by the 2004 tsunami.

fields.title: Thousands flee crisis in Somalia
fields.description: July 28 - The worst drought in 60 years swells refugee numbers on the Kenya-Somali border. Lily Grimes reports.

fields.title: US Day Ahead: Third-quarter GDP better than expected-poll
fields.description: Oct. 26 - Reuters Correspondent Jason Lange says GDP growth for this quarter could just be a rebound from the high oil prices and Japanese earthquake from earlier this year.

fields.title: Huge aid drive for Haiti at UN
fields.description: Donors meet at the United Nations for massive Haiti aid drive for reconstruction. The earthquake-devastated country is expected to ask the world for $4 billion to rebuild.

fields.title: Famine risk in Africa
fields.description: July 27 - Famine risk worsens in Horn of African with a 30 percent increase in Kenyans needing food and thousands facing starvation in the Somali capital. Marie-Claire Fennessy reports

fields.title: Somali famine refugees moved to new camp
fields.description: Aug. 8 - The UN has begun relocating refugees fleeing famine and conflict in Somalia from the unsecure outskirts of Dadaab camp into a new extension to help cope with overcrowding. Nick Rowlands reports.

fields.title: Pakistan: aid trickles, self-help swells
fields.description: Shipments of foreign aid arrive in disaster-stricken Pakistan as communities laud the relief efforts of their own.

fields.title: Kenyan herders suffer as drought worsens
fields.description: July 8 - Pastoralist communities in north-eastern Kenya face starvation as drought continues to engulf the horn of Africa region. Nick Rowlands reports.

fields.title: Pakistanis return home after floods
fields.description: Many Pakistani flood victims make the journey home to water-logged homes, with some lashing out against absent military and government assistance.

fields.title: Artist paints earthquake devastation
fields.description: A 35-year-old Haitian artist who lost his home in the quake carves out a niche for himself painting the scenes of Port-au-Prince's devastation.

fields.title: Life after conflict in Aceh
fields.description: Former Indonesian rebels and tsunami survivors in Aceh put decades of conflict and loss behind in an effort to rebuild their community and economy.

fields.title: Indonesia looks to tsunami tourism
fields.description: Vessels beached by the tsunami attract tourists in Indonesia's Banda Aceh.

fields.title: Haiti government ends rescues
fields.description: Haiti's government has halted search and rescue operations as hope of finding people alive after the massive earthquake 11 days ago dwindles.

fields.title: More aid needed to save Somalis
fields.description: Aug 12. - United Nations food and agriculture agency officials say more aid is needed to keep Somalis from dying of starvation. Lindsey Parietti reports

fields.title: Pakistan floods kill scores
fields.description: Monsoon rains in southern Pakistan kill at least 132 people and displace hundreds of thousands of people. Travis Brecher reports.

fields.title: Haiti focuses on health and housing
fields.description: Relief efforts in Haiti have started to focus on health care and housing as hopes of finding more survivors dwindle nearly two weeks after the earthquake.

fields.title: Japan can fund quake budget-EcoMin
fields.description: Japanese Economics Ministers Kaoru Yosano tells Reuters that Tokyo should have no trouble financing addition disaster relief spending.

fields.title: Tsunami survivors come home
fields.description: Residents return to tsunami ravaged areas of Japan to salvage belongings as many fear their communities will become ghost towns. Deborah Lutterbeck reports.

fields.title: Ben Stiller's new role as philanthropist
fields.description: Sept. 20 - Stiller hosts an art auction to raise money for Haiti earthquake victims. Alicia Powell reports.

fields.title: Disease a growing risk in Pakistan
fields.description: Pakistan's flood survivors are falling victim to water-borne diseases, with doctors fearing they may soon face an epidemic.

fields.title: Tales of survival in devastated Japan
fields.description: Residents of quake and tsunami-ravaged Miyako city recount their escape from the surging waters.

fields.title: Haiti: brother and sister rescued
fields.description: Rescue teams have pulled more people alive from the rubble of Haiti's earthquake but medics in Port au Prince are warning that the task of treating the injured is proving immense.

fields.title: Tsunami destroys Japan fortress town
fields.description: A huge sea wall fails to prevent the March 11 tsunami from sweeping away a Japanese fishing town.

fields.title: Prayers for Japan
fields.description: The Pope calls on the faithful to pray for the victims of Japan's earthquake as citizens of Germany and Russia offer condolences. Deborah Lutterbeck reports

fields.title: Haiti UN office collapses in quake
fields.description: Workers struggle overnight to rescue trapped UN staffers after building collapses.

fields.title: Crime plagues the homeless in Haiti
fields.description: Some six months after a quake struck Haiti many of the homeless now face the threat of violence. Deborah Lutterbeck reports.

fields.title: Pakistan braces for rainy season
fields.description: July 30 - One year after the worst floods in the country's history, the devastation is still evident and Pakistan remains unprepared for the rainy season. Lindsey Parietti reports.

fields.title: Haiti quake devastates capital
fields.description: Thousands are feared dead after a magnitude 7.0 earthquake that buried some residents and toppled buildings.

fields.title: Haiti quake devastates capital
fields.description: Thousands are feared dead after a magnitude 7.0 earthquake that buried some residents and toppled buildings.

fields.title: Students honoured amid quake heartache
fields.description: At a kindergarten in tsunami-destroyed Kesennuma, a class graduates with one student missing.

fields.title: Flooded Pakistan faces a hard winter
fields.description: Victims of Pakistan's devestating floods face a difficult winter with few supplies in relief camps.

fields.title: Sparse aid reaches hard hit Leogane
fields.description: Aid reaches the Haitian town of Leogane, west of Port-au-Prince and considered to be the epicenter of last week's earthquake.

fields.title: Pakistan floods spark disease risk
fields.description: One week into the disastrous downpours hitting Southern Pakistan, victims now face the threat of cholera.

fields.title: Moving day in Haiti.
fields.description: Haiti's government and foreign aid agencies started to move thousands of earthquake survivors to higher ground. Deborah Lutterbeck reports.

fields.title: Family members still missing after tsunami
fields.description: Five years after the Indian Ocean tsunami, Thai relatives of victims are still searching for the remains of family members.

fields.title: Poaching crisis forces private game parks to de-horn rhinos
fields.description: Sept. 28 - Veterinarians in a South African private game park are de-horning rhinos in a bid to discourage poachers from slaughtering the animals. Rhino horn is highly sought after and poaching has reached crisis levels in recent years reducing rhino populations in Africa and Asia. Stuart McDill reports.

fields.title: Entrepreneurs in Haitian tent cities
fields.description: One month after the devastating earthquake -- tent cities in Haiti have become something of an incubator for entrepreneurs. Deborah Lutterbeck reports.

fields.title: Japan marks disasters six months on
fields.description: Sept. 11 - Anti-nuclear protests and memorials mark six-month anniversary of Japan's earthquake and tsunami. Lindsey Parietti reports.

fields.title: Haitians still struggle two weeks on
fields.description: Haitians try to resume normal routines within tent cities two weeks after the devastating earthquake. Many still not getting aid, while others continue the gruesome job of cleaning debris.

fields.title: Debating reconstruction in Haiti
fields.description: As the rainy season approaches, calls for reconstruction grow lowder, but some experts warn Haiti isn't ready to rebuild.

fields.title: Japan's quake brought back to life on giant globe
fields.description: Aug. 1 - Visitors to a Tokyo museum can now see the March 11 tsunami that devastated northern Japan as though they were watching it from outer space. Tara Cleary reports.

fields.title: Ethiopia attempts to insulate against drought
fields.description: Nov. 23 - As the worst drought in decades ravishes the Horn of Africa, Ethiopia is taking steps to avoid repeating the devastating famine of the 1980s. Deborah Gembara reports.

fields.title: Ceremony marks Haiti quake
fields.description: Former US President Bill Clinton and Haitian President Rene Preval attend a ceremony marking six months since devastating earthquake.

fields.title: Noodles for comfort in quake-damaged Japan
fields.description: A Japanese noodle chef travels more than 700 miles to feed quake victims. Deborah Lutterbeck reports.

fields.title: Preval marks quake anniversary
fields.description: Haiti's Preval marks the one month anniversary of a devastating quake, addressing the nation and later meeting with a US delegation. Deborah Lutterbeck reports.

fields.title: Pakistan flood victims blame govt.
fields.description: Criticism of Pakistan's government is growing after President Asif Ali Zadari left the country while epic floods were threatening over 3 million people.

fields.title: More US troops reach Haiti
fields.description: Thousands more US troops have arived in Haiti as earthquake aid and rescue teams try to reach areas outside Port-au-Prince which have had little or no help so far.

fields.title: Donkeys deliver aid in Pakistan
fields.description: Donkeys and mules are being used to bring aid to mountain villagers devastated by Pakistan's worst floods in decades.

fields.title: Pakistan flood victims seek shelter
fields.description: Hundreds of survivors left homeless by Pakistan's floods camp on a motorway, as President Zardari continues visit to Paris, London.

fields.title: Pakistan PM tours flooding
fields.description: Pakistan's prime minister has viewed the damage wrought by flooding which has killed more than 400 people, and forced thousands to flee their homes.

fields.title: Ray of hope for Haiti's amputees
fields.description: A Haitian hospital brings relief to hundreds of earthquake victims, fitting them with prosthetic limbs, giving them a new lease on life.

fields.title: Getting by week after Sumatra quake
fields.description: Rescue efforts are all but abandoned as Indonesia focuses on cleaning up the debris from an earthquake that struck 7 days ago.

fields.title: Gaga's message of support to Japan
fields.description: June 27 - Lady Gaga tells quake and tsunami-hit Japanese fans "never give up on the dream of Japan". Doug MacLaurin reports.

fields.title: Volunteers run Haitian tent clinic
fields.description: Despite the hard ground, limited medical supplies and bevy of flies, volunteer Haitian doctors and nurses living in tent camps put in long days attending to fellow residents under the most basic conditions.

fields.title: Pakistan flood victims find shelter
fields.description: With nowhere else to go, thousands of flood victims flock to relief camps operated by Pakistan's army.

fields.title: Global supplies impacted by Japan
fields.description: Telco, auto and tech companies warn of supply problems following Japan's devastating earthquake.

fields.title: Malaria fears grow in Haiti
fields.description: Doctors working on the ground in earthquake ravaged Haiti say they are seeing a significant increase in the number of cases of malaria.

fields.title: Baby brings hope to tsunami survivors
fields.description: The birth of a child eases the pain of an Indian family struggling to rebuild their lives after losing four of their five children in the Indian Ocean tsunami.

fields.title: Haiti's poorest struggling
fields.description: Haiti's government says it is confident that 60 percent of the aid is getting through to the people who survived the devastating earthquake. But people living in the deprived slum area of Cite du Soleil, north of Port-au-Prince, say they have received no

fields.title: Japanese town struggles to rebuild
fields.description: Sept 9 - Six months after Japan's deadly earthquake and tsunami, one coastal town continues the struggle to rebuild. Sunita Rappai reports.

fields.title: Pakistan floods force evacuations
fields.description: As floods continue to ravage wide areas of Pakistan, villagers are having to be evactuated from their homes- some forcibly.

fields.title: Drought displaces Somalis
fields.description: June 30 - Aid agencies are concern with displaced Somalis due to drought after already facing one of the worst humanitarian crisis in the ongoing conflict. Sophia Soo reports.

fields.title: Pakistan's flood-affected beg
fields.description: Pakistanis displaced by the country's worst-ever flooding move to a train station in Karachi, begging commuters for food.

fields.title: Pope calls for aid for Haiti
fields.description: Pope Benedict appeals for an international aid effort for Haiti as cholera continues to spread through the earthquake-stricken population.

fields.title: Pakistan cleans up after floods
fields.description: As Pakistan toils to patch up damaged bridges and roads, survivors plead for the reconstruction of their houses.

fields.title: Haiti: human cost of quake
fields.description: Survivors desperately search for loved ones as the wait for basics like food, water and medical supplies goes on.

fields.title: Residents stock up amid nuclear panic
fields.description: Tokyo residents head to petrol stations, drugstores and supermarkets after a nuclear power plant explosion sends low levels of radiation floating towards the capital.

fields.title: Global response to Haiti
fields.description: The international community prepares relief efforts for Haiti.

fields.title: Hurricane Tomas nears Haiti
fields.description: Hurricane Tomas threatens another humanitarian disaster in Haiti, already grappling with the impact of a devastating earthquake in January, and a deadly cholera epidemic.

fields.title: Aid medics expand Pakistan push
fields.description: Doctors Without Borders -- one of the medical aid groups providing urgent medical care among the millions Pakistanis displaced by flooding -- is expanding its operation into the south of the country.

fields.title: Pakistan floods cause humanitarian crisis
fields.description: Sept 18 - The United Nations says urgent assistance is needed in Pakistan as flooding continues to swamp the southern part of the country. Andrew Raven reports.

fields.title: Vaccination campaign in Kenya refugee camps
fields.description: Aug 1 - Aid agencies vaccinate against polio and measles in Kenya's Dadaab area where hundreds of thousands of refugees have settled after fleeing devastating drought and warfare in Somalia. Nick Rowlands reports.

fields.title: Rising floods in Pakistan's Sindh
fields.description: Pakistan's southern province of Sindh is bearing the brunt of the latest flooding, with hundreds of thousands of people fleeing to higher ground.

fields.title: Jakarta flights resume
fields.description: Flights suspended because of Indonesia's Mount Merapi volcano restart to Jakararta but Yogyakarta airport stays shut.

fields.title: US expands Pakistan relief mission

fields.title: Wallace Unplugged: The Monday Edition
fields.description: The budget appears to take a back seat this week, as foreign news dominates the headlines

fields.title: Agriculture: sowing the seeds of the future
fields.description: www.euronews.com While traditional agricultural methods can be very productive it is still important to keep up with new developments, as demand for foodstuffs grows. The UN estimates that by 2050, global demand for food will be three times greater than today. Many countries are working to sustain their agricultural resources and promote good farming practices. Learning World looks at lessons on agriculture in Pakistan, Cuba and China. *Pakistan: seeding, harvesting and eating* Monsoon floods in Pakistan devastated the country's agricultural sector. Now as the country recovers from the crisis, many organisations are giving lessons in modern agricultural methods to local communities. 75 million Pakistanis are directly dependent on farming, a sector that makes up 21% of its GDP. Improving overall quality in this area therefore, is critical. "welthungerhilf":www.welthungerhilfe.de "alliance2015": www.alliance2015.org "fao":www.fao.org "Pakistan":sappk.wordpress.com "economie":www.tresor.economie.gouv.fr Cuba: Farming challenges The US economic embargo resulted in Cuba investing in internal resources like agriculture to promote farming techniques which address the country's needs. New curriculums aim to capitalise on a new breed of young land-owning farmers. Colleges are a vital to teaching the next generation the ins and outs of agriculture. The future of the island is in the students hands as Cuba continues to import 80% of what it consumes. Dismantling the state monopoly ...

fields.title: euronews learning world - Emergency education after disasters
fields.description: Recovering from the trauma of a natural disaster is not only about rebuilding homes and schools, but also rebuilding broken lives and healing trauma. So-called "Emergency Education" can be one of the most effective means to help children who survived a natural disaster return to normality. ... www.euronews.net

fields.title: euronews reporter - Japan: Shinto Shrine survivors
fields.description: On 11 March the Japanese town of Otsuchi was devastated by a 9-magnitude earthquake and a tsunami. Making matters even worse, fires raged unchecked for days, sparked by exploding gas tanks. Around one third of Otsuchi's population of 16000 are dead or missing. The Matsuhashi family are the custodians of the Kozuchi Shinto Shrine, a sacred structure and one of the few remaining buildings left intact. ... www.euronews.net

fields.title: Post-tsunami Sri Lanka - Five years on
fields.description: It was a giant wave bowling in at 200 kilometres per hour destroying everything in its path. The tsunami of the 26th December 2004 killed more than 230000 people. After the disaster, according to the Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development, 11-billion euros in aid flowed into NGO coffers. In Sri Lanka, the country worst affected after Indonesia, the tsunami also made more than half a million people homeless. ... www.euronews.net/

fields.title: The eyes in the sky helping with major disasters
fields.description: The tragic earthquake in Haiti last month triggered a vast international rescue effort. And space played a vital role in saving lives. Observation satellites are helping by providing crucial information in the emergencies that follow major natural disasters.... www.euronews.net/

fields.title: Haiti's steps to recovery - reporter
fields.description: Amputation has become one of the defining injuries of January's catastrophic earthquake in Haiti. Thousands were left without limbs after being caught in collapsed buildings. The task now facing NGO's and charities is to fit prosthetics and rehabilitate victims. Euronews travelled to Haiti, this week in reporter.... www.euronews.net

fields.title: euronews reporter - ECHO from Haiti
fields.description: Humanitarian emergency response, getting what's needed to a disaster zone fast... One year after the Haiti earthquake, European Union support towards recovery is being sustained. Immediate crisis help and longer-term management require complex preparation and execution, handled be the European Community Humanitarian Aid Office, ECHO.... www.euronews.net

fields.title: euronews futuris - Scientists work on tsunami alert system for Med
fields.description: Massive waves crashed into the eastern coast of Japan after last week's 8.9 earthquake. The tsunami killed thousands of people and left hundreds of thousands homeless. Scientists in Europe are convinced this scenario could happen closer to home. They have been working on an early warning system for countries surrounding the Mediterranean Sea. The region along the Turkish coast in the Eastern Mediterranean is considered the most vulnerable. Turkish geophysicist Ahmet Yalciner from the University of Ankara classed the risk as "very serious." ... www.euronews.net

fields.title: euronews interview - António Guterres: "we're witnessing human suffering on an epic scale"
fields.description: www.euronews.com For the fifth consecutive year the number of forcibly displaced people worldwide has reached 42 million and aid is now at a critical level. Euronews met with the UN High Commissioner for Refugees, António Guterres who highlights the most pressing issues that a growing number of people are facing. Michel Santos, euronews: Mr. António Guterres welcome to euronews. For the 5th consecutive year there are more than 42 million forcibly displaced people throughout the world. What can we understand from this? António Guterres, UN High Commissioner for Refugees: I think it's a combination of two factors. On the one hand there has been a multiplication of new crises. Since the beginning of 2011, the Ivory Coast, Libya, Yemen, Syria, the Horn of Africa - Somalia - and then more recently Sudan, South Sudan and Mali. And at the same time, old crises never seem to die: Afghanistan is still going on and on; Somalia or the Democratic Republic of Congo. And more than 70 percent of the world's refugees have been refugees for more than 5 years. Michel Santos, euronews: Is the worldwide economic turmoil affecting the aid for refugees? António Guterres, UN High Commissioner for Refugees: The world economic crisis has made two impacts. It's reduced the amount of humanitarian support for people in need but it's also triggered instability and conflict in many situations. There is a clear link, for instance, when you have high food prices and social instability at an urban level ...

fields.title: euronews reporter - Pakistan planting for hope
fields.description: Six months ago, flooding in Pakistan killed 1600 people, badly affected millions more and wrought billions of euros in material destruction. Today, Red Cross help in the northwest is seen as crucial for those returning home. Farmers are being given crop seed and tools, but whatever they might hope, there is no guarantee of harvest.... www.euronews.net

fields.title: Focus: quenching the world's water thirst
fields.description: The Horn of Africa is facing its worst drought for decades. The need for fresh water for people there is simply a matter of life and death. While climate change and environmental factors have been blamed for the increasing scarcity of this most valuable resource, it is not the only reason for the region's difficulties. ... www.euronews.net

fields.title: euronews le mag - Haiti art saved from beneath rubble
fields.description: When the devastating earthquake struck Haiti a year ago, hundreds of thousands of people were killed. An entire cultural tradition was also buried beneath the rubble.
