fields.description: March 14 (Bloomberg) -- Gary Shilling, president of A. Gary Shilling & Co., and Howard Davidowitz, chairman of Davidowitz & Associates Inc., talk about the outlook for Japan's currency and economy following last week's earthquake, tsunami and nuclear plant accident. Shilling and Davidowitz, speaking with Pimm Fox on Bloomberg Television's "Surveillance Midday," also discuss the US economy and budget deficit. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Lyness Says Haitian Violence Is `Isolated', Aid Arriving: Video
fields.description: Jan. 19 (Bloomberg) -- Randy Lyness, regional director for the Americas at CHF International, talks with Bloomberg's Bernard Lo about the relief efforts in Haiti following a 7.0 magnitude earthquake on Jan. 12. Lyness, speaking from Petionville, Haiti, also discusses reports violence in Haiti is preventing governments and humanitarian groups from providing aid. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Hennessy Says Tech Companies to Be Hit Unevenly by Quake
fields.description: March 15 (Bloomberg) -- Stanford University President John Hennessy talks about the impact of the Japanese earthquake on companies that depend on manufacturing plants in Japan for parts for their products. Hennessy, a board member of Google Inc. and Cisco Systems Inc., also discusses his dinner with President Barack Obama and other leaders of the US technology industry last month. He speaks with Emily Chang and Cory Johnson on Bloomberg Television's "Bloomberg West." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Ferguson Says World Moving to `Inflationary Mindset'
fields.description: March 14 (Bloomberg) -- Niall Ferguson, a Harvard University professor, talks about the euro-zone bailout fund and the effect of the Japanese earthquake on the country's economy. He speaks with Andrea Catherwood on Bloomberg Television's "Last Word."

fields.title: Jersey Says Japanese Bonds, Stocks Show `Risk Aversion'
fields.description: March 15 (Bloomberg) -- Ira Jersey, an interest-rate strategist at Credit Suisse Group AG, and Hans-Guenter Redeker, global head of foreign-exchange strategy at BNP Paribas SA, talk about the outlook for Japanese financial markets after last week's record earthquake. They speak with Tom Keene on Bloomberg Television's "Surveillance Midday." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Ruskin Says Japan May Use QE-Type Program for Recovery
fields.description: March 17 (Bloomberg) -- Alan Ruskin, global head of Group-of-10 foreign-exchange strategy at Deutsche Bank AG, talks about Japan's economic policy response to the record-setting earthquake that hit the country last week. He speaks with Tom Keene on Bloomberg Television's "Surveillance Midday." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Haugh Says It's `Amazing' Stocks Up After Japan Quake
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Dan Haugh, president at PTI Securities & Futures LP, and Zahid Siddique, portfolio manager at Gamco Investors Inc., talks about the earthquake in Japan and the outlook for stocks. They speak with Carol Massar and Matt Miller on Bloomberg Television's "Street Smart." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Haltman Sees Reassessment of Nuclear Energy by Nations: Video
fields.description: March 16 (Bloomberg) -- Nathan Haltman, a professor at the University of Maryland School of Public Policy and fellow at the Brookings Institution, and Bloomberg New Energy Finance's Chris Gadomski talk about the damaged nuclear reactors in Japan and implications for global energy policy. The United Nations' nuclear agency plans an emergency meeting to discuss the crisis at Japan's Fukushima Dai-Ichi power plant as hundreds of cars streamed south of areas hit by last week's earthquake and tsunami. Haltman and Gadomski speak with Pimm Fox on Bloomberg Television's "Taking Stock." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Hultman Sees Reassessment of Nuclear Energy: Video (Correct)
fields.description: (Correct spelling of guest's name.) March 22 (Bloomberg) -- Nathan Hultman, a professor at the University of Maryland School of Public Policy and fellow at the Brookings Institution, and Bloomberg New Energy Finance's Chris Gadomski talk about the damaged nuclear reactors in Japan and implications for global energy policy. The United Nations' nuclear agency plans an emergency meeting to discuss the crisis at Japan's Fukushima Dai-Ichi power plant as hundreds of cars streamed south of areas hit by last week's earthquake and tsunami. Hultman and Gadomski spoke with Pimm Fox on Feb. 16 on Bloomberg Television's "Taking Stock." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Randy Paar Discusses Insurance Law After Japan Quake: BLAW
fields.description: March 23 (Bloomberg) -- Randy Paar, partner at Kasowitz Benson Torres & Friedman LLP, talks with Bloomberg Law's Lee Pacchia about the impact the recent earthquake and tsunami in Japan has had on the insurance and reinsurance industries.

fields.title: Ito Says Japan Has 80% Recession Chance on Power Outages
fields.description: April 1 (Bloomberg) -- Takatoshi Ito, a University of Tokyo professor and former adviser to the Japanese government, talks about the outlook for the economy amid reconstruction following last month's earthquake and power outages.¶ He speaks with Bloomberg's Ryan Chilcote in Cernobbio, Italy.

fields.title: Ito Says Japan Has 80% Recession Chance on Power Outages
fields.description: April 1 (Bloomberg) -- Takatoshi Ito, a University of Tokyo professor and former adviser to the Japanese government, talks about the outlook for the economy amid reconstruction following last month's earthquake and power outages. He speaks with Bloomberg's Ryan Chilcote in Cernobbio, Italy.

fields.title: Kelley Says Japan Nuclear Reactor Not Another Chernobyl
fields.description: March 14 (Bloomberg) -- Robert Kelley, a nuclear engineer and former contractor for the US Department of Energy, and Bloomberg's Chris Gadomski talk about damage to Tokyo Electric Power Co.'s Fukushima Dai-Ichi nuclear power plant resulting from Japan's March 11 earthquake. They speak with Pimm Fox on Bloomberg Television's "Taking Stock." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Nicholson Says Japan Crisis May Hurt Handset Makers
fields.description: March 17 (Bloomberg) -- Christopher Nicholson, lead equity analyst at research firm Oraca Ltd., talks about the effect of the Japanese earthquake and nuclear crisis on economic growth. Nicholson also discusses the implications for manufacturers including handset makers. He spoke with Bloomberg's Caroline Connan yesterday in London.

fields.title: Roubini Says Japan Quake 'Worst Thing' at Worst Time
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Nouriel Roubini, founder of Roubini Global Economics, discusses the earthquake in Japan and the European debt crisis. He talks with Maryam Nemazee on Bloomberg Television's "The Pulse."

fields.title: Lyman Says US Nuclear Plants Need More Safety Measures
fields.description: March 25 (Bloomberg) -- Edwin Lyman, a scientist at the Union of Concerned Scientists, talks about damage at nuclear reactors in Japan as a result of the March 11 earthquake and tsunami and the implications for the US nuclear industry. Japan's nuclear regulator says a reactor core at the quake-damaged Fukushima power plant may be leaking after workers were injured by radioactive water. Lyman speaks with Matt Miller on Bloomberg Television's "Street Smart." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Kawakami Says Japan Will Be Able to Finance Rebuilding
fields.description: March 18 (Bloomberg) -- Yosuke Kawakami, minister of financial affairs at the Embassy of Japan in London, talks about recovery efforts from the March 11 earthquake and tsunami, the Group of Seven nations' joint intervention in foreign-exchange markets to curb gains in the yen and concerns over the nuclear crisis. He speaks with Andrea Catherwood on Bloomberg Television's "Last Word." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Pearson Doesn't See Change in China's Nuclear Plans
fields.description: March 18 (Bloomberg) -- William Pearson of the Eurasia Group talks about the outlook for nuclear energy following the Japan earthquake and crisis at the crippled Fukushima Dai-Ichi plant. He speaks with Tom Keene on Bloomberg Television's "Surveillance Midday." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Willis's Plumeri Says Japan Insured Losses Still Unknown
fields.description: March 15 (Bloomberg) -- Joseph Plumeri, chief executive officer of insurance broker Willis Group Holdings Plc, discusses the potential impact of Japan's earthquake and tsunami on the insurance industry. Plumeri, speaking with Erik Schatzker on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack," also talks about the country's damaged nuclear reactors. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Morgan Stanley's Roach Says Japan May Face Recession
fields.description: March 16 (Bloomberg) -- Stephen Roach, non-executive chairman of Morgan Stanley Asia Ltd., talks about the prospects for a recession in Japan following the earthquake and tsunami. He speaks with Andrea Catherwood on Bloomberg Television's "Last Word."

fields.title: Bermudez Says Colombia, US Trade Would Help Drug Fight: Video
fields.description: Jan. 15 (Bloomberg) -- Colombia's Foreign Minister Jaime Bermudez talks with Bloomberg's Bernard Lo about the implications of free trade with the US in the fight against drug trafficking and terrorism. Bermudez also discusses Colombia's aid to Haiti following a 7.0 magnitude earthquake on Jan. 12. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Cashmore Says Apple Tablet May Threaten E-Book Readers: Video
fields.description: Jan. 19 (Bloomberg) -- Pete Cashmore, chief executive officer of social networking blog Mashable, talks to Bloombergs Margaret Brennan about the outlook for the possible debut of Apple Inc.'s tablet device and its potential impact on the electronic publishing industry. Cashmore also discusses Google Inc.'s censorship dispute in China and the impact of the Internet on humanitarian aid following the Jan. 12 earthquake that struck Haiti. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Dennis Says Emerging Markets to Rally Over Rest of Year
fields.description: March 22 (Bloomberg) -- Geoffrey Dennis, an emerging-markets strategist at Citigroup Inc., talks about the outlook for emerging markets. Dennis, speaking with Lisa Murphy on Bloomberg Television's "Fast Forward," also discusses the economic implications of the March 11 earthquake and tsunami in Japan and US President Barack Obama's trip to Latin America. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Blitz Sees No Long Term Economic Harm From Japan Quake
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Steve Blitz, economist at ITG Investment Research, and Eamonn Fingleton, author of "In The Jaws of the Dragon," talks about the earthquake in Japan. They speak with Pimm Fox on Bloomberg Television's "Taking Stock." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Okubo Says BOJ's Commitment to Inflation Target `Weak'
fields.description: Feb. 20 (Bloomberg) -- Takuji Okubo, chief Japan economist at Societe Generale SA in Tokyo, talks about the nation's economy and central bank monetary policy. Japan posted a record trade deficit in January as the yen's strength and weaker global demand eroded manufacturers' profits and slowed the nation's recovery from last year's earthquake and tsunami. Okubo speaks with John Dawson on Bloomberg Television's "First Up." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Sakurai Says Japan Growth May Worsen in Second Quarter
fields.description: May 19 (Bloomberg) -- Yuuki Sakurai, president at Fukoku Capital Management Inc. in Tokyo, talks about the outlook for Japan's economy and central bank monetary policy and currency. Japan's economy shrank more than estimated in the first quarter after the March 11 earthquake and tsunami disrupted production and prompted consumers to cut back spending, sending the nation to its third recession in a decade. Sakurai speaks with Rishaad Salamat on Bloomberg Television's "On the Move Asia." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: O'Brien Says Haiti `Attractive,' Ireland in `Recovery'
fields.description: Sept. 23 (Bloomberg) -- Denis O'Brien, chairman of Digicel Group Ltd., discusses prospects for Haiti following January's earthquake, the outlook for Ireland's economy and investment opportunities in both countries. Digicel is the largest mobile-phone company in the Caribbean. O'Brien spoke with Margaret Brennan on Bloomberg Television's

fields.title: De Longis Says Coordinated Yen Intervention Can Work
fields.description: March 18 (Bloomberg) -- Alessio de Longis, a portfolio manager at Oppenheimer Funds, discusses the Group of Seven's decision to intervene in the foreign exchange market to help stabilize the Japanese economy in the wake of the March 11 earthquake. De Longis, speaking with Erik Schatzker on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack," also discusses his recommendation of the Swiss franc. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Andreeff Says US `Missed the Boat' on Nuclear Energy
fields.description: March 24 (Bloomberg) -- Dane Andreeff, founder and portfolio manager at Andreeff Equity Advisors LLC., talks about the outlook for nuclear energy following the March 11 Japanese earthquake and tsunami, and his investment strategy. Andreeff spoke yesterday with Bloomberg's Margaret Brennan. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Parker Expects More Aftershocks From Japan Earthquake
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Bruce Parker of the Stevens Institute of Technology talks about the aftermath of the earthquake in Japan. Residents near a Tokyo Electric Power Co. nuclear reactor were ordered to evacuate because of a possible radiation leak as Japan's strongest earthquake in a century shut power plants and oil refineries. Parker talks with Pimm Fox on Bloomberg Television's "Taking Stock." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Berger Says Japan Quake Will Impact iPad 2 Production
fields.description: March 16 (Bloomberg) -- Craig Berger, a senior technology analyst at Friedman, Billings, Ramsey & Co., talks about the potential impact of the Japanese earthquake and resulting tsunami on the technology market. Berger speaks with Erik Schatzker on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Amos Says Aflac's Exposure to Japan Quake `Controlled'
fields.description: March 16 (Bloomberg) -- Daniel Amos, chief executive officer of Aflac Inc., discusses the impact of last week's earthquake and tsunami in Japan on the Columbus, Georgia-based insurer and Aflac's contribution to the relief effort. The world's largest seller of supplemental health insurance gets most of its revenue in Japan. Amos talks with Betty Liu on Bloomberg Television's "In the Loop." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Byrne Says Japan Debt Concerned Moody's Prior to Quake
fields.description: March 15 (Bloomberg) -- Tom Byrne, senior vice president at Moody's Investors Service, discusses Japan's credit rating amid the March 11 earthquake and ensuing tsunami. Byrne speaks with Erik Schatzker on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: MIT's Spear Praises Toyota's Internal Problem-Solving
fields.description: April 5 (Bloomberg) -- Steven Spear, a senior lecturer at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology's Sloan School of Management, discusses the impact of Japan's earthquake and tsunami on Toyota Motor Corp.'s so-called just-in-time production system. Spear speaks with Erik Schatzker on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack." (Source: Bloomberg) steven

fields.title: Patterson Discusses Pakistan Floods, US Response: Video
fields.description: Aug. 23 (Bloomberg) -- Anne Patterson, the US ambassador to Pakistan, talks about the impact of floods on Pakistan's economy, prospects for loans from the International Monetary Fund and opportunities for US investment in Pakistan. Patterson speaks with Margaret Brennan on Bloomberg Television's "InBusiness." (This is an excerpt. Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Stern Encourages Unicef `Inspired Gift' Donations
fields.description: Dec. 21 (Bloomberg) -- Caryl Stern, chief executive officer of the US Fund for Unicef, talks about helping children globally, fundraising efforts and the "Inspired Gift" option on Unicef.org. She speaks with Pimm Fox on Bloomberg Television's "Taking Stock." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Nissan's Wilcox Says Demand for Leaf Outstrips Supply
fields.description: March 21 (Bloomberg) -- Paul Wilcox, managing director of Nissan Motor Co.'s UK unit, discusses demand for the company's Leaf electric car. Speaking with Maryam Nemazee on Bloomberg Television's "The Pulse," Wilcox also comments on the impact of the March 11 earthquake on the company's Japanese plants.

fields.title: Semmens Says Gasoline Prices Hurting Disposable Income
fields.description: March 21 (Bloomberg) -- David Semmens, US economist at Standard Chartered Bank, talks about the impact of the March 11 earthquake and tsunami in Japan on manufacturing in the US, and the uprising and military intervention in Libya on oil and gasoline prices. Semmens speaks with Pimm Fox on Bloomberg Television's "Taking Stock." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Grae Doesn't Expect Public Disaster at Japanese Reactor: Video
fields.description: March 14 (Bloomberg) -- Seth Grae, chief executive officer of Lightbridge Corp., discusses damage to Tokyo Electric Power Co.'s Fukushima nuclear plant after Japan's strongest earthquake on record, the impact on the local population and environment, and the safety of nuclear power plants in the US Grae speaks with Margaret Brennan on Bloomberg Television's "InBusiness." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Schieffer Says US Prepared to Aid Japan After Tsunami
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Former US Ambassador to Japan Tom Schieffer talks about US response to the seven-meter-high tsunami that hit Japan, killing hundreds of people as it engulfed towns on the nation's northern coast. He speaks with Margaret Brennan on Bloomberg Television's "InBusiness." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Freeze Says Japan Valuations `Extreme,' Best Since 1993
fields.description: March 15 (Bloomberg) -- Curtis Freeze, chairman of Prospect Asset Management Inc., talks about his investment strategy in Japan following the March 11 earthquake and resulting tsunami. Freeze speaks from Tokyo with Scarlet Fu on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Sparx's Abe Sees `Quite Strong' Rebound for Japan Stocks
fields.description: March 17 (Bloomberg) -- Sparx Group Co. President Shuhei Abe talks about his Japanese stocks strategy after the country's strongest earthquake on record. He speaks from Tokyo with Francine Lacqua on Bloomberg Television's "On The Move."

fields.title: Price Doubts Japan Quake Will Hurt Yahoo, Apple Results
fields.description: April 19 (Bloomberg) -- Walter Price, a portfolio manager at RCM Capital Management, talks about the impact of the March 11 Japanese earthquake and tsunami on the technology industry. Price also discusses the outlook for earnings from Yahoo! Inc., Intel Corp. and Apple Inc. He speaks with Carol Massar and Matt Miller on Bloomberg Television's "Street Smart." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Weinberg Says BOJ Needs to Ensure Liquidity After Quake
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Carl Weinberg, chief economist at High Frequency Economics Ltd., talks about the potential impact of the Japan's earthquake and tsunami on the domestic and global economy. Weinberg speaks with Betty Liu on Bloomberg Television's "In the Loop." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: O'Donoghue Says Markets Are on `Knife's Edge' Over Japan
fields.description: March 16 (Bloomberg) -- John O'Donoghue, head of equities at Cowen & Co., talks about the impact of Japan's earthquake, tsunami and nuclear crisis on the US stock market. O'Donoghue speaks with Margaret Brennan on Bloomberg Television's "InBusiness." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Freeze Sees `Deep Dip' in Japan's GDP Before Rebound
fields.description: March 28 (Bloomberg) -- Curtis Freeze, chairman of Prospect Asset Management Inc., talks about investment strategy in Japan amid nuclear safety concerns at Fukushima's tsunami-damaged Dai-Ichi power plant. Freeze speaks with Deirdre Bolton on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Ross Says Japan Quake's Impact on Economy `Containable'
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Billionaire investor Wilbur Ross, chairman and chief executive officer of WL Ross & Co., discusses the potential impact of the Japan's earthquake and tsunami on the economy. Ross, speaking with Betty Liu on Bloomberg Television's "In the Loop," also talks about the unrest in the Middle East and his investment strategy. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: MIT's Lester Says Nuclear Power Needed in Low-Carbon Mix
fields.description: April 7 (Bloomberg) -- Richard Lester, head of the department of nuclear science and engineering at the Massachusetts Institute of Technology, talks about the outlook for nuclear power following the crisis at Tokyo Electric Power Co.'s tsunami-damaged facility in northeastern Japan. Lester speaks with Carol Massar and Matt Miller on Bloomberg Television's "Street Smart." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Lawton Says Japan Supply Disruptions to Stifle Companies
fields.description: April 1 (Bloomberg) -- James "Jim" Lawton, president and general manager of D&B Supply Management Solutions, talks about the impact of Japan's earthquake and tsunami on global supply chains. Lawton speaks with Erik Schatzker on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Loundermon Says US Forces Working Swiftly in Haiti: Video
fields.description: Jan. 20 (Bloomberg) -- Commander Christopher Loundermon, a spokesman for the US Joint Forces in Haiti, talks with Bloomberg's Bernard Lo about the relief and peacekeeping efforts in the devasted Caribbean nation. A magnitude 7.0 earthquake on Jan. 12 may have left more than 100000 people dead, according to United Nations data. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Keller Expects Japan Supply Issues to Hurt Automakers
fields.description: March 18 (Bloomberg) -- Maryann Keller, principal of a self-titled consulting firm, and Karl Bauer, senior analyst at Edmunds.com, talk about the impact of last week's earthquake and tsunami on Japanese automobile parts manufacturers and the global auto industry. They speak with Matt Miller and Carol Massar on Bloomberg Television's "Street Smart." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Caron Says Japan Investors Not Selling US Treasuries
fields.description: March 17 (Bloomberg) -- Jim Caron, head of global interest-rate strategy at Morgan Stanley, talks about the outlook for the US Treasury market following the Japanese earthquake, ensuing tsunami and nuclear crisis. Caron speaks with Betty Liu and Michael McKee on Bloomberg Television's "In the Loop." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Akbar Says US Flood Aid in Pakistan May Help Relations: Video
fields.description: Aug. 19 (Bloomberg) -- Ghouse Akbar, director for the Akbar Group, talks about the flood catastrophe in Pakistan and the opportunity the US may have to strengthen relations through foreign aid.¶ Akbar, speaking with Margaret Brennan on Bloomberg Television's "InBusiness," also discusses the company's plan to assist with rebuilding efforts. Former Secretary of Defense William Cohen also speaks. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Barrett Says Fukushima Crisis `Not a Health Catastrophe'
fields.description: March 28 (Bloomberg) -- Lake Barrett, former deputy director of the Office of Civilian Radioactive Waste Management at the US Department of Energy, discusses Japan's nuclear crisis. Radiation levels that can prove fatal were detected outside reactor buildings at Japan's Fukushima Dai-Ichi plant. A magnitude-9 earthquake and ensuing tsunami knocked out power and disabled the cooling systems on March 11. Barrett speaks with Erik Schatzker on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Heymann Likes Johnson Controls, 3M on Japan Prospects
fields.description: March 21 (Bloomberg) -- Nicholas Heymann, an analyst at Sterne Agee & Leach Inc., talks about companies that may benefit as Japan rebuilds after the 9.0 magnitude earthquake and tsunami that struck the country on March 11. Heymann speaks with Pimm Fox on Bloomberg Television's "Taking Stock." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Freedman Says Japan Quake May Benefit US Memory Makers
fields.description: March 14 (Bloomberg) -- Doug Freedman, an analyst at Gleacher & Co., talks about the possible impact of the earthquake in Japan on the semiconductor industry. He speaks with Pimm Fox on Bloomberg Television's "Taking Stock." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Levkovich Says Japan Quake Unlikely to Hurt Global GDP
fields.description: March 18 (Bloomberg) -- Tobias Levkovich, chief US equity strategist at Citigroup Inc., discusses the impact of Japan's earthquake and tsunami on the global economy and financial markets. Levkovich talks with Margaret Brennan on Bloomberg Television's "InBusiness." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Toys `R' Us CFO Says China's Growth Will Benefit Japan
fields.description: Sept. 30 (Bloomberg) -- F. Clay Creasey, chief financial officer of Toys "R" Us Inc., the world's biggest toy retailer, talks about the company's business in Japan. Creasey spoke yesterday in the city of Sendai, one of the areas hardest hit by Japan's record earthquake and tsunami, with Bloomberg Television's Mike Firn. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Resler Says Central Banks May `Stand Ready' for Japan
fields.description: March 15 (Bloomberg) -- David Resler, chief economist at Nomura Securities International Inc., talks about the potential impact of the Japanese earthquake and tsunami on the global economy. Resler, speaking with Margaret Brennan on Bloomberg Television's "InBusiness," also discusses the outlook for today's Federal Open Market Committee meeting decision and the Fed's monetary policy. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Eric Brock Says Take 2-3 Months to Assess Japan Stocks
fields.description: March 22 (Bloomberg) -- Eric Brock, portfolio manager at Clough Capital Partners, talks about the outlook for investments in Asia following the March 11 earthquake and tsunami in Japan. Brock speaks with Margaret Brennan on Bloomberg Television's "InBusiness." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: SocGen's Okubo Says Japan to Post Trade Deficit in 2012
fields.description: Jan. 25 (Bloomberg) -- Takuji Okubo, chief Japan economist at Societe Generale SA in Tokyo, talks about the nation's economy and the yen. Japan's exports fell for the third consecutive month in December, capping the first annual trade deficit in 31 years, figures underscoring the toll slower global growth and March's earthquake have taken on the economy. Okubo speaks with Rishaad Salamat on Bloomberg Television's "On the Move Asia." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Amos Says Aflac Has Limited Exposure to Japan Earthquake
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Daniel "Dan" Amos, chairman and chief executive officer of Aflac Inc., discusses the potential impact of the earthquake in Japan on the insurance company and Aflac's contribution to the relief effort. The US-based insurer makes most of its revenue from health insurance in Japan. Amos speaks with Margaret Brennan on Bloomberg Television's "InBusiness." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Bill Eyre Says US Reinsurance Prices May Rise 15%
fields.description: March 22 (Bloomberg) -- Bill Eyre, managing director of the reinsurance brokerage at Towers Watson, discusses the potential impact of the March 11 Japanese earthquake and resulting tsunami on the insurance industry. Eyre talks with Erik Schatzker on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Besnainou Says Japan Reactors Will Be 'Damaged Forever'
fields.description: March 15 (Bloomberg) -- Jacques Besnainou, chief executive officer of Areva SA's US unit, talks about the earthquake in Japan and the condition of Tokyo Electric Power Co.'s nuclear reactors. Areva is the world's largest maker of nuclear reactors. Besnainou talks with Betty Liu on Bloomberg Television's "In the Loop." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Grae Says Japan Reactor Failures Shouldn't Have Happened
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Seth Grae, chief executive officer of Lightbridge Corp., talks about damage at Tokyo Electric Power Co.'s nuclear reactor in Fukushima, Japan, after the nation's strongest earthquake. The utility said it may vent radioactive vapor to reduce pressure at the reactor after coolant pumps lost electric power. Lightbridge is a developer and consultant on atomic fuel. Grae speaks with Pimm Fox on Bloomberg Television's "Taking Stock." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Tavares Says Nissan Leaf to Go Mass Market in Late 2012
fields.description: April 21 (Bloomberg) -- Carlos Tavares, chairman of Nissan Motor Co.'s Americas operation, talks about the company's recovery from the March 11 earthquake and tsunami in Japan, the impact of the technology revolution on Nissan's vehicles and the company's electric-car ambitions. Tavares speaks with Pimm Fox at the New York International Auto Show on Bloomberg Television's "Taking Stock." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Hasenstab Expects `Gradual Depreciation' of Japan's Yen
fields.description: March 17 (Bloomberg) -- Michael Hasenstab, who runs the Templeton Global Bond Fund at Franklin Templeton Investments, talks about the impact of the record-setting earthquake in Japan on financial markets. He speaks with Pimm Fox on Bloomberg Television's "Taking Stock." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Parpart Says Japan's Fiscal State After Quake Is Concern
fields.description: March 15 (Bloomberg) -- Uwe Parpart, chief economist and strategist for Asia at Cantor Fitzgerald HK Capital Markets, talks about the cost of reconstruction in Japan following the earthquake and tsunami. He speaks with Mark Barton on Bloomberg Television's "Countdown."

fields.title: Japan Says Reactor Intact After Blast; BOJ Injects Cash
fields.description: March 14 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Mark Barton and Mike Firn report on a second hydrogen explosion to rock an atomic plant north of Tokyo where fears of a possible meltdown threaten a region reeling from the nation's biggest earthquake and ensuing tsunami. Tokyo Electric Japan Power Co. said a meltdown remains possible after an explosion at the Fukushima Dai-Ichi No. 3 reactor. To shield the nation's economy from the effects of the quake, the Bank of Japan poured a record amount of cash into the financial system and doubled the size of their asset-purchase plan. Firn speaks from Fukushima prefecture north of Tokyo. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Gadomski Says US Must Reassess Nuclear Plant Safety
fields.description: March 16 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg New Energy Finance's Chris Gadomski talks about the need for US officials to re-examine safety measures of the country's nuclear facilities following radiation fears in Japan. Gadomski, speaking with Lisa Murphy on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack," also discusses the effort of Japanese crews to stabilize nuclear plants damaged by the March 11 earthquake. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: KBW''s Threadgold Sees Value in Tokio Marine, NKSJ, T&D
fields.description: May 27 (Bloomberg) -- David Threadgold, a Tokyo-based analyst at Keefe Bruyette & Woods Inc., talks about the impact of Japan's March 11 earthquake on insurers. Japan's four largest life insurers, including Nippon Life Insurance Co., reported a 10.5 percent drop in combined full-year profit on claims following the quake. Threadgold speaks with Rishaad Salamat on Bloomberg Television's "On the Move Asia." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Demos Expects More Conservative Apple Forecast on Japan
fields.description: April 20 (Bloomberg) -- Mark Demos, a fund manager at Fifth Third Asset Management, talks about the outlook for Apple Inc.'s second-quarter results and third-quarter forecast, and the impact of the earthquake, tsunami and nuclear crisis in Japan on the company. Demos speaks with Julie Hyman on Bloomberg Television's "Fast Forward." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Koll Says Japan Seeks Stability After `Weak' Leadership
fields.description: Aug. 29 (Bloomberg) -- Jesper Koll, head of equity research at JPMorgan Chase & Co. in Tokyo, talks about Japanese politics and the nation's economy. Japan's ruling party today chooses Prime Minister Naoto Kan's successor following weekend debates that revealed differences over how to cover the costs of rebuilding from the March 11 earthquake and a nuclear meltdown. Koll speaks with Susan Li on Bloomberg Television's "First Up." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Rogers Says `Core Strength' of Japan Intact After Quake
fields.description: June 9 (Bloomberg) -- Ed Rogers, chief executive officer at Rogers Investment Advisors, a Tokyo-based fund-of-hedge-funds adviser, talks about Japan's recovery from the earthquake and tsunami in March, strategy for investment in the country and the outlook for the yen. Rogers speaks with Carol Massar and Adam Johnson on Bloomberg Television's "Street Smart." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: McKee Says Quake May Knock 2% Off Japan Growth This Year
fields.description: March 14 (Bloomberg) -- Bob McKee, chief economist at Independent Strategy Ltd. in London, talks about the effect of the Japanese earthquake on the country's economy. He speaks with Francine Lacqua on Bloomberg Television's "On The Move."

fields.title: Pritchard Expects Japan Quake to Affect Adobe Forecast
fields.description: March 16 (Bloomberg) -- Walter Pritchard, an analyst with Citigroup Global Markets Inc., discusses the impact of Japan's earthquake and tsunami on the computer software market, and his assessment of Adobe Systems Inc., Autodesk Inc. and Salesforce.com Inc. Pritchard speaks with Lisa Murphy on Bloomberg Television's "Fast Forward." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Brown Sees Some Upward Pressure on Yen After Japan Quake
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Scott Brown, chief economist at Raymond James & Associates Inc., talks about the outlook for Japan's economy after the country's worst earthquake on record. Brown talks with Carol Massar and Matt Miller on Bloomberg Television's "Street Smart." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Keogh Says It WIll Take Months to Assess Quake Damage
fields.description: March 14 (Bloomberg) -- William Keogh, president of Eqecat Inc., talks about the impact of the Japan earthquake on the insurnace industry. Japan was struck by its strongest earthquake on record, an 8.9-magnitude temblor that shook buildings across Tokyo and unleashed a seven-meter-high tsunami that engulfed towns on the northern coast, killing thousands. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Ripert Says Radiation to Rise From Japan Nuclear Plant
fields.description: March 15 (Bloomberg) -- Enguerran Ripert, a nuclear energy consultant at Frost & Sullivan Inc., talks about the risk of radiation leakage from Tokyo Electric Power Co.'s stricken nuclear power plant. The Fukushima Dai-Ichi facility was today rocked by two further explosions and a fire as workers struggled to avert the risk of a meltdown. Ripert speaks with Maryam Nemazee on Bloomberg Television's "The Pulse."

fields.title: HSBC's Qu Says Stock Market Reaction to Quake Temporary
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Qu Hongbin, co-head of economic research at HSBC Holdings Plc, talks about the stock, currency and bond market reaction to the earthquake in Japan and the effect of the disaster on economic growth. Japan was struck by its strongest earthquake in at least a century, an 8.9-magnitude temblor that shook buildings across Tokyo and unleashed a tsunami as high as 10 meters, engulfing towns along the northern coast. Qu speaks with Maryam Nemazee on Bloomberg Television's "The Pulse."

fields.title: Haqqani Says Pakistan Will Need Assistance After Floods: Video
fields.description: Aug. 10 (Bloomberg) -- Husain Haqqani, Pakistan's ambassador to the US, discusses the floods that have devastated northern Pakistan and uprooted 14 million people so far. Pakistan's deadliest floods may sweep through southern areas increasing damage to crops and infrastructure. Haqqani talks with Margaret Brennan on Bloomberg Television's "InBusiness." Mortimer Zuckerman, chairman of Boston Properties Inc., also speaks. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Colas Says Japan Recovery May Boost Yen, Hurt Exporters
fields.description: March 14 (Bloomberg) -- Nicholas Colas, chief market strategist at BNY ConvergEx Group LLC, discusses the outlook for Japan's economy and Bank of Japan policy following last week's earthquake and tsunami, and the potential impact of the disaster on the US recovery. Colas speaks with Mark Crumpton on Bloomberg Television's "Bottom Line." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Rambus's Holt Expects Toshiba to Honor License Agreement
fields.description: March 23 (Bloomberg) -- Sharon Holt, senior vice president and general manager of Rambus Inc.'s Semiconductor Business Group, talks about the potential impact of the March 11 Japanese earthquake and tsunami on the technology company. Rambus, a seller of technology used in computer memory, said on March 15 it renewed an agreement that lets Toshiba Corp. license patents covering certain computer chips. Holt spoke yesterday with Bloomberg's Deirdre Bolton. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: GM's Akerson Discusses Oil Prices, Japan Quake Response
fields.description: April 19 (Bloomberg) -- Dan Akerson, chief executive officer of General Motors Co., discusses the impact of oil prices on the company's strategy and actions by GM to head off interruption the auto-parts supply chain following the March 11 earthquake and tsunami in Japan. Akerson speaks at a forum hosted by the National Automobile Dealers Association and IHS Automotive in New York. Mike Jackson, chief executive officer of AutoNation Inc., moderates. (This report is an excerpt of the full event. Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Brockman Expects Japan to Use Robots for Nuclear Repairs
fields.description: March 18 (Bloomberg) -- Ken Brockman, former director of nuclear installation safety at the International Atomic Energy Agency, talks about efforts by Japan engineers to cool down tsunami-damaged reactors at Fukushima Dai-Ichi power plant. Brockman speaks with Deirdre Bolton on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Castillo Says Japan Doing `Excellent Job' Handling Aid
fields.description: March 18 (Bloomberg) -- Carlos Castillo, senior adviser with the Washington Federal Practice at PricewaterhouseCoopers, discusses the distribution of disaster aid in Japan following the earthquake and tsunami. Castillo speaks with Julie Hyman on Bloomberg Television's "Fast Forward." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: AEI's Makin Says Japan to Be Resilient After Earthquake
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- John Makin, an economist at the American Enterprise Institute, discusses the impact of Japan's earthquake on the nation's economy. Makin, speaking with Tom Keene on Bloomberg Television's "Surveillance Midday," also talks about US Federal Reserve policy. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Okubo Says Japan Quake Could Cause 1% Hit to GDP
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Takuji Okubo, chief Japan economist at Societe Generale Securities, discusses the potential impact of the 8.9-magnitude earthquake in Japan on its economy. Okubo speaks from Tokyo with Erik Schatzker on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Hore-Lacy Sees No Health Concerns From Fukushima Reactor
fields.description: March 14 (Bloomberg) -- Ian Hore-Lacy, director of public communications at the World Nuclear Association, talks about radiation levels around the Fukushima nuclear power station damaged in Japan's earthquake. He speaks with Francine Lacqua on Bloomberg Television's "On The Move."

fields.title: Unnikrishnan Says Wheat Prices May Rise to $9 a Bushel
fields.description: Aug. 6 (Bloomberg) -- Sudakshina Unnikrishnan, a commodities analyst at Barclays Capital, talks about the impact of flooding and Russia's export ban on wheat prices. She speaks on Bloomberg Television's "The Pulse" with Maryam Nemazee.

fields.title: Vale de Almeida Says EU `Responding Forcefully' to Japan
fields.description: March 16 (Bloomberg) -- João Vale de Almeida, the European Union's ambassador to the US, discusses the potential impact of the Japanese earthquake on the global economic recovery. Vale de Almeida, speaking with Peter Cook on Bloomberg Television's "In the Loop with Betty Liu," also talks about the EU's role in political unrest in Libya and the outlook for the sovereign debt crisis in Europe. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Lee Downplays Japan Quake Impact on US Economy, Stocks
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Thomas Lee, chief US equity strategist at JPMorgan Chase & Co., talks about the impact of a record-setting earthquake in Japan on the US economy and stock market. Lee, speaking with Betty Liu on Bloomberg Television's "In the Loop," also discusses his expectation for oil prices. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Japanese Flee Quake Zone as Government Battles Impact
fields.description: March 16 (Bloomberg) -- Hundreds of cars streamed south of Japanese areas devastated by last week's earthquake and tsunami as a few dozen technicians battled to contain fires and radiation leaks at the Fukushima Dai-Ichi nuclear power station. Companies including Alcatel-Lucent SA and ICAP Plc said they are moving employees to safer locations. Bloomberg's Sara Eisen reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Walk Says 16000 Japan Quake Videos Uploaded to YouTube
fields.description: March 14 (Bloomberg) -- Hunter Walk, director of product management at Google Inc.'s YouTube, talks about the use of social media in coverage of the Japan earthquake and tsunami, and the growth of YouTube usage on mobile devices. Walk speaks with Cris Valerio at the SXSW Music and Media Conference in Austin, Texas, on Bloomberg Television's "Fast Forward."(Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Schulz Expects `Rather Strong' Yen Through Year End: Video
fields.description: May 19 (Bloomberg) -- Martin Schulz, a senior economist at Fujitsu Research Institute in Tokyo, talks about the outlook for Japan's economy and currency. Japan's economy shrank more than estimated in the first quarter after the March 11 earthquake and tsunami disrupted production and prompted consumers to cut back spending, sending the nation to its third recession in a decade. Schulz speaks with Mark Barton on Bloomberg Television's "Global Connection." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Heinonen Says Japan Radiation Not a Concern Yet in US
fields.description: March 15 (Bloomberg) -- Olli Heinonen, senior fellow at Harvard University's Belfer Center for Science and International Affairs, discusses the impact of a potential nuclear disaster in Japan. Radiation levels rose amid a series of explosions at Tokyo Electric Power Co.'s Fukushima Dai-Ichi nuclear power plant after the March 11 earthquake and resulting tsunami. Heinonen speaks with Tom Keene on Bloomberg Television's "Surveillance Midday." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Pakistan Floods Raise Cost for US Against Militants: Video
fields.description: Aug. 18 (Bloomberg) -- Pakistan's destructive floods will raise the cost of the US effort to keep the country from sliding further under the influence of Islamic militants allied to al-Qaeda who oppose America's presence in the region. Bloomberg's James Rupert reports. Margaret Brennan also speaks. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Japan's Toymakers Focus on the Family After Earthquake
fields.description: June 17 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Mike Firn reports from the Tokyo Toy Show on industry trends after the March 11 earthquake. The magnitude-9 temblor and tsunami have spurred toy sales as parents look for ways to offset their children's exposure to images of destruction from the nation's worst disaster since World War II. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Fujitsu's Schulz Says Japan `Creeping Out of Recession' (Video)
fields.description: Oct. 3 (Bloomberg) -- Martin Schulz, a senior economist at Fujitsu Research Institute in Tokyo, talks about today's economic data from Japan. The quarterly Tankan index of sentiment among large manufacturers rose to 2 in September from minus 9 in June, the Bank of Japan said. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Phuket Strives to Recover from Tsunami, Financial Crisis: Video
fields.description: Dec. 24 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Stephen Engle reports on the recovery of Phuket's tourism and real estate markets following the global financial crisis and 2004 tsunami. More than 8000 people were killed, or are still missing in Thailand from the Boxing Day tsunami five years ago. Tourism took a hit, and the islands once booming property market hasnt been the same since, being jolted as well by political and economic crises. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Kelley Sees Progress in Japan Nuclear Health Precautions: Video
fields.description: March 14 (Bloomberg) -- Robert Kelley, nuclear engineer and former contractor for the US Department of Energy, discusses the damage and safety of Tokyo Electric Power Co.'s Fukushima Dai-Ichi nuclear plant. Kelley, speaking with Deirdre Bolton on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack," also talks about the outlook for nuclear energy following the March 11 Japanese earthquake and tsunami. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Phuket Strives to Recover from Tsunami, Financial Crisis: Video
fields.description: Dec. 24 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Stephen Engle reports on the recovery of Phuket's tourism and real estate markets following the global financial crisis and 2004 tsunami. More than 8000 people were killed, or are still missing in Thailand from the Boxing Day tsunami five years ago. Tourism took a hit, and the islands once booming property market hasnt been the same after being jolted as well by political and economic crises. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Lynch Says Quake Recovery Efforts May Aid Japan Economy
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Michael Lynch, president of Strategic Energy & Economic Research, discusses the impact of the earthquake in Japan on oil prices and that nation's economy. Lynch, speaking with Mark Crumpton on Bloomberg Television's "Bottom Line," also talks about the long-term prospects for Japan's economy. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Lehr Says Damaged Nuclear Plants Will Cause Minimal Harm
fields.description: March 15 (Bloomberg) -- Jay Lehr, science director for the Heartland Institute, talks about the potential risks to the public from the earthquake-damaged nuclear plants in Japan. Radiation levels rose following a series of explosions and fire at Tokyo Electric Power Co.'s Fukushima Dai-Ichi nuclear power plant after the March 11 earthquake and ensuing tsunami. Lehr speaks with Deirdre Bolton on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Global Aid Pours Into Haiti in Search for Survivors: Video
fields.description: Jan. 15 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Peter Green reports on the relief efforts following a 7.0 magnitude earthquake in Haiti on Jan. 12. Rescuers from around the world poured into Haiti today, overwhelming the countrys only international airport. Almost 48 hours after the tremor hit the capital, Port-au-Prince, thousands of people wandered the citys streets or dug to rescue those trapped beneath collapsed structures. The Red Cross estimates as many as 50000 people may have died. Bloomberg's Bernard Lo also speaks. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Pietrangelo Says US Has `Very Good' Nuclear Safety Record
fields.description: March 14 (Bloomberg) -- Anthony Pietrangelo, senior vice president and chief nuclear officer of the Nuclear Energy Institute, talks about the outlook for the nuclear energy industry following the March 11 Japanese earthquake. Workers are battling to prevent a nuclear meltdown at Tokyo Electric Power Co.'s Fukushima Dai-Ichi nuclear plant after the 8.9-magnitude temblor and ensuing tsunami. Pietrangelo speaks with Peter Cook on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: World Vision's Blank Says Ruined Roads Slowing Haiti Aid
fields.description: Jan. 14 (Bloomberg) -- Laura Blank, World Visions media relations manager, talks with Bloomberg's Anastasia Haydulina about the relief operation following the earthquake in Haiti. The United Nations and international aid groups said time is running out to pull thousands of people trapped beneath collapsed buildings in the capital by the countrys worst quake in more than a century. Blanks speaks from the Dominican Republic.

fields.title: Okubo Says Japan's V-Shaped Recovery `Almost Completed'
fields.description: Aug. 15 (Bloomberg) -- Takuji Okubo, chief Japan economist at Societe Generale SA in Tokyo, speaks about the nation's economy and currency. Japan's economy contracted less than economists estimated in the second quarter, signaling the country is rebounding from a slump after a record earthquake and tsunami even as a rising yen threatens to slow exports. Okubo speaks with Susan Li on Bloomberg Television's "First Up." (Okubo spoke before Japan released its gross domestic product data for the fiscal second quarter. Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Tepco Faces Protests at First Meeting Since Disaster
fields.description: June 28 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Mike Firn reports from Tokyo on Tokyo Electric Power Co.'s shareholders' meeting. Tepco, as the utility is known, faces shareholders for the first time since the March 11 earthquake and tsunami caused meltdowns at its Fukushima Dai-Ichi plant, wiping about $36 billion off its market value. Firn speaks to Rishaad Salamat on Bloomberg Television's "On the Move Asia." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Kelley Says Japan Has `Lost Control' of Nuclear Problem
fields.description: March 17 (Bloomberg) -- Robert Kelley, a nuclear engineer, discusses efforts to cool Japan's earthquake-stricken Fukushima Dai-Ichi nuclear plant. Kelley speaks from Vienna with Erik Schatzker on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Japan's Stricken Nuclear Power Plant Rocked By Blasts
fields.description: March 15 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg reporter Stuart Biggs speaks about Japan's nuclear crisis after Tokyo Electric Power Co.'s stricken nuclear power plant was today rocked by two further explosions and a fire as workers struggled to avert the risk of a meltdown. Biggs, traveling north of Tokyo, speaks with Erik Schatzker on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Powerful Quake Rocks Japan, Triggers Deadly Tsunami
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Japan was struck by its strongest earthquake in at least a century, an 8.9-magnitude temblor that shook buildings across Tokyo and unleashed a tsunami as high as 10 meters, engulfing towns along the northern coast. At least 26 people were killed by the 33-foot wave and many are missing, according to state broadcaster NHK Television. Bloomberg's Mike Firn reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Murakami Says Current Yen Level May Spur Intervention
fields.description: Aug. 3 (Bloomberg) -- Naoki Murakami, chief economist at Monex Group Inc. in Tokyo, talks about the value of the yen and its implications for the country's economy and central bank monetary policy. Japanese officials are concerned the yen's strength will hurt domestic companies and undermine the nation's recovery from the March 11 earthquake and tsunami, the Nikkei newspaper reported, without saying where it got the information. Murakami speaks with Susan Li on Bloomberg Television's "First Up." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Fujitsu Research's Schulz on Japan's Economy, Yen
fields.description: Jan. 25 (Bloomberg) -- Martin Schulz, a senior economist at Fujitsu Research Institute in Tokyo, talks about Japan's economy and the yen. Japan's exports fell for the third consecutive month in December, capping the first annual trade deficit in 31 years, figures underscoring the toll slower global growth and March's earthquake have taken on the economy. Schulz speaks with Susan Li on Bloomberg Television's "First Up." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Roach, El-Erian, Geithner Own Words on Japan Economy
fields.description: March 17 (Bloomberg) -- Stephen Roach, non-executive chairman of Morgan Stanley Asia Ltd., Mohamed El-Erian, chief executive officer of Pacific Investment Management Co., and US Treasury Secretary Timothy Geithner speak about the economic impact of the March 11 earthquake and tsunami in Japan on the country and the rest of the world. This report also includes comments from Joao Vale de Almeida, the European Union's ambassador to the US, Citigroup Inc.'s Willem Buiter and Credit Suisse Asset Management's Stefan Keitel. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Haitian Violence Hampers Earthquake Relief Efforts: Video
fields.description: Jan. 18 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Chris Dolmetsch reports on the violence in Haiti hampering the assistance of earthquake victims as the US, the United Nations and aid groups work to deliver supplies to victims of the earthquake that ravaged the Western Hemispheres poorest nation on Jan. 12. Bloomberg's Bernard Lo also speaks. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Woo Says Nuclear Plants Must Reevaluate Tsunami Risk
fields.description: March 16 (Bloomberg) -- Gordon Woo, a catastrophist at Risk Management Solutions, discusses the need for nuclear power-plant operators to reevaluate tsunami risk in the wake of Japan's 9-magnitude earthquake that struck last week. Woo speaks from London with Erik Schatzker on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Japan Quake Forces Evacuation Near Nuclear Reactor
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Residents near a Tokyo Electric Power Co. nuclear reactor were ordered to evacuate because of a possible radiation leak as Japan's strongest earthquake in a century shut power plants and oil refineries. About 1800 residents living within 2 kilometers (1.2 miles) of the Fukushima Dai-Ichi No. 1 reactor were ordered to evacuate. Bloomberg's John Brinsley reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: UN Members Increase Pledges of Aid for Pakistan Floods
fields.description: Aug. 20 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Simin Demokan reports on the Pakistan flood and the pledges of international aid from members of the United Nations including the US, UK and the European Union.

fields.title: Japan Rattled by 7.4 Quake, Tsunami Warning Issued
fields.description: April 7 (Bloomberg) -- A magnitude 7.4 earthquake hit 215 miles (345 kilometers) northeast of Tokyo, resulting in warnings of a possible tsunami. The quake was measured at a depth of about 25 miles and struck about 11:32 pm local time, the US Geological Survey reported on its website. Bloomberg's Brian Fowler talks about the quake with Margaret Brennan on Bloomberg Television's "InBusiness." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Devastation, Confusion in Sendai Amid Nuclear Fears
fields.description: March 16 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Stuart Biggs speaks from the airport in Sendai, Japan, about the impact of the March 11 tsunami and resulting nuclear crisis on the region. Japan was hit by a 5.7-magnitude aftershock and a second fire at the stricken Fukushima nuclear plant as the government struggled to overcome the aftermath of the nation's strongest earthquake on record. Linzie Janis also speaks. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Panasonic Plans Energy-Efficient `Smart Town' in Japan
fields.description: July 25 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Mike Firn reports from Fujisawa, Japan, about Panasonic Corp.'s plans for the nation's first so-called smart town, which will showcase the company's household technologies. The plans are part of Panasonic's effort to expand business built on energy-related products and to cut its reliance on television sales, as intensified competition erodes prices. Japan's worst earthquake and tsunami cut power supplies across the country and boosted demand for energy-saving devices. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Japan Hit by 8.9 Maginitude Earthquake, 10-Meter Tsunami
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Mike Firn reports from Tokyo on the 8.9-magnitude earthquake that struck off the coast of northern Japan. Mark Barton also speaks on Bloomberg Television's "Countdown."

fields.title: Japan Hit by 8.9 Maginitude Earthquake, 10-Meter Tsunami
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Mike Firn reports from Tokyo on the 8.9-magnitude earthquake that struck off the coast of northern Japan. Mark Barton also speaks on Bloomberg Television's "Countdown."

fields.title: Unicef's Hahn Says Quake Casualties in Haiti Are Rising
fields.description: Jan. 13 (Bloomberg) -- Tamar Hahn, regional director for Latin America at the United Nations Children's Fund, Unicef, talks with Bloomberg's Anastasia Haydulina about the 7.0 magnitude earthquake that struck Haiti. The temblor hit 10 miles (16 kilometers) southwest of the capital Port-au-Prince, a city with about 2 million inhabitants. Thousands of people are dead or missing. Hahn speaks from Panama.

fields.title: Matthews Says Japan Will Sell Some US Treasury Assets
fields.description: March 15 (Bloomberg) -- Shawn Matthews, chief executive officer of Cantor Fitzgerald & Co., discusses the outlook for Federal Reserve monetary policy ahead of today's Federal Open Market Committee meeting and the likelihood the Bank of Japan may sell US Treasuries to help fund recovery from last week's earthquake and tsunami. Matthews, speaking with Suzanne O'Halloran on Bloomberg Television's "Fast Forward," also discusses Cantor Fitzgerald's expansion strategy. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Mubashar Says Over 6 Million People Need Aid in Pakistan: Video
fields.description: Aug. 18 (Bloomberg) -- Oxfam International's Mubashar Hasan speaks from Islamabad about aid efforts for victims of Pakistan's floods. More than 3 million children are at high risk of deadly water-borne diseases in Pakistan, making them the most vulnerable victims of one of the worst natural disasters in history, the United Nations Children's Fund said. Mubashar speaks with Linzie Janis on Bloomberg Television's "Global Connection." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Hasan Discusses Pakistan Flood Devastation, Aid Outlook: Video
fields.description: Aug. 19 (Bloomberg) -- Lama Hasan of ABC News reports on the devastation caused by floods in Pakistan. The Obama administration is increasing its emergency aid to Pakistan as US Secretary of State Hillary Clinton calls upon other nations to step up humanitarian assistance to the flood-ravaged country. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Kan Tasked With Averting Japan Recession, Debt Crisis: Video
fields.description: Jan. 7 (Bloomberg) -- Naoto Kan became Japans sixth finance minister in 18 months, tasked with preventing a relapse into the nations worst postwar recession as deflation threatens to erode companies earnings. Kan, the 63-year-old deputy prime minister, was named by premier Yukio Hatoyama yesterday in Tokyo to replace Hirohisa Fujii, who stepped down over ill health. Bloomberg's John Brinsley reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Tsunami-Hit Miyagi's Governor Has Recipe for Rebirth
fields.description: Oct. 13 (Bloomberg) -- Yoshihiro Murai, governor of Miyagi, the prefecture that was the ground zero of the March 11 earthquake and tsunami, wants to turn 120 miles (200 kilometers) of wrecked coastline into the country's most attractive investment spot. Murai says he wants to create a model economy in Miyagi that could be replicated in Japan's 46 other prefectures. Bloomberg Television's Mike Firn reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Royal Asscher Expects Post-Quake Diamond Demand to Rise
fields.description: July 18 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Mike Firn reports on Royal Asscher Japan Ltd's expectations for diamond sales following Japan's worst-ever earthquake in March. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Kan Tasked With Averting Japan Recession, Debt Crisis: Video
fields.description: Jan. 7 (Bloomberg) -- Naoto Kan, Japan's sixth finance minister in 18 months, is handed the job of preventing a relapse into the nation's worst postwar recession while containing its debt. Kan, the 63-year-old deputy prime minister, was named by premier Yukio Hatoyama yesterday to replace Hirohisa Fujii, who stepped down over ill health. Bloomberg's Mike Firn reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Okubo Expects `Flat' Japan Growth in Second Quarter
fields.description: June 13 (Bloomberg) -- Takuji Okubo, chief Japan economist at Societe Generale SA in Tokyo, talks about the outlook for the country's economy. Japan's machinery orders fell for the first time in four months in April, an indication that companies are reluctant to spend after the March 11 earthquake and tsunami. Okubo speaks from Tokyo with Susan Li on Bloomberg Television's "First Up." (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: French Ties to Haiti Remain Strong With Relief Efforts: Video
fields.description: Jan. 22 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Isabelle Mas reports on the relief efforts from France to aid Haiti's recovery from the Jan. 12 earthquake. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Aftershocks Continue in Japan; Rain May Spread Radiation
fields.description: March 16 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Margaret Conley in Tokyo reports the latest news on the crisis in Japan. A second fire in as many days broke out at a Japanese reactor hours after more earthquakes struck a country battling to avert a nuclear meltdown following last week's record magnitude earthquake and tsunami. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Wong Says Japan Quake Should Not Impact Core Inflation
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Simon Wong, an economist at Standard Chartered Plc, discusses the potential impact of the 8.9-magnitude earthquake in Japan on food prices. Wong, speaking from Hong Kong with Deirdre Bolton on Bloomberg Television's "InsideTrack," also talks about Bank of Japan monetary policy. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Anti-Nuclear Sentiment in Europe Tests Industry's Future
fields.description: March 28 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Poppy Trowbridge reports on the rise of anti-nuclear sentiment in Germany and France since the crisis at the Fukushima Dai-Ichi power plant following the earthquake in Japan.

fields.title: Japan's Kan Resigns After Backlash Over Quake Leadership
fields.description: Aug. 26 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Margaret Conley reports from Tokyo on the resignation of Japanese Prime Minister Naoto Kan after 14 months on the job. Kan was undone by a backlash over his leadership after the March 11 earthquake and tsunami spawned the nation's deepest postwar crisis. Linzie Janis also speaks. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Aid Donations Go Further When Disasters Are In the News
fields.description: Jan. 18 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Ryan Chilcote reports on the cost to charities of delivering aid to earthquake-struck Haiti and other natural disaster zones. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Wyclef Jean Discusses Haiti Earthquake Relief Efforts: Video
fields.description: Feb. 12 (Bloomberg) -- Wyclef Jean, Grammy Award-winning musician and producer, talks with Bloomberg Television about Haiti earthquake relief efforts. Haiti faces a major food crisis due to a lack of support for farmers who begin planting in March for a harvest that usually produces 60 percent of the nations grains, fruits and vegetables, the United Nations said. Bloomberg's Matt Miller also speaks. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Commuters Stranded After Japan Earthquake, Tsunami
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- Tokyo's subway system, the world's busiest with about 8 million riders a day, shut down after today's 8.9-magnitude quake and tsunami struck the city, leaving commuters to wait hours for taxis or search for somewhere to spend the night. Retail store shelves were also left empty as victims struggled to buy supplies and food amid the disaster. Police say 60 people were killed and 56 are missing, according to the Associated Press. Bloomberg's Mike Firn reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Coach, Tiffany, Aflac Risk Japan Sales Drop After Quake
fields.description: March 15 (Bloomberg) -- Coach Inc. leather handbags, and Tiffany & Co. jewelry are among the products from US companies at risk for lost sales in Japan after the country's worst earthquake ever. At number of companies including Aflac Inc., Rambus Inc., Coach and Tiffany & Co. had substantial sales from Japan in 2010, according to data compiled by Bloomberg. Bloomberg's Scarlet Fu and Erik Schatzker report. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Magnitude 6.6 Quake Strikes Japan's Tohoku Region
fields.description: April 11 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Zeb Eckert reports from Tokyo on Japan's latest earthquake. A 6.6-magnitude quake hit the country's Tohoku region, southwest of Iwaki, the United States Geological Survey said. The tremor shook buildings in downtown Tokyo. Eckert speaks with Maryam Nemazee on Bloomberg Television's "The Pulse." (Eckert's report came before the USGS revised the size of the earthquake from 7.1 to 6.6. Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Nikkei Tumbles on Quake; Toyota Halts Japan Production: Video
fields.description: March 15 (Bloomberg) -- Jane King summarizes the top stories this morning on the Bloomberg Business Report. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: US West Coast on Alert After Tsunami Devastates Japan
fields.description: March 11 (Bloomberg) -- The tsunami that slammed Japan hit Hawaii early today, and waves were spreading as people along the island chain's coast evacuated and warnings were issued for US West Coast states. Hawaii was hit by a 1-meter (39-inch) wave, according to scientists at the Pacific Tsunami Warning Center. The first tsunami waves are expected to hit the Western coast of the US before Noon EST, according to the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. Bloomberg's Michael McKee reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: `Hope For Haiti' Raises Millions; O'Brien Has Last Show: Video
fields.description: Jan. 25 (Bloomberg) -- Bloomberg's Matt Miller reports on the weekend's breaking media news in today's edition of Media Monday. (Source: Bloomberg) (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Haiti Quake Survivor Says IPhone Helped Save His Life: Video
fields.description: Jan. 20 (Bloomberg) -- Dan Woolley, an American who survived the Jan. 12 earthquake in Haiti, credited Apple Inc.'s iPhone for helping him stay alive while he was trapped in the rubble of his hotel. Bloomberg's Lori Rothman reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: USGS Says Magnitude 6.8 Quake at Offshore Bio-Bio, Chile: Video
fields.description: March 5 (Bloomberg) -- An earthquake with a preliminary magnitude of 6.8 was recorded off the Chilean coast near Bio-Bio, about 30 kilometers (18 miles) northwest of Concepcion, the US Geological Survey said on its Web site. Bloomberg's Betty Liu reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: Japan Won't Tax Foreign Companies in Disaster Zone
fields.description: Oct. 19 (Bloomberg) -- Japan's National Strategy Minister Motohisa Furukawa talks about the government's efforts to reconstruct the nation from damages caused by the March 11 earthquake and tsunami. Furukawa said Japan won't impose taxes on foreign companies who set up new operations in areas hit by the March 11 earthquake and nuclear disaster for five years to encourage investment. He speaks at a Bloomberg Link conference in Tokyo. (Translated excerpt. Source: Bloomberg)

fields.title: BBC Science: Preparing for Disaster - Earthquake Storms
fields.description: Although there is still time to prepare for the potential disaster in Istanbul, to strengthen structures and create an evacuation plan, scientists worry that their words of warning might not be heard by the residents who cannot afford to miss a day of work for a prediction that might not come true. Watch more Earthquake Storms videos with BBC worldwide here: www.youtube.com

fields.title: BBC Nature: Mega Tsunami - Landslide Analysis
fields.description: Scientists test a theory on how a mega tsunami is made, and how it builds up enough momentum to wage war on a coastline.

fields.title: BBC Nature: Mega Tsunami - Evidence of Destruction
fields.description: Scientists uncover evidence of disastrous damage to the coastline at Lituya Bay. Analysis of tree rings from the tree trim line show evidence of an impossibly high wave - a Mega Tsunami. Watch MORE Mega Tsunami videos with BBC Worldwide here: www.youtube.com

fields.title: BBC Nature: Mega Tsunami - Hawaii - The Tsunami Creator?
fields.description: Scientists discuss how the repeated landslides on the volcanic island of Hawaii may be evidence that the land itself is a Mega Tsunami creator.

fields.title: BBC Nature: Mega Tsunami - Alaskan Super Wave - Amazing Survival
fields.description: Two survivors of a Mega Tsunami tell their stories of the day the 1/2km high wave hit Lituya Bay.

fields.title: Bhola Cyclone - Superstorm - BBC
fields.description: The team use the weather pattern technology to look at what happened with the Bhola Cyclne in 1970. The destructive force of the storm caused thousands of deaths. From the BBC show, Superstorm. Contains scenes which some viewers may find upsetting. Watch more high quality videos on the new BBC Worldwide YouTube channel here: www.youtube.com

fields.title: Ants create a lifeboat in the Amazon jungle - BBC wildlife
fields.description: A flood hits a fire ant colony in the Amazon jungle. An amazing chance to see footage on how the species has adapted to water to protect their queen. From the BBC.

fields.title: Great natural wonders - the Twelve Apostles, Melbourne, Australia - David Attenborough - BBC
fields.description: David Attenborough narrates this video clip showing the Twelve Apostles off the coast of Melbourne Australia. Amazing rock formations rising out of the ocean. From BBC.

fields.title: Haiti Voodoo - how to make a zombie - Secret Life of Ghosts & Werewolves
fields.description: BBC show 'Secret Life of Ghosts and Werewolves' takes a spooky journey to Haiti to see a festival of the dead. Can witchdoctors raise the dead and create zombies? Make up your own mind with this chilling video!

fields.title: Simon Pegg on 'Run, Fat Boy, Run' - BBC Breakfast - BBC One
fields.description: www.bbc.co.uk Simon Pegg joins BBC Breakfast to talk about his latest film 'Run, Fat Boy, Run'. Wake up to Breakfast every morning from 6am to 9.15am on BBC One and 8.30am on BBC News 24.

fields.title: EastEnders Children in Need Special 2009 HD - BBC
fields.description: To donate go to www.bbc.co.uk Don't just watch - donate as it's all to raise money for BBC Children in Need and continue helping disadvantaged children and young people across the UK.

fields.title: Northern Lights - The Sky At Night - BBC Four
fields.description: Dr Chris Lintott travels to a radar facility in northern Norway to discover how the magical Aurora Borealis are created.

fields.title: DEC Pakistan Floods Appeal - BBC
fields.description: For donations: www.dec.org.uk John McCarthy presents an appeal on behalf of the Disasters Emergency Committee for the survivors of the floods in Pakistan.

fields.title: How Earthquakes Trigger Tsunamis - Bang Goes The Theory, Preview - BBC One
fields.description: www.bbc.co.uk Follow Bang on Twitter @bbcbang and #bbcbang. Jem Stansfield explains how pent-up energy between tectonic plates can cause a tsunami when it is eventually released.

fields.title: Irish Billionaire Invests in Haitian Reconstruction - From Haiti's Ashes - BBC Two
fields.description: More about this programme: www.bbc.co.uk Irish telecomms billionaire Denis O'Brien explains why he is funding the reconstruction of the Iron Market in Port-Au-Prince, which was destroyed by the earthquake that devastated Haiti in January 2010.

fields.title: Log Running Challenge - Last Woman Standing - Series 1 Episode 2 Preview - BBC Three
fields.description: More about this episode: www.bbc.co.uk The Xavante tribe run for kilometres under the blistering Brazilian sun with a fifty kilo log on their back in the ultimate relay race. How will our very Western girls cope when they take on tribal women at their own sport? Tuesday 16th Feb, 9pm, BBC3.

fields.title: Highlights of 'Hope for Haiti Now' Concert
fields.description: George Clooney hosts a star-studded telethon feauring Madonna, U2, Bruce Springsteen and dozens more to raise money to help earthquake victims in Haiti. (Jan. 22)

fields.title: A Haitian Dream: I Want More for My Kids
fields.description: As the one year anniversary of the devastating earthquake in Haiti nears, many Haitians still have trouble getting used to their new reality. Many, including taxi driver Isaac Michel-Ange just want a better future for their children. (Jan. 10)

fields.title: Video Essay: the Long Trip Home to Haiti
fields.description: His spine was crushed in the Haiti earthquake. And yet college student Bazelais Suy was one of the lucky ones. Suy met an American trauma surgeon brought him to Chicago. Produced by Martha Irvine. (Sept. 7)

fields.title: Images of Disaster: Haiti's Worst Day
fields.description: Estimates of the number of dead from yesterday's quake in Haiti are now running into the hundreds of thousands. AP photographers have captured the devastation. (Jan. 13)

fields.title: Images of Disaster: Haiti's Worst Day
fields.description: Estimates of the number of dead from yesterday's quake in Haiti are now running into the hundreds of thousands. AP photographers have captured the devastation. (Jan. 13)

fields.title: Photographer Looks Back at Surviving Haiti Quake
fields.description: Dan Woolley was in the Hotel Montana in Port-au-Prince last January when Haiti was struck by a massive earthquake. He was rescued days later, after living in the hotel's elevator. He looks back at his ordeal, with the AP's Rich Matthews. (Jan. 10)

fields.title: Stars Comment on 'Hope for Haiti Now' Concert
fields.description: Performers and celebrities speak out at the "Hope for Haiti Now" telethon organized by George Clooney. (Jan. 23)

fields.title: Raw Video: National Guard Trucks Submerged
fields.description: A witness captured video of two National Guard trucks attempting to drive through the streets of Manville, New Jersey after Hurricane Irene flooded the area. The water so deep that the only the vehicle's roofs can be seen at one point. (Aug. 29)

fields.title: After Devastating Quake, What Is Next for Haiti?
fields.description: Haiti's great earthquake may be an opportunity to rebuild and re-boot a state which has largely failed its own people. The AP's John Mone spoke with some of Haiti's intellectual and financial elite about how to redevelop the country. (Jan. 26)

fields.title: First Person: Haiti Reporter Looks Back
fields.description: On Jan. 12, 2010 Jonathan Katz was the only American reporter working full time in Haiti. One year after the devastating earthquake rocked Port Au Prince, Katz looks back at that day, at what has happened since and what the future holds. (Jan. 7)

fields.title: Haitian Artists Turn Disaster Into Beauty
fields.description: One year after the devastating earthquake destroyed Haiti, widespread despair remains. But, one group of artists is turning that disaster into beauty. The AP's Rich Matthews has their story. (Jan. 12)

fields.title: Japan Two Weeks On: Disaster Impact Devastating
fields.description: As the clean-up continues across the worst earthquake and tsunami hit areas a suspected breach in a reactor core at the stricken Fukushima nuclear plant could mean more serious radioactive contamination. (March 25)

fields.title: Fresh Warnings Over Pakistan Flood Recovery
fields.description: Officials warn it would be two more weeks until Pakistan's flood waters recede, three months until direct aid is no longer needed, and three years until the country recovers. The prime minister said the health system is damaged. (24 August 2010)

fields.title: Japan Rattled by Aftershocks Month After Tsunami
fields.description: A strong new quake and other aftershocks rattled northeastern Japan hours after the country somberly marked one month since a deadly combination of quake and tsunami laid waste to the region. (April 11)

fields.title: UN Says Millions Without Help in Pakistan Floods
fields.description: The World Bank has pledged 900 million dollars to help flood-devastated Pakistan, but the UN warned Tuesday that millions of victims in the country are still waiting for help. (August 17)

fields.title: George Clooney on 'Hope for Haiti' Telethon
fields.description: George Clooney gives a preview of the 'Hope for Haiti' benefit telethon he's helping to organize to help victims of the earthquake in Haiti. (Jan. 21)

fields.title: Bush, Clinton Join Obama in Aiding Haiti
fields.description: President Barack Obama is asking former Presidents George W. Bush and Bill Clinton to coordinate efforts to involve more Americans in the recovery and rebuilding effort that's needed in Haiti. (Jan. 16)

fields.title: Raw Video: Tsunami Arrives, People Flee
fields.description: Amateur video captures the force of the tsunami's arrival in Japan. The waves devastate entire blocks in Miyagi Prefecture, with some residents narrowly escaping, as captured by this photographer. (March 14)

fields.title: Expert: Too Early to Criticize Japan Nuke Crisis
fields.description: A nuclear policy expert tells the AP that while any number of nuclear-related deaths in Japan would be too many, last Friday's tsunami is likely to prove significantly more devastating to human life than the reactor incident. (March 15)

fields.title: Raw Video: Surfer Films Indonesia Tsunami Panic
fields.description: AP Television has obtained exclusive access to dramatic video of the moment the tsunami struck Indonesia, filmed by a Chilean surfer who was on North Pagai in the Mentawai island chain on Monday when the wall of water slammed ashore. (Oct. 29)

fields.title: Missing Teen Natalee Holloway Declared Dead
fields.description: The parents of Natalee Holloway looked on somberly as a judge on Thursday declared their child dead, more than six years after the American teenager vanished during a high school graduation trip to the Caribbean island of Aruba. (Jan. 12)

fields.title: US Soldier Returns to His Native Haiti for Relief Effort
fields.description: Junior Florestal and his family left Haiti for Florida when he was 13. Now he's back in his homeland as a member of the US Army, assisting with earthquake relief efforts. (Jan. 17)

fields.title: Extreme World Weather: Natural Disasters Linked
fields.description: From mudslides in China to flood ravaged Pakistan, the planet seems to be having a climate breakdown. Scientists say floods, fires and heat aren't just a portent of things to come but a sign of troubling climate change already under way. (August 12)

fields.title: Tsunami-tossed Ships Rescued in Japan
fields.description: Wreckage remains strewn across one of Japan's ports, three months after it was slammed by a giant wave, as the slow process of recovery continues. Cranes are busy helping to lift beached ships back into the water in Kesennuma. (June 17)
