fields.title: US Altering Its Images in Flooded Pakistan
fields.description: Associated Press reporter Chris Brummitt says the US is offering more aid than any other country to flood-stricken Pakistan and those offerings are helping it change its image there. (Aug. 17)

fields.title: Haitians Praise God After Apocalyptic Quake
fields.description: Drumbeats called the faithful to a Sunday Mass praising God amid a scene resembling the Apocalypse-- a collapsed cathedral in a city cloaked with the smell of death and rattled by gunfire. (Jan. 17)

fields.title: Devastated Japan Still Reeling From Disaster
fields.description: A devastated Japan was struggling to cope Monday in the wake of last week's earthquake and tsunami that have wreaked destruction on the country's northeast coast. (March 14)

fields.title: Deadly Flooding Spreads to Pakistan's Heartland
fields.description: Deadly flood waters were spreading to villages in Pakistan's heartland Tuesday, forcing more people to evacuate their homes and threatening food supplies for many. High water was also threatening a major dam in the country's northwest. (August 3)

fields.title: Pakistan Flood Waters Still Rising
fields.description: Flood waters were still rising in parts of Pakistan Wednesday, weeks after heavy rains started deluging the country. The aid effort was ramping up, to reach out to millions affected by the disaster. (Aug. 18)

fields.title: Google Maps Out Improvements
fields.description: As Apple reportedly prepares to roll out its own, internally developed navigation service for iPhones and iPads later this year, Google unveiled improvements to its competing Google Maps program. (June 6) Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: World Rushing Aid to Haiti After Quake
fields.description: Countries around the world were rushing aid to quake-devastated Haiti on Wednesday. Search and rescue teams and medical personnel, equipment and facilities were among the top priorities. (Jan 13)

fields.title: On Eve of Haiti Quake Anniversary Little Change
fields.description: Driving through the streets of Haiti's capital you'll notice one thing, very little has changed since a catastrophic earthquake brought Port-au-Prince to its knees one year ago. (Jan. 6)

fields.title: Raw Video: Haiti's Key Landmark to Be Rebuilt
fields.description: Haiti's once-spectacular National Palace, which became a crumpled symbol of the earthquake that devastated Haiti more than two years ago, is to be re-built, the president Michel Martelly announced on Wednesday. (Aug. 22)

fields.title: Deadly Flash Floods Add to NE Australia Misery
fields.description: Flash floods swept across weary Queensland, Australia Monday, boosting the death toll from the high water that has been devastating the state since before Christmas. But there were dramatic rescues, some of which were caught on camera. (10 January 2010)

fields.title: Prayer and Mourning in Haiti a Year After Quake
fields.description: Haiti's capital turned quiet Wednesday as prayer services marked the anniversary of the country's worst natural disaster in history. John Mone reports. (Jan. 12)

fields.title: Raw Video: Japan 8 Months After the Tsunami
fields.description: Aerial views of tsunami-battered Japanese seaside communities showed an eerie flattened moonscape on Friday, eight months after Japan's March 11 disaster. (Nov. 18)

fields.title: Pakistan Still Reels at Scale of Flood Disaster
fields.description: Those displaced and those returning home in the wake of the floods in Pakistan are trying to cope as best they can. Aid agencies said Wednesday they are still trying to ramp up assistance efforts, but they need more outside help. (August 25)

fields.title: Japan PM: Quake, Tsunami Worst Crisis Since WWII
fields.description: People across a devastated swath of Japan suffered for a third day Sunday without water, electricity and proper food, as the country grappled with the enormity of a massive earthquake and tsunami that may have left more than 10000 people dead. (March 13)

fields.title: Volcano, Tsunami Deaths Mount in Indonesia
fields.description: Indonesia's most volatile volcano has erupted Tuesday, spewing smoke and hot ash into the air. The death toll was climbing at Mount Merapi, and also to the west where an earthquake triggered a tsunami Monday. (Oct. 26)

fields.title: Quake Victims' NY Relatives: 'Not Knowing Is the Worst Part'
fields.description: Haitian-Americans with family living in smaller towns outside of Port-au-Prince are putting out a desperate call for any information about their loved ones. They say not knowing if their relatives are suffering is the worst part. (Jan. 14)

fields.title: Powerful Quake, Tsunami Kills Hundreds in Japan
fields.description: Japan's northeastern coast was a swampy wasteland of broken houses, overturned cars, sludge and dirty water Saturday as the nation awoke to the of a powerful tsunami created by one of the strongest earthquakes ever recorded. (March 11)

fields.title: Nuclear Expert: Situation in Japan Is Dire
fields.description: Japan is working to avert a catastrophic release of radiation. The troubles at the Fukushima Dai-ichi complex started when last Friday's quake and tsunami knocked out power, crippling cooling systems needed to avoid a nuclear fuel meltdown. (March 14)

fields.title: Raw Video: Japan's Earthquake As Seen From Above
fields.description: A massive earthquake in northern Japan has unleashed a 23-foot tsunami that swept away boats, cars and buildings. The 8.9-magnitude quake is one of the strongest ever to hit Japan. (March 11)

fields.title: Justin Bieber Visits Victims of Japan Earthquake
fields.description: Justin Bieber met with victims of the Japan earthquake and tsunami in Tokyo on Wednesday. He wished nine students from the hardest hit areas of Iwate, Miyagi and Fukushima a brighter future and invited them to his upcoming shows in Japan. (May 18)

fields.title: Floods Devastate Pakistan's Crops
fields.description: Floodwaters in recent weeks have wrecked Pakistan's crops. The UN said six million people may be in need of food assistance. (August 11)

fields.title: Raw Video: Powerful Quake in Northern Italy
fields.description: One of the strongest earthquakes to shake northern Italy rattled the region around Bologna early Sunday, a magnitude-6.0 temblor that toppled some buildings and sent residents running into the streets, emergency services and news reports said. (May 20) Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: Raw Video: Moment of Massive Japanese Quake
fields.description: A tsunami warning has been extended to the entire US West Coast following a massive earthquake that slammed Japan's eastern coast. Friday's 8.9 magnitude jolt struck offshore and was followed by more than 20 aftershocks. (March 11)

fields.title: Raw Video: Tsunami Wave Smashes Boats and Cars
fields.description: Dramatic new pictures have emerged of a tsunami wave smashing into the Japanese town of Miyako on Friday. The wave crashes over the seawall carrying away everything in its path, including cars and boats. (March 13)

fields.title: Aid Groups Struggle to Get Food, Water to Haitians
fields.description: Aid workers hoping to distribute food, water and other supplies to a shattered Port-au-Prince are warning their efforts may need more security Friday as Haitians grow increasingly desperate and impatient for help. (Jan. 15)

fields.title: US: Billions Needed for Pakistan Flood Victims
fields.description: The world is ramping up assistance to flood-ravaged Pakistan, 3 weeks after the crisis began. The US, Germany and Saudi Arabia all announced new pledges of aid, while Japan said it would send helicopters to help with food distribution. (Aug. 19)

fields.title: Ex-PM Kan: Japan Unprepared for Nuke Crisis
fields.description: Former PM Naoto Kan told the AP Friday that Japan was woefully unprepared for the nuclear crisis that sprang from the country's devastating earthquake and tsunami. He said Japan needs to dramatically cut its dependence on nuclear power. (Feb. 17) Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: Japan: Sadness Over Lost School Persists
fields.description: The hunt for the missing is continuing as sadness persists in Ishinomaki, a year after a tsunami slammed the Japanese community on the country's hard-hit northeast coast. The city's Okawa Elementary School lost 74 out of its 108 students. (March 7) Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: Japan: Sadness Over Lost School Persists
fields.description: The hunt for the missing is continuing as sadness persists in Ishinomaki, a year after a tsunami slammed the Japanese community on the country's hard-hit northeast coast. The city's Okawa Elementary School lost 74 out of its 108 students. (March 7) Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: Rangers Rally in 9th, Win Game 2 of World Series
fields.description: The Rangers rallied in the 9th inning to beat St. Louis Thursday night 2-1 and even the World Series at one game each. Josh Hamilton and Michael Young hit sacrifice flies to lead Texas to the win. (Oct. 21)

fields.title: Haitian Americans React to Devastating Earthquake
fields.description: Haitian-Americans, many of whom live in South Florida, are praying for good news after a devastating earthquake struck Haiti Tuesday. The earthquake registered a 7.0, toppling buildings and causing widespread damage. (Jan. 13)

fields.title: Hundreds Dead in Indonesia's Twin Disasters
fields.description: Indonesia was struggling to cope as the death toll was climbing from a tsunami and an erupting volcano. On Wednesday rescue crews with emergency supplies finally made it to the remote islands slammed by the giant wave. (Oct. 27)

fields.title: Raw Video: US Troops Arrive for Haiti Relief
fields.description: Hundreds of US troops arrived in Haiti Friday to help with the earthquake relief effort. Thousands more troops are en route. (Jan. 15)

fields.title: Raw Video: 1 Year Since Japan Quake, Tsunami
fields.description: People across Japan prayed and stood in silence on Sunday to remember the massive earthquake and tsunami that struck the nation one year ago, killing just over 19000 and unleashing the world's worst nuclear crisis in a quarter century. (March 11) Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: Fresh Flooding in Crisis Hit Pakistan
fields.description: As new floods cause further suffering for the population the US special envoy to Pakistan, Richard Holbrooke, visits the country for the first time since the natural disaster hit. (Sept. 15)

fields.title: Frantic Effort to Free Trapped in NZ Quake
fields.description: Office workers trapped under their collapsed buildings sent messages to the outside as rescuers with dogs scrambled to save them and dozens of others following a powerful earthquake that killed at least 65 in one of New Zealand's largest cities. (Feb. 22)

fields.title: Japan Marks 1 Year Since Quake, Tsunami Disaster
fields.description: Across Japan, people paused at 2:46 pm, the moment the magnitude-9.0 quake struck a year ago, for moments of silence, prayer and reflection about the enormous losses suffered and monumental tasks ahead. (March 11) Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: Surfer: Tsunami Was Like Runaway Train
fields.description: A Chilean surfer told The Associated Press that the tsunami in Indonesia hit like a runaway train. Supplying exclusive video, he said the giant waves battered the 3-story building where a group was sheltering. (Oct. 29)

fields.title: Raw Video: Japan's Devastation From Ground Level
fields.description: New video from Japan is showing the extent of the devastation from cities obliterated by both the quake and the following Tsunami. (March 14)

fields.title: Drought Crisis Growing in East Africa
fields.description: Somalis walking to find food and water are faced with a difficult and sometimes deadly journey in the face of a massive drought in the region. Aid agencies are calling for more assistance. (July 12)

fields.title: This Week in Haiti: Images of Horror
fields.description: Fears of unrest have been growing in Haiti, but survivors of Tuesday's earthquake are beginning to get relief supplies. AP photojournalists have been on the scene since Tuesday. (Jan. 15)

fields.title: Stricken Japan Nuke Plant Vulnerable: Manager
fields.description: The manager at Japan's Fukushima Dai-ichi nuclear plant said it was still vulnerable, nearly a year after a tsunami crippled the facility. A report made public Tuesday found the government had withheld the potential dangers of the disaster. (Feb. 28) Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: Gabriel: Haiti Aid Can Benefit From Technology
fields.description: Musician Peter Gabriel says technology offers tremendous potential for humanitarian relief efforts in Haiti. (Jan. 27)

fields.title: Meltdown Threat Rises at Japanese Nuclear Plant
fields.description: Radiation has been released into the environment at Japan's Fukushima Dai-ichi nuclear plant following a third explosion at the facility. Japan's prime minister is telling residents who live within 19 miles of the facility to stay indoors. (March 14)

fields.title: Quake Aftershocks 'a Concern' in Rescue Efforts
fields.description: A geophysicist with the US Geological Survey says he expects a large amount of damage and casualties in the aftermath of Tuesday's earthquake in Haiti. The 7.0 quake brought down major buildings, leaving several people trapped under the debris. (Jan. 12)

fields.title: Quake, Tsunami, Nuclear Crisis Overwhelm Japan
fields.description: Japan says an earthquake and tsunami overwhelmed its efforts to contain a growing crisis at nuclear power plants damaged by the disasters. But the nation's prime minister says the Japanese people need strength. (March 18)

fields.title: Lady Gaga Wants You to Visit Japan
fields.description: Lady Gaga attends a press conference, ahead of her appearance at the MTV Video Music Aid event, where she expressed her dedication to helping the Japanese people recover from the tsunami disaster. (June 23)

fields.title: Raw Video: More Flooding Threatens Pakistan
fields.description: As Pakistan authorities on Monday warned of more flooding to come in the week ahead, those displaced by the country's worst floods in recorded history struggle to find clean water, food and shelter. (Aug 16)

fields.title: Japan Quake Clouds Nuclear Future
fields.description: The explosions and fire at a Japanese plant have raised new questions about the safety of nuclear power, and may be a setback to President Barack Obama's belief it should play a major role in America. AP's Mark Smith reports. (March 15)

fields.title: Haiti Recovery Bogged Down 6 Months After Quake
fields.description: Six months after Haiti's devastating earthquake, hundreds of thousands of people remain homeless, living in refugee camps in the capital Port-au-Prince. (July 12)

fields.title: Raw Video:Search Continues for Tsunami Survivors
fields.description: Residents of northern Japanese cities devastated by the massive earthquake and following tsunami still face a long battle clearing mud from their flooded houses and streets. (23 March 2011)

fields.title: Haiti Quake Survivors Scratch by in Camp
fields.description: Survivors of the Haiti earthquake are trying to make do with few necessities and little shelter at a camp on a golf course. The AP's Ted Shaffrey found one man whose sole dream is to now leave the country. (Jan. 19)

fields.title: Raw Video: Politician's Murder Sparks Violence
fields.description: The killing of a politician sparked deadly violence in the Pakistani city of Karachi late on Monday, with local media reporting that as many as 40 people were killed and more than 50 were injured. (August 3)

fields.title: Flood-hit Australians See Devastation, More Rain
fields.description: Australians returning home after devastating floods in the eastern state of Queensland found mud and mess. Forecasters said more rain wasn't likely to made conditions worse, although water levels had yet to peak in at least one town. (Jan. 7)

fields.title: Flood Misery in Pakistan Again
fields.description: Pakistanis driven from their homes by high water have been waiting for international aid. Officials say at least 200 people have been killed and 200000 made homeless by flooding in Sindh province triggered by monsoon rains. (Sept. 14)

fields.title: Obama: Japan Quake Potentially 'catastrophic'
fields.description: President Barack Obama says the earthquake and tsunami in Japan are a potentially 'catastrophic' disaster, and he says his thoughts and prayers are with the Japanese people. (March 11)

fields.title: Tsunami, Volcano Toll Higher As Victims Buried
fields.description: The death toll was climbing from this week's deadly tsunami in Indonesia, and rescuers fear many were swept out to sea. Between the deadly wave and the volcano erupting across the country, officials said more than 400 people were killed. (Oct. 28)

fields.title: Indonesia Staggers to Recover After Disasters
fields.description: An earthquake-induced tsunami and a volcano batter the sprawling island nation of Indonesia, causing a scramble for aid and harrowing tales of survival. (Oct. 29)

fields.title: Japan Quake Serves As Reminder for California
fields.description: For years, Californians have been preparing for the next big earthquake. But the recent earthquake in Japan has been a painful reminder of the state's ongoing struggle with earthquake preparedness. (March 22)

fields.title: US Braces for Tsunami Debris, Impact Unclear
fields.description: More than a year after a tsunami devastated Japan, killing thousands and washing millions of tons of debris into the Pacific Ocean, neither the US government nor West Coast states have a clear plan for how to clean up the floating rubble. (June 8) Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: Global Economic Impact of Quake Muted for Now
fields.description: As Japan digs out from the country's worst disaster since world war II, its becoming clear that the economic impact will extend beyond Japanese shores. The extent of the dame though, is unclear. (March 14)

fields.title: Dozens Missing After Fresh China Landslide
fields.description: Another deadly landslide struck southwestern China Wednesday as unusually strong summer storms were continuing. Access to Puladi township in Yunnan province was cut off by the deluge of mud and water. (August 18)

fields.title: US Military: Haiti Unrest Less Than Before Quake
fields.description: The top US military commander in Haiti says the country is seeing less unrest than before the earthquake. But getting help to people injured or displaced by the disaster remains a challenge, even with the military's help, officials say. (Jan. 18)

fields.title: Earthquake Leaves 3 Million in Need in Haiti
fields.description: Haiti's devastating earthquake has left an estimated 3 million people in need of emergency aid, a Red Cross official said Wednesday, as aid groups and governments scrambled to send tons of disaster relief to the impoverished Caribbean nation. (Jan. 13)

fields.title: Health Fears for Japanese in Nuclear Zone
fields.description: Japanese living in the region around the country's crippled nuclear power plant face uncertainty over health risks posed by radiation. (March 8) Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: Images of Disaster: Aftermath in Haiti
fields.description: Desperately needed aid from around the world slowly made its way Thursday into Haiti. AP photographers capture the latest on the ground. (Jan. 14)

fields.title: No End Seen of Refugees Fleeing Somalia Drought
fields.description: There's no letup in the flow of refugees fleeing Somalia after years of drought that's brought shortages of food and water. Conditions in the Horn of Africa are the worst for 60 years. (July 14)

fields.title: Experts: High Probability of More Haiti Quakes
fields.description: A month after Haiti's earthquake, scientists fear another one could strike before demolition crews can even reach toppled buildings to prevent more deaths. The January 12th disaster killed more than 200000 people. (Feb. 15)

fields.title: UN Chief Pleads for Massive Aid for Haiti
fields.description: UN Secretary general Ban Ki-Moon is pledging $10 million in aid for Haiti and is calling on the international community to do everything it can to help the earthquake-stricken nation. (Jan. 13)

fields.title: Major Quake Hits Haiti; Many Casualties Expected
fields.description: The strongest earthquake in more than 200 years rocked Haiti Tuesday, collapsing a hospital where people screamed for help and heavily damaging the National Palace, UN peacekeeper headquarters and other buildings. (Jan. 13)

fields.title: Jacmel, Tourist Area in Haiti, Decimated by Quake
fields.description: The coastal city of Jacmel was once home to wealthy coffee merchants. Now the city is a jumble of concrete and wood, cut off help by roads blocked with debris. (Jan. 18)

fields.title: Ford to Add 5750 US Jobs As Part of Contract
fields.description: Ford Motor Co. said Tuesday it will add 5750 jobs and invest $4.8 billion in its US factories as part of a new contract deal with the United Auto Workers union. (Oct. 4)

fields.title: Raw Video 8.8-magnitude Earthquake Hits Chile
fields.description: A massive 8.8-magnitude earthquake struck Chile early Saturday, collapsing buildings, killing at least 16 people and downing phone lines. President Michele Bachelet declared a "state of catastrophe." (Feb. 27)

fields.title: Protests Flare in Flood-weary Pakistan
fields.description: Angry flood survivors in Pakistan blocked a highway to protest slow delivery of aid and heavy rain lashed makeshift housing Monday as a forecast of more flooding increased the urgency of the massive international relief effort. (Aug. 16)

fields.title: Pakistani Flood Victims Angry, Trying to Salvage
fields.description: Some Pakistani flood victims were returning home or trying to do so on Monday, but amid growing anger at the government, they found little worth salvaging. (August 2)

fields.title: Angelina Jolie Meets Flood Victims in Pakistan
fields.description: Angelina Jolie has visited northwest Pakistan to meet victims of the recent flooding. The actress appealed to the international community to provide aid and help the country recover from its worst natural disaster. (Sept 7)

fields.title: Volcano Worry As Tsunami Slams Indonesia
fields.description: A volatile volcano was rumbling in Indonesia Tuesday, as scientists warned of a possible powerful eruption. Meanwhile, the country was also slammed by a tsunami-generated earthquake. (Oct. 26)

fields.title: Angelina Jolie Meets Flood Victims in Pakistan
fields.description: Angelina Jolie has visited northwest Pakistan to meet victims of the recent flooding. The actress appealed to the international community to provide aid and help the country recover from its worst natural disaster. (Sept 7)

fields.title: Raw Video: Aid Pours for Pakistan Flood Victims
fields.description: Islamabad has accepted $5-million dollars in aid from India for flood victims, a rare expression of goodwill between the feuding neighbours at a time when Pakistan is reeling from one of its worst ever natural disasters. (Aug. 20)

fields.title: Massive Storm Howls Across Nation's Midsection
fields.description: A massive storm with wind gusts up to 81 mph howled across the nation's midsection Tuesday, snapping trees and power lines, ripping off roofs, delaying flights and soaking commuters hunched under crumpled umbrellas. (Oct. 26)

fields.title: Security an Issue As Somalia Aid Ramps Up
fields.description: The UN says it plans to start airlifting emergency rations into parts of drought-stricken Somalia this week, but security remains a concern for those plans and other aid efforts. (July 26)

fields.title: UN Chief Appeals for Aid in Flood-hit Pakistan
fields.description: UN Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon urged the world to speed up assistance to flood-ravaged Pakistan on Sunday as the 20 million people made homeless grew increasingly desperate, and new torrents inundated villages. (Aug. 15)

fields.title: Video Essay: Devastation in Japan
fields.description: Stunning images of the aftermath of the tsunami in Japan, which has claimed thousands of lives and triggered a nuclear crisis. (March 14)

fields.title: 'We Are the World' Class of 2010
fields.description: 25 years after the original, charity anthem 'We Are The World' has been given a hip-hip, pop twist by top artists, including Celine Dion, Jonas Brothers and Wyclef Jean. The stars have re-recorded the 80s hit to raise money for Haiti. (Feb. 2)

fields.title: Hundreds Killed in Tsunami After 8.9 Japan Quake
fields.description: A ferocious tsunami spawned by one of the largest earthquakes on record slammed Japan's eastern coast Friday, killing hundreds of people as it swept away ships, cars and homes (March 11)

fields.title: Japanese Search for Survivors, Fear Radiation
fields.description: In areas hit hard by an earthquake then tsunami, the search goes on for any survivors. But the new fear in places like Sendai, Japan, is radiation from troubles at nuclear power plants nearby. (March 16)

fields.title: Jill Biden Visits East Africa Famine Refugees
fields.description: A US aid official warned Monday that hundreds of thousands of Somalis could die as famine spreads, amid a visit to Kenyan refugee camps by the wife of Vice President Joe Biden.

fields.title: Months After Haiti Quake, No Permanent Homes
fields.description: After the earthquake that ravaged Haiti, there is still no permanent shelter for legions of quake survivors. Now, rains loom, which aid workers say could be create another major disaster. (March 12)

fields.title: Raw Video: Typhoon Headed to Japan Disaster Zone
fields.description: A powerful typhoon is bearing down on Japan's tsunami-ravaged northeastern coast, approaching a nuclear power plant crippled in that disaster and prompting calls for the evacuation of more than a million people. (Sept. 21)

fields.title: Raw Video: Indonesian Volcano Forces Evacuation
fields.description: A volcanic eruption of Mount Merapi on Tuesday killed at least 25 people, forced thousands to flee down its slopes and spewed burning ash and smoke high into the air on the island of Java. (Oct. 27)

fields.title: Raw Video: Coast Guard Sinks Ghost Ship
fields.description: The US Coast Guard used cannon fire to sink an empty Japanese ship in the Gulf of Alaska. The "ghost ship" drifted across the Pacific after last year's tsunami. (April 6) Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: Japan Races to Avert Multiple Nuclear Meltdowns
fields.description: Japan's nuclear crisis intensified Sunday as authorities raced to combat the threat of multiple reactor meltdowns and more than 170000 people evacuated the northeastern coast where fears spread over possible radioactive contamination. (March 13)

fields.title: Floods Kill Hundreds in Pakistan
fields.description: Pakistani officials say days of floods in the northwest have killed hundreds of people and left hundreds of thousands homeless. One called it the worst flooding since 1929. (July 30)

fields.title: Raw Video: 7.4 Quake Hits New Zealand
fields.description: A powerful 7.4-magnitude earthquake struck much of New Zealand's South Island early Saturday. No tsunami alert was issued and there were no reports of serious injuries, but looters broke into some damaged shops in Christchurch, police said. (Sept. 3)

fields.title: Raw Video: Two Rescued 9 Days After Japan Quake
fields.description: An 80-year-old woman and her teenage grandson were rescued on Sunday in northeastern Japan when the youth was able to pull himself out of their flattened two-story house nine days after the devastating earthquake and tsunami. (March 20)

fields.title: Raw Video: New Images of Haiti After the Quake
fields.description: WARNING GRAPHIC VIDEO: Haitians piled bodies along the devastated streets of their capital Wednesday after a powerful earthquake crushed thousands of structures, from shacks to the National Palace and the UN peacekeeping headquarters. (Jan. 13)

fields.title: Obama: Haiti Crisis 'Calls Out for American Leadership'
fields.description: President Barack Obama says he is ordering that providing earthquake relief to Haiti become a top priority of the US government, pledging aid from the military and relief groups, along with cash. (Jan. 14)

fields.title: Pat Robertson Calls Quake 'blessing in Disguise'
fields.description: TV Evangelist Pat Robertson made some unusual observations about the Haiti earthquake on his CBN newscast Wednesday, calling the quake a possible blessing and saying the Haitian people are cursed. (Jan .13)

fields.title: NYPD Helps Reshape Haitian Police Force
fields.description: The chief of New York's police travelled to Haiti on Monday to discuss US support for rebuilding the security forces of the Caribbean nation following the devastating earthquake. (Aug. 3)

fields.title: Raw Video: US Aid Arrives in Flood-hit Pakistan
fields.description: The death toll from massive floods in northwestern Pakistan rose to 1100 on Sunday as US aid was being distributed to people affected by the floods (August 1)

fields.title: Snow Adds to Recovery Work Challenge in Japan
fields.description: International rescue teams were working hard as recovery efforts continued in the wake of Japan's twin disasters of earthquake and tsunami. Snow and freezing temperatures were adding to the challenge of the crews and the misery of survivors. (March 17)

fields.title: Quake Mudslides Wipe Out Indonesian Villages
fields.description: Mountains of mud and debris have obliterated a handful of Indonesian villages. So far, the government confirms more than 700 people are dead and three thousand listed as missing. (Oct. 3)

fields.title: Haiti Throws Young US Official Into Spotlight
fields.description: The devastating earthquake in Haiti put the spotlight on USAID administrator Rajiv Shah, who was tapped to lead the relief efforts just days after taking office. AP correspondent Julie Pace reports on the 36-year-old who is winning praise in Washington.

fields.title: Understanding the Scale of the Japan Earthquake
fields.description: Few recorded earthquakes have been as strong as the one that rocked Japan Friday. Coupled with the massive tsunami that washed ashore, the country is facing nearly unimaginable consequences. (March 14)

fields.title: Twitter, Facebook Play Big Role in Helping Haiti
fields.description: Charitable organizations say an unprecedented number of people have turned to social media, including Twitter and Facebook to give money for disaster relief efforts following the Haiti earthquake. (Jan. 13)

fields.title: Haitians Struggle to Get Their Share of Aid
fields.description: The Associated Press's John Mone reports that with food, water and other aid flowing into Haiti in earnest, relief groups and officials are focused on moving the supplies out of the clogged airport and to earthquake survivors in the capital. (Jan. 16)

fields.title: Japanese Americans Rally to Help Tsunami Victims
fields.description: Japanese Americans in California are raising funds to help earthquake and tsunami victims even as many still have missing loved ones in Japan. (March 16)

fields.title: Raw Video: Mount Merapi Continues to Erupt
fields.description: An Indonesian volcano continued to erupt on Tuesday, spewing out ash clouds and hot gas in the latest eruption in a deadly week for the country. (Nov. 2)

fields.title: Indonesia Volcano: Toll Tops 190, Flights Cut

fields.title: AP Top Stories
fields.description: SelectPlusAP Top StoriesAP Top StoriesThe Associated PressHere's the latest news for Thursday June 5th: Severe storms from Ohio to Maryland; Arraignment for 9/11 mastermind; Investigation continues into the Yearning for Zion Ranch; Red Wings are Stanley Cup Champions.[Notes:ANCHOR VOICE]This is AP NewsMinute. At least three people are dead, following a day full of strong storms from the Ohio Valley to the Mid-Atlantic. In Central Ohio - strong thunderstorms produced thousands of power outages, lightning fires and flooding. The confessed mastermind behind the Nine-Eleven attacks will be arraigned today at Guantanamo Bay, Cuba. Khalid Sheik Mohammed and four other alleged plotters will be before a military tribunal. The hearing is expected to be confrontational. For Mohammed, it will be his first public appearance since he was captured in Pakistan back in 2003. A criminal investigation continues at the Yearning for Zion Ranch in Texas. State officials are investigating allegations of sexual abuse at the ranch. 440 children taken by the state have now been returned to the polygamist sect that lives at the ranch. For the fourth time in 11 years, hockeytown is titletown. The Detroit Red Wings won the Stanley Cup last night -- defeating the Pittsburgh Penguins. The Penguins had a chance to tie the game in the final minute, but Chris Osgood made a stellar save to secure the victory.___ ___, The Associated Press with AP NewsMinute. (****END****) VOICE ...

THE 5.8 MAGNITUDE TREMOR DESTROYED 71000 HOMES - KILLING AT LEAST ONE PERSON AND INJURING MORE THAN 400. [Notes:damage shots]THE AFTERSHOCK BRINGS FRESH DEVASTATION - FURTHER STRAINING RECOVERY EFFORTS FROM CHINA'S 7.9 MAGNITUDE EARTHQUAKE ON MAY 12.IN ADDITION TO THE 71000 HOMES THAT WERE LEVELED - ANOTHER 200000 ARE IN DANGER OF COLLAPSING. [Notes:aftershocks] [Notes:beijing towers]US OFFICIALS SAY THE AFTERSHOCK IS ONE OF THE MOST POWERFUL RECORDED SINCE THE INITIAL MAY 12TH QUAKE. SKYSCRAPERS SWAYED IN BEIJING . . . 800 MILES AWAY. [Notes:rescue people shot]BEFORE THE AFTERSHOCK - FIVE MILLION PEOPLE WERE HOMELESS, THE DEATH TOLL FROM THE INITIAL DISASTER SURPASSED 62000 AND MORE THAN 23000 PEOPLE ARE STILL CONSIDERED MISSING. THERE IS NO WORD ON HOW MANY PEOPLE HAVE BEEN ADDED TO THE MILLIONS OF HOMELESS. OFFICIALS NOW WARN THAT THE NUMBER OF DEAD COULD SURPASS 80000. ___ ___, The Associated Press.(****END****) (ANCHOR VOICE: SKozell-------------------------VIDEO PRODUCER: NHawkins------------------------------VIDEO SOURCE ...

fields.title: AP Top Stories
fields.description: Here's the latest news for Friday, March 11: Japan tries to recover from quake; Japan nuclear fears; US tsunami warnings; Mel Gibson back in court.

fields.title: AP Top Stories
fields.description: Here's the latest news for Sunday, Jan. 17: Haiti earthquake update; Obama evokes Martin Luther King Jr.; Pope speaks out about the Holocaust; Bin Laden picture.

fields.title: AP Top Stories
fields.description: Here's the latest news for: White House won't confirm taliban capture; Marines battle in Afghanistan; Haiti's earthquake bill reaches into the billions; Making toad sausages.

fields.title: AP Top Stories
fields.description: Here's the latest news for Thursday, August 23: Tropical Storm Isaac floods Puerto Rico; GOP plans to go ahead with its convention; Syrian rebels make advances; Hippo gets stuck in pool.

fields.title: Raw Video: Marines Land in Japan for Quake Help
fields.description: More US troops have arrived in Japan to help with relief efforts there following last month's devastating earthquake and tsunami. Saturday, a group of marines from Indian Head, Maryland arrived at Yokota Air Force Base in Japan. (April 3)

fields.title: Haiti, Dom. Rep. Brace for TS Emily
fields.description: Tropical Storm Emily is headed toward the Dominican Republic and Haiti, where more than 630000 people are still without shelter after last year's earthquake. Forecasters say the biggest threat will be flooding. (Aug. 3)

fields.title: Aid to Haiti Frustrating, Looting Persists
fields.description: Six days later, help is still not reaching a lot of the survivors of Haiti's earthquake -- people are still struggling to find water or a handful of food. As the AP's Rich Matthews reports, security remains a concern in Port-au-Prince. (Jan. 18)

fields.title: Japanese Company Markets Tsunami Escape Pod
fields.description: A small factory in Japan introduced its first tsunami survival shelter, a capsule which can float on water and is able to hold four adults inside. (Sept. 30)

fields.title: Ray Bradbury, Author of 'Fahrenheit 451,' Dies
fields.description: Ray Bradbury, the science fiction-fantasy master transformed his childhood dreams and Cold War fears into telepathic Martians, lovesick sea monsters, and the high-tech, book-burning future of "Fahrenheit 451." (June 6) Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: UN Pleads for More Aid to Famine-hit Somalia
fields.description: The United Nations appealed for a further half-billion dollars in aid funding for 2011 to deal with a serious famine in the Horn of Africa. Around 1.5 million Somalis remain stuck in the country as the worst drought in 20 years hits the country. (July 21)

fields.title: Nikkei Slides 11 Percent on Radiation Fears
fields.description: Japan's Nikkei stock index nose-dived nearly 11 percent on Tuesday as the earthquake-shattered country faced an unfolding nuclear crisis after a radiation leak was detected at a crippled power plant. Other Asian markets tumbled. (March 15)

fields.title: AP Top Stories
fields.description: Here's the latest news for Sunday, March 11: US soldier suspect in Afghan civilian deaths; GOP candidates look to Deep South; Former UN chief leaves Syria without deal; Japan marks one year since earthquake, tsunami. Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: Raw Video: US Military Brings Quake Relief
fields.description: Aid to quake-ravaged Japan is starting to come in thanks to the US military. A helicopter from an aircraft carrier off the coast of Japan airlifts supplies to the country's interior. (March 14)

fields.title: Raw Video: Deadly Floods Sweep Across Pakistan
fields.description: Rivers burst their banks during monsoon rains in Pakistan this week, washing away streets, battering a dam and killing at least 28 people. However, two men captured on tape were rescued. (July 29)

fields.title: AP Top Stories
fields.description: Here's the latest news for Friday, May 13th: Flood concerns in Mississippi; Ron Paul enters presidential race; 80 killed in Pakistan blast; Shuttle countdown for Monday.

fields.title: Raw Video: Angelina Jolie Visits Pakistan
fields.description: The United Nations says actress Angelina Jolie is visiting Pakistan to meet victims of the floods and highlight the need for international help. (Sept. 7)

fields.title: Workers Pulled at Japan Nuke Plant After Smoke
fields.description: Operators evacuated workers from Japan's tsunami-damaged nuclear plant Monday after gray smoke rose from one of its reactor units, the latest of persistent troubles in stabilizing the complex. (March 21)

fields.title: Raw Video: Italian Cruise Ship Drifts Powerless
fields.description: A French fishing vessel on Tuesday began towing an Italian cruise ship drifting powerless in the Indian Ocean to a nearby Seychelles island, but was not expected to reach the island until Wednesday, officials said. (Feb. 28)

fields.title: Raw Video: Mass Marks Anniversary of Haiti Quake
fields.description: A large Mass is being celebrated in Haiti, marking the first anniversary of the devastating earthquake that destroyed much of Port-au-Prince and killed thousands of people. (Jan. 12)

fields.title: Cholera Victims Fill Gym in Haiti Amid Protests
fields.description: Haitians angry over the cholera outbreak ignored pleas from health workers to stop violence that is disrupting treatment efforts in the capital. Meanwhile treatment centers across the country are filling up. (Nov. 19)

fields.title: Raw Video: Jolie Visits Haitian Quake Victims
fields.description: Angelina Jolie began two days of meetings with Haiti earthquake victims Tuesday in her role as a goodwill ambassador for the UN refugee agency. (Feb. 9)

fields.title: AP Top Stories
fields.description: Here's the latest news for Wednesday, Jan 13.: Some death toll estimates out of Haiti are in six figures; Obama promises all-out US relief effort for Haiti; Senator says US should consider drone attacks in Yemen; Strong debut for 9th season of 'Idol'.

fields.title: Raw Video: Tsunami Slams Northeast Japan
fields.description: A tsunami triggered by a massive earthquake washed away buildings along the northeast coast of Japan. (March 11)

fields.title: AP Top Stories
fields.description: Here's the latest news for Wednesday, Jan 13.: Some death toll estimates out of Haiti are in six figures; Obama promises all-out US relief effort for Haiti; Senator says US should consider drone attacks in Yemen; Strong debut for 9th season of 'Idol'.

fields.title: Japan Emperor Makes First Trip to Disaster Zone
fields.description: Japan's emperor visited the country's earthquake and tsunami-ravaged disaster zone for the first time Thursday as frustration rose over the nation's inability to gain control over a crisis at a nuclear plant crippled by the twin disasters. (April 14)

fields.title: AP Top Stories
fields.description: Here's the latest news for Saturday, March 10: Obama swings back on gas prices; Israel pounds Gaza with airstrikes; Mourners mark first anniversary of Japan disaster; Prince Harry romps around in Brazil. Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: Missing Virginia Teacher's Body Located in Japan
fields.description: The body of a 24-year-old English teacher from Virginia, Taylor Anderson, has been discovered in the wreckage of the tsunami in Japan. (March 22)

fields.title: AP Top Stories
fields.description: Here's the latest news for Saturday, July 31: Fire crews get advantage in California; Flooding kills hundreds in Pakistan; russia battling deadly fires; Scary fall in Turkey.

fields.title: Hydrogen Explosion Occurs at Japanese Nuke Plant
fields.description: Japan's chief cabinet secretary says a hydrogen explosion has occurred at Unit 3 of Japan's stricken Fukushima Dai-ichi nuclear plant. The blast was similar to an earlier one at a different unit of the facility. (March 13)

fields.title: AP Top Stories
fields.description: Here's the latest news for Tuesday, January 19th: More troops sent to Haiti; Violence erupts in Haiti; More security for Kabul; erich Segal dies.

fields.title: Haiti to Relocate 400000 Quake Homeless
fields.description: Within days, the government will move 400000 people made homeless by Haiti's epic earthquake from their squalid improvised camps throughout Port-au-Prince to new resettlement areas on the outskirts, a top Haitian official said Thursday. (Jan. 21)

fields.title: Building Shakes in 7.5 Magnitude Quake Test
fields.description: Scientists in Japan subjected a six-story condo building to a powerful earthquake in a test of building practices that could lead to better building standards and practices. (July 14)

fields.title: Raw Video: Boat Caught in Japan's Swirling Water
fields.description: Ferocious tsunami waves swirled near a port in Oarai, Japan. A boat is seen struggling to stay afloat in the whirlpool. (March 11)

fields.title: State Dept.: Next 72 Hours Critical to Haiti Rescues
fields.description: Officials at the State Department talk about coordinating rescue and recovery efforts in Haiti among aid groups and the military. Initial assessments have the situation on the ground as calm. (Jan. 13)

fields.title: Coast Guard Sinks Tsunami Ghost Ship
fields.description: A US Coast Guard cutter unleashed cannon fire on an abandoned Japanese ship on Thursday, ending a journey that began when last year's tsunami dislodged the 164-foot ship and set it adrift across the Pacific Ocean.(April 6) Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: First Person: California Harbor Hit by Tsunami
fields.description: The tsunami that ravaged Japan was also felt on the West Coast Friday. It ripped docks out and damaged or destroyed a number of boats in California's Santa Cruz Harbor. (March 11)

fields.title: Raw Video: New Images of Aftermath in Japan
fields.description: Rescue workers in Japan were searching for any survivors from the massive quake and ensuing tsunami. Meanwhile, more pictures from the widespread damage are emerging. (March 14)

fields.title: More Than 100 Injured in Japanese Earthquake
fields.description: SelectPlusMore Than 100 Injured in Japanese EarthquakeMore Than 100 Injured in Japanese EarthquakeThe Associated PressAn earthquake northeast of Tokyo Japan injured at least 109 people. Sixteen were seriously hurt. The tremor caused strong shaking for up to 40 seconds across a large swath of the Asian country. (July 24)) [Notes:ANCHOR VOICE] [Notes:street damage - shattered windows and ceiling]A POWERFUL EARTHQUAKE RATTLED NORTHERN JAPAN AND INJURED MORE THAN 100 PEOPLE ON THURSDAY. [Notes:shattered store/shelves] THE QUAKE MEASURED A PRELIMINARY MAGNITUDE OF 6.8 AND COMES JUST ONE MONTH AFTER A 7.2 MAGNITUDE TEMBLOR KILLED AT LEAST 12 PEOPLE IN JAPAN'S NORTHERN MOUNTAINS. THE TREMOR STRUCK SHORTLY AFTER MIDNIGHT NEAR THE COAST ABOUT 280 MILES NORTHEAST OF TOKYO -- THOUGH IT WAS ALSO FELT THERE. [Notes:press conference]POLICE SAY SOME OF THE INJURIES WERE SERIOUS BUT MOST WERE MINOR. [Notes:a little nats of prime minister]JAPAN'S PRIME MINISTER SAYS HE WAS SURPRISED BY THE QUAKE AND THAT OFFICIALS ARE STILL GATHERING INFORMATION TO PROPERLY ASSESS THE SITUATION. fields.title: Raw Video: Haiti Moments After the Quake
fields.description: WARNING GRAPHIC VIDEO: New footage taken just after the earthquake in Haiti shows scores of people flooding the street including those trying to find a place to take the injured. (Jan. 13)

fields.title: Raw Video: Magnitude 7.4 Quake Hits Japan Coast
fields.description: Japan was rattled by a strong aftershock and tsunami warning Thursday night nearly a month after a devastating earthquake and tsunami flattened the northeastern coast. (April 7)

fields.title: Strongest Earthquake in Decades in Britain
fields.description: An earthquake struck Britain early Wednesday and was felt across large parts of the country. (Feb. 27)

fields.title: Pakistanis Suspect Landowners of Diverting Flood
fields.description: As the disastrous floods recede in Pakistan, something new is rising: suspicions and rumors that powerful officials and landowners used their influence to divert water away from their property and inundate the villages of millions of poor People (Sept. 7)

fields.title: Raw Video: Refinery Burns After Japan Quake
fields.description: There are reports of injuries in Tokyo from a massive, magnitude 8.9 earthquake off Japan's northeastern coast. Japanese TV shows a refinery fire has broken out. (March 11)

fields.title: Bin Laden Releases Audio Tape, Wants Aid Relief
fields.description: Osama bin Laden sought to drum up support by taking advantage of Pakistan's flood tragedy with a new audiotape released Friday criticizing Muslim governments for their slow response and calling for the creation of a new relief body to aid Muslims.(Oct. 1)

fields.title: Dozens Dead in Hatian School Collapse
fields.description: A hillside school where roughly 500 students crowded into several floors collapsed during classes on Friday, killing at least 30 people and injuring many more. Rescuers used bare hands to pull bleeding students from the wreckage. (Nov. 7)

fields.title: Japan Abandons Nuke Plant Over Radiation
fields.description: Japan suspended operations to prevent a stricken nuclear plant from melting down Wednesday after a surge in radiation made it too dangerous for workers to remain at the facility. (March 15)

fields.title: Raw Video: Tsunami Wave Strikes Japan Airport
fields.description: Waves of muddy waters swept over farmland near the city of Sendai. At Sendai airport, north of Tokyo, was inundated with cars, trucks, buses and thick mud deposited over its runways. (March 11)

fields.title: Tsunami Basketball Lands in Alaska, Returned
fields.description: A Japanese basketball, which was among the first piece of debris to be washed away from Rikuzentakata city, by the March 2011 tsunami and later found on an island off Alaska, was delivered to the owner; a school team, on Wednesday. (June 13) Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: AP Top Stories
fields.description: Here's the latest news for Saturday August 14th: Eight people shot in Buffalo; First family vacations in the Gulf Coast; Cholera strikes amid Pakistani floods and Florida wildlife officials free bear cub's head from jar.

fields.title: Raw Video: Wash. Mudslide Traps Minivan
fields.description: Heavy rain in the Puget Sound is starting to cause mudslides. One slide covered a road Thursday morning in Pierce County, Washington, trapping a minivan. The occupants were unhurt. (March 10)

fields.title: Madonna Promises $500000 for Quake Relief
fields.description: The mayor of an Italian town shaken by Monday's earthquake says Madonna has promised $500000 in aid. The mayor of Pacentro, which is the birthplace of the pop star's grandparents, says he was deeply moved by Madonna's effort. (April 8)

fields.title: Debris Apparently From Tsunami Reach Canada
fields.description: Debris apparently from the tsunami that hit Japan in March are washing up on beaches in Japan. Much greater amounts of debris could reach the US And Canada in the next year. (Dec. 16)

fields.title: Raw Video: Sean Penn Named Ambassador for Haiti
fields.description: Actor Sean Penn was named ambassador at large for Haiti in recognition of his humanitarian work since the 2010 earthquake. He received the honor from Haitian President Michel Martelly at a special ceremony Tuesday evening at the National Palace. (Jan. 31)

fields.title: Pakistani President Defends Gov't Flood Response
fields.description: Pakistan's president defended the government's much-criticized response to the country's record-breaking flood crisis as emergency workers worked frantically Monday to shore up a system of levees protecting two southern cities. (Aug. 23)

fields.title: Airline Passengers From Haiti Share Tales of Chaos, Damage
fields.description: Airline passengers landing in Miami, Florida from Haiti say the earthquake caused major damage and devastation to the airport and to Port-Au-Prince. The earthquake occurred just before the plane took off. (Jan. 12)

fields.title: Raw Video: Several Hurt After Indonesia Quake
fields.description: A strong earthquake shook the popular Indonesian resort island of Bali early Saturday, injuring at least seven people and sending panicked tourists and residents fleeing out of homes and hotels. (Sept. 19)

fields.title: Raw Video: Earthquake Triggers Tsunami in Japan
fields.description: Japan was struck by a magnitude-8.8 earthquake off its northeastern coast Friday, triggering a 13-foot (4-meter) tsunami that washed away cars and tore away buildings along the coast near the epicenter. (March 10)

fields.title: Raw Video: Pakistanis Protest NATO Supply Route
fields.description: One-thousand Jamaat-e-Islami party supporters marched in Karachi, Pakistan to protest against the reopening of a NATO supply route to Afghanistan. Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: Haiti Braces for Tropical Storm Tomas
fields.description: A US Navy vessel is heading toward Haiti to be on hand in case Tropical Storm Tomas strikes this week. The impoverished nation has still not recovered from January's deadly earthquake. (Nov. 2)

fields.title: Raw Video: Magnitude 7.1 Aftershock Hits Japan
fields.description: Japanese scientists say a 7.0 magnitude aftershock has rattled the country's northeast, one month to the day since a massive quake devastated the country. A tsunami warning was issued, then lifted shortly after. (April 11)

fields.title: Raw Video: Magnitude 7.1 Aftershock Hits Japan
fields.description: Japanese scientists say a 7.0 magnitude aftershock has rattled the country's northeast, one month to the day since a massive quake devastated the country. A tsunami warning was issued, then lifted shortly after. (April 11)

fields.title: Colts Receiver Thankful for Support After Haiti Quake
fields.description: Colts receiver Pierre Garcon, who has relatives in the earthquake-ravaged nation of Haiti, said he appreciates the support of his Indianapolis teammates and head coach Jim Caldwell. (Jan. 14)

fields.title: Somali Father Loses 5 Children in Famine
fields.description: A Somali father has told how he was forced to bury five of his seven children, as they starved to death in the famine that has engulfed his homeland. (Aug. 9)

fields.title: 7.2 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Japan
fields.description: SelectPlus7.2 Magnitude Earthquake Hits Japan7.2 Magnitude Earthquake Hits JapanThe Associated PressAt least three people are dead in a powerful earthquake that rocked northern Japan Saturday. Dozens more are reported injured or missing. (June 14)In this video--you can see the earth shaking as a 7.2 magnitude earthquake rocks Japan. The country's northern region has reportedly been hit hardest---and deaths have been reported. Dozens are injured or missing. (((ANCHOR PLEASE READ TRANSLATION --THIS SOUND IS IN JAPANESE))) [Notes:SOT: Japanese Chief Cabinet Secretary Nobutaka Machimur]SOT: "THE DAMAGE REPORTS ARE GRADUALLY GETTING BIGGER WITH TIME. GOVERNMENT AGENCIES AND THE POLICE FORCE ON THE FIELD ARE CLOSELY COMMUNICATING TO GET AS MUCH INFORMATION AS POSSIBLE. AT THIS POINT.A Japanese TV network recorded this video as the quake rocked their broadcast complex....The morning temblor was about 280 miles north of Tokyo---but it was felt in the capital.Electricity was cut off to about 29000 households in the quake zone.Authorities concluded there was no danger of a tsunami. ___ ___, The Associated Press.

fields.title: Strong Earthquake Rocks Northeastern Japan
fields.description: A 7.3 magnitude earthquake hit Japan's northeastern coast on Sunday, prompting a tsunami warning. However, there were no immediate reports of damage. (July 9)

fields.title: Raw Video: Haitians Mark One Month Since Quake
fields.description: Earthquake survivors in Haiti joined hands and chanted to mark the exact moment when an earthquake struck the capital a month ago, killing more than 200000 people. (Feb. 12)

fields.title: Raw Video: Mourners Mark Tsunami Anniversary
fields.description: The victims of the 2004 Indian Ocean tsunami were honored by thousands of mourners Friday who prayed, burned candles and shared meals on beaches from Indonesia to India. (Dec. 26)

fields.title: Raw Video: US Won't Sink Japan Ghost Ship Now
fields.description: The US Coast Guard says that a Canadian fishing vessel has claimed salvage rights to the Japanese ghost ship that was set adrift by last year's tsunami. If the Canadians are unable to tow the ship, the Coast Guard will sink it as planned. (April 5) Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: Raw Video: Japan Quake Caught on Camera
fields.description: A magnitude 6.9 earthquake hit off Japan's southern coast, shaking Okinawa and nearby islands but no major damage was reported. The moment the quake struck was caught on an NHK newsroom camera, shaking some signs and rattling nerves. (Feb. 26)

fields.title: Tsunami Watch After 8.6 Quake
fields.description: Tsunami watches and warnings went into effect for nations around the Indian Ocean, after a magnitude 8.6 earthquake struck Indonesia on Wednesday. An aftershock also topped magnitude 8. Most tsunami alerts were later lifted. (April 11) Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: Tsunami Watch After 8.7 Quake
fields.description: A Tsunami watch is in effect for nations around the Indian Ocean, after a magnitude 8.7 earthquake struck Indonesia on Wednesday. (April 11)

fields.title: Tsunami Watch After 8.7 Quake
fields.description: A Tsunami warning is in effect for nations around the Indian Ocean, after a magnitude 8.7 earthquake struck Indonesia on Wednesday. (April 11) Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: Raw Video: Smoke Pours From Japan Nuclear Plant
fields.description: An explosion at a nuclear power station tore down the walls of one building Saturday as smoke poured out. Japanese officials said they feared the reactor could melt down following the failure of its cooling system in the earthquake and tsunami. (March 12

fields.title: Indonesian Earthquake Triggers Tsunami Warning
fields.description: A magnitude 7.7 earthquake shook Indonesia's northwest island of Sumatra early Wednesday, prompting a brief tsunami warning and sending panicked residents rushing for higher ground. (April 7)

fields.title: Strong, Long 7.6 Quake Shakes Mexico City
fields.description: A strong, long 7.6-magnitude earthquake with an epicenter in Guerrero state on Tuesday, followed by an aftershock that shook central southern Mexico, swayed buildings in Mexico City and sent frightened workers and residents into the streets. (March 20) Subscribe to the Associated Press: bit.ly Download AP Mobile: www.ap.org Associated Press on Facebook: apne.ws Associated Press on Twitter: apne.ws Associated Press on Google+: bit.ly

fields.title: Earthquake Kills 3 and Injures 25 in Indonesia
fields.description: A powerful earthquake estimated to be a magnitude 7.6 killed three people and injured 25 in western Indonesia. (Feb. 20)

fields.title: 7.0 Quake Hits Impoverished Haiti, Hospital Collapses
fields.description: A strong earthquake hit Haiti on Tuesday, where a hospital collapsed and people were screaming for help. The earthquake had a preliminary magnitude of 7.0 and was centered about 10 miles west from Port-au-Prince, the USGS said. (Jan. 12)

fields.title: Raw Video: Air Mattress Raft Ride
fields.description: Three men took advantage of flooding in the Las Vegas area to go raft riding on an air mattress. Authorities eventually made them stop. (Aug. 23)

fields.title: Tsunami Warning After 7.7 Indonesia Quake
fields.description: A local geological agency official says a powerful 7.7-magnitude earthquake has struck eastern Indonesia. (Nov. 16)

fields.title: Raw Video: Typhoon Triggers Flood in Japan
fields.description: Heavy rain flooded the already-devastated Miyagi area of northern Japan on Monday, hindering its reconstruction efforts after the 11 March tsunami and earthquake. (May 30)

fields.title: Raw Video: 6.8M Quake Strikes Off Japanese Coast
fields.description: A magnitude 6.8 earthquake struck off Japan's northeastern coast Friday, triggering a tsunami advisory that was later lifted. The quake was centered just south of where a massive magnitude-9.0 temblor struck in March. (Aug. 19)

fields.title: Haitian Quake Victim Freed From US Detention
fields.description: A Haitian man who was airlifted by the US military following January's earthquake was freed Thursday from a Florida immigration detention center. (April 1)

fields.title: Al Jazeera Correspondent - Haiti: After the Quake
fields.description: Al Jazeera's Sebastian Walker asks why a system that was designed to help Haitians ended up exacerbating their misery.

fields.title: Featured Documentaries - Arab Awakening - Libya: Through the fire
fields.description: Through the eyes of a Libyan-born filmmaker, we investigate the dark stories emerging from a country fast unravelling into civil war. Libya: Through the fire can be seen from Thursday, May 5, at the following times GMT: Thursday: 2000; Friday: 1200; Saturday: 0100; Sunday: 0600; Monday: 2000; Tuesday: 1200; Wednesday: 0100; Thursday: 0600.

fields.title: The Stream - Asylum seekers in Australia & economic development in Haiti
fields.description: Australia's policies towards asylum seekers. Plus, why some accuse Haiti's factories of being sweat shops. Thumbnail image: Textile workers manufacture garments in the Willbes clothing manufacturing plant after it ramped back up to full production months after the January 12th earthquake. (Raedle/Getty)

fields.title: The Stream - Rise of the Global South
fields.description: We look at how markets of the Global South have become hotbeds of business innovation. Correction: #I4TandT - Netizens from Trinidad and Tobago campaign to raise $200000 to support the country's future Olympians & Paralympians

fields.title: The Stream - The Stream - Man-made pandemics
fields.description: Is the destruction of nature to blame for emerging diseases? Plus, a look at Uganda's nodding syndrome crisis.

fields.title: The Stream - Web of addiction
fields.description: Is internet addiction a real disorder? Most Asian countries see it as a serious problem but the US has yet to acknowledge it.

fields.title: The Stream - American terror
fields.description: We look at rising Islamophobia in the US and what can be done about it.

fields.title: The Stream - Grading state failure
fields.description: We examine whether or not the Failed States Index is a fair assessment of struggling countries.

fields.title: earthrise - Episode two
fields.description: Gorillas return from the brink of extinction in Africa, a seed bank in Britain for the world's wild plant species, a centre to combine green theory and practical experience in Wales and a project to reclaim lost mangrove forests in Indonesia.

fields.title: Inside Story - Who is to blame for India's ethnic unrest?
fields.description: India has accused Pakistan of fuelling ethnic tensions in the country over the last few weeks by fabricating threatening messages sent by mobile phones and over the internet that triggered a panic among migrant workers in southern Indian cities, leading to thousands fleeing their homes. Are the allegations true and how will this affect ties between the troubled neighbours? Guests: KC Singh, Subir Sinha, Ahmed Quraishi.

fields.title: Inside Story Americas - Is there hope for Haiti's homeless?
fields.description: Even before the earthquake struck Haiti, in a country of just ten million, hundreds of thousands were in need of housing. But after the quake the housing problem turned into a crisis, with nearly half of the homes in the capital suffering significant damage. The International Organization of Migration (IOM) says that the number of homeless is down from a peak of around 1.5 million to 400000, which is a significant drop. So why are Haitians still angry? President Michel Martelly, along with the IOM, launched a housing program giving camp residents $500 in rental subsidies for a year.

fields.title: Counting the Cost - Fighting the drought
fields.description: With 12 million people on the brink of starvation in the Horn of Africa, can Africa find the money and a solution?

fields.title: Inside Story - What next for Julian Assange?
fields.description: In what's been described as his Evita Peron moment, Wikileaks founder Julian Assange has criticised everything from the media to global politics, but gave no indication of his future plans.Jane Dutton speaks to Khawar Qureshi, Douglas Murray & Anthony Timmons.

fields.title: Inside Story - Japan's looming nuclear crisis
fields.description: Is this the nightmare scenario of nuclear meltdown becoming real? And what can be done to contain the nuclear threat while at the same time dealing with the widespread destruction caused by Japan's largest recorded earthquake?

fields.title: Inside Story - Life after Ethiopia's Meles Zenawi
fields.description: Meles Zenawi, the Ethiopian prime minister, died at the age of 57 after more than two decades in power. As preparations for his funeral gets under way, what's next for the country and region? Guests: David Shinn, Jawar Mohammed, Farah Abdul Samed.

fields.title: Riz Khan - Jesse Ventura: Clandestine US missions
fields.description: Has the US secretly started wars and assassinated leaders? We talk to Jesse Ventura, the former governor of the US state of Minnesota, about his controversial new book, '63 Documents the Government Doesn't Want You to Read'. In the book, Ventura has published dozens of previously classified US government papers that seem to suggest Washington may have secretly provoked the Vietnam War, lied to the American people about the actual threat of terrorism and experimented on its own soldiers.

fields.title: Inside Story Americas - Haiti: The republic of NGOs?
fields.description: It has been two years since Haiti was devastated by a magnitude 7.0 earthquake. Since then only half of the promised aid has been delivered. Guests Kim Ives, Mark Weisbrot and Ray Laforest discuss why reconstruction is taking too long to complete.

fields.title: Inside Story - Have Pakistan's flood victims been abandoned?
fields.description: Six months since floods ravaged Pakistan's Sindh and Balochistan provinces, millions of victims are still waiting for urgent aid. Who failed them -- the government, donor community or media? Guests: Shaheen Chughtai, Zafar Iqbal Qadir, Naveed Ahmed.

fields.title: 101 East - Pakistan Under Water
fields.description: Recent monsoon floods in Pakistan have left hundreds dead and million of others homeless, with flood-related diseases on the rise. How can this nation rise above the humanitarian crisis?

fields.title: People & Power - Danger Zone: Ageing Nuclear Reactors
fields.description: The US has more than 100 reactors similar to Japan's destroyed Fukushima plant. Some located in earthquake zones or close to major cities are now reaching the end of their working lives. People & Power sent Joe Rubin and Serene Fang to investigate.

fields.title: Counting the Cost - Japan: The cost of disaster
fields.description: On this week's Counting the Cost we look at: The economic impact of the catastrophe in Japan, the global nuclear power debate and an unexpected pastime in Afghanistan - skiing.

fields.title: Inside Story - Japan: Mixed messages
fields.description: As some 200000 people are evacuated from the area, is Japan facing a nuclear disaster?

fields.title: People & Power - Aftermath of a disaster
fields.description: People & Power looks at Miyako's citizens that survived Japan's devastating earthquake.

fields.title: Listening Post - Reporting the Egyptian revolution
fields.description: On this episode of Listening Post we look at the Egyptian revolution and the media's crucial role in it. Plus, Haiti one year after the earthquake - the global media'a anniversary coverage and the local media's struggles.

fields.title: Counting the Cost - Myanmar: Open for business
fields.description: As political reforms kick in and foreign investment floods in, we ask if Myanmar could be Asia's next economic tiger. Plus, Madrid's SOS. Spain is now the focal point of the eurozone crisis. Counting the Cost reports from the place where the pain of Spain's economic crisis is really being felt - the unemployment offices - and asks if a new bailout is the right solution. And, finally, could events in Europe cause Japan's hard-fought post-tsunami economic gains to fall apart?

fields.title: Listening Post - What is all the buzz about Japan?
fields.description: First came the earthquake, then the "ten metre high" tidal wave, then the threat of a nuclear meltdown. The string of disasters in Japan has grabbed headlines across the globe but when you are dealing with a story of this magnitude, it is always difficult to accurately convey the reality in a single headline, by-line or bulletin. The dominant narrative in this case has been the threat of Japan's damaged nuclear reactors leaking radiation. No matter how hard the experts try to pull the Chernobyl/Three Mile Island/nuclear buzzwords out of the headlines, they keep finding their way back in. On this week's Listening Post: The fault line that runs through the Land of the Rising Sun - and the chasm that lies between fact and what some call fiction in the reporting of the earthquake story.

fields.title: Riz Khan - The nuclear power debate
fields.description: As fear of lethal radiation from Japan's Fukushima nuclear plant is increasing, we look at the future of atomic energy.

fields.title: 101 East - Fukushima Fallout
fields.description: Japan is facing its biggest-ever backlash against nuclear power in the aftermath of the March 11, 2011, tsunami triggered by a 9.0 magnitude earthquake that wiped out not just entire towns and villages, but also destroyed a nuclear power plant.

fields.title: Witness - Tendenko: Surviving the Tsunami
fields.description: We ask if a code promoting self-preservation in a tsunami could account for one Japanese community's high survival rate.

fields.title: Inside Story - Behind East Africa's famine
fields.description: Why are millions of people still facing famine? What can be done to prevent future famines? Are the problems in the Horn of Africa simply down to nature, or are people and politics to blame? Could the crisis have been averted?

fields.title: Riz Khan - Haiti: Rebuilding an image
fields.description: "Republic of NGOs", "crime-ridden", "cursed"... this is how the media often describes Haiti, overshadowing the country's rich cultural identity. As the nation marks its one-year anniversary of the devastating earthquake that left more than 230000 people dead, many Haitians are fighting to break the negative stereotypes. On Tuesday's Riz Khan, we speak with renowned Haitian artist Edouard Duval-Carrié; and Huguens Jean, whose directorial debut Lif Up follows his journey back to Haiti two months after the earthquake. Dr Laurent Dubois, a historian and the co-director of the Haiti Lab at Duke University also joins the programme.

fields.title: Fault Lines - Horn of Africa Crisis: Somalia's Famine
fields.description: In part one of a two-part series, Fault Lines goes to Mogadishu to see the impact of Somalia's famine, and asks if US policies have contributed to the disaster?

fields.title: Frost Over the World - The future of nuclear power
fields.description: John Key, the prime minister of New Zealand, talks about the earthquake that struck his country in February and the recent disaster in Japan. Plus, Michael Meacher, the UK's former environment minister, discusses the future of nuclear power after the crisis in Japan. And, actress and UNICEF goodwill ambassador Mia Farrow reflects on her recent visit to South Sudan.

fields.title: Inside Story - The impact of disaster on Japan's economy
fields.description: It's two weeks since the magnitude 9.0 earthquake and 10-metre tsunami struck the northeast coast of Japan. Hundreds of thousands of people are still homeless, more than half a million households do not have water, and workers are still battling to gain control of the Fukushima nuclear power plant. Fears of contaminated food are spreading overseas as officials report traces of radiation in milk products, seawater and 11 kinds of locally-grown vegetables. How will Japan recover from the disaster? Will it be able to regain the world's confidence, and how long will it take?

fields.title: Inside Story - Haiti: a nation in trouble
fields.description: On this episode of Inside Story we ask: how will political uncertainty and unrest impact the country's recovery efforts?

fields.title: Inside Story - Drought in the Horn of Africa
fields.description: The Horn of Africa is in the middle of its worst drought in more than 60 years with up to 12 million people facing famine in parts of Ethiopia, Kenya, Djibouti and Somalia. Why is this particular region so vulnerable? Is it the weather or war?

fields.title: Inside Story - Can Morsi break the military's hold on Egypt?
fields.description: Mohamed Morsi, Egypt's president, has only been in power for two months but it would appear he is keen to stamp his authority on Egypt. In a move that surprised the nation, he dismissed Field Marshall Hussein Tantawi, the chief of armed forces, and his number two General Sami Annan. Tantawi had been in the post for more than 20 years. So, is it the beginning of a transition to civilian rule in Egypt? Or is it just the Muslim Brotherhood tightening its grip on the country? And what role will Egypt's wealthy military play in the future?

fields.title: Fault Lines - Horn of Africa Crisis: Drought Zone
fields.description: As world leaders discuss climate policy in Durban, Fault Lines travels through Kenya's drought zone. We ask how US policies intersect with drought and hunger, and how the US is responding to the emergency in the Horn of Africa.

fields.title: Inside Story - Somalia's waiting game
fields.description: Why is aid not reaching those most in need?

fields.title: Inside Story - Pakistan's flood crisis
fields.description: Could the country's devastation have been prevented?

fields.title: Inside Story - Climate of extremes - 4 Oct 09
fields.description: A series of natural disasters simultaneously hit the world soon after scientists said that quakes, volcanic eruptions, giant landslides and tsunamis may become more frequent as global warming changes the earth's crust. Are these geological catastrophes man-made? What should be done to reverse the process? And can politicians restore nature's delicate balance?

fields.title: Inside Story - Pakistan's looming health crisis
fields.description: More than two weeks of floods in Pakistan have left well over 1000 people dead and more than 20 million displaced. And the country is set for more troubled times ahead. The UN has warned that up to 3.5 million children are at risk of contracting water-borne diseases. As many as 300000 people could contract Cholera - a disease that can spread quickly in areas where the water is contaminated. The first case has been reported and a failure to contain the disease could spell further disaster for Pakistan. So just what will it take to avert this and how are relief agencies being hindered by the growing health crisis?

fields.title: People & Power - Haiti: Hope among the rubble
fields.description: What now for Haiti's shattered government and traumatised people? What challenges remain after the aid agencies leave Haiti? Who will take responsibility? In the days following Haiti's earthquake, People & Power's Juliana Ruhfus and Caroline Pare set out to try and answer these questions, focusing their attention on Haiti's own response to the calamity to see whether it contained any seeds of a brighter future.

fields.title: Inside Story - Disaster for Indonesia
fields.description: Indonesia has been hit by yet another tsunami - washing away at least 20 villages and leaving hundreds dead and many more missing. And all this despite an expensive Tsunami early-warning system. As the waves surged towards the coastline, the system failed to work and no warning was given. Indonesia's disaster response agency says the system had been vandalised and was not properly maintained. On this episode of Inside Story, we ask why the system did not work.

fields.title: Inside Story - Tackling problems in Muslim nations
fields.description: An audio message from Osama bin Laden with a softer approach and broader appeal. He calls for establishing a relief body to deal with disasters in Muslim nations. Is it a genuine call or an attempt to gain support among frustrated Pakistanis?

fields.title: Fault Lines - Haiti:The politics of rebuilding
fields.description: english.aljazeera.net Follow us on Twitter: twitter.com Follow us on Facebook: facebook.com Follow us on Tumblr: ajfaultlines.tumblr.com Just weeks after the earthquake that took more than 200000 lives, Avi Lewis finds that debates over how to rebuild Haiti are already underway.

fields.title: Inside Story - Pakistan's devastating floods
fields.description: Paksitan has been hit by the worst floods in living memory. An unprecedented 12 inches of rain fell in just 36 hours. With an estimated one million people crying out for aid and leadership, what are the implications for the country if still more civilians lose faith in the power of their government?

fields.title: Fault Lines - Haiti: Six months on
fields.description: english.aljazeera.net Follow us on Twitter: twitter.com Follow us on Facebook: facebook.com Follow us on Tumblr: ajfaultlines.tumblr.com Six months after the earthquake that killed up to 300000 people, the dust is starting to settle over Port-au-Prince. As it does, the deep wounds that fracture this country are re-emerging, more gaping than even before.

fields.title: The Listening Post - Pakistan's aid shortfall
fields.description: Did you donate any money to Haiti after the earthquake? Have you donated money to Pakistan to help victims of the floods there? A lot of people can answer yes to the first question, but not so many to the second. What was it about these floods that stopped people dipping into their pockets? We have seen wide shots of saturated fields, families trapped on crudely fashioned lifeboats, villagers left homeless, starving and without clean drinking water. But even with all this we have not been nearly as charitable as we were after the earthquake in Haiti.
